src: ER gewährt Weisheit, wem ER will.
ref: He gives wisdom to whomever He wills.
draft: HE grants wisdom to whom HE wants.
hil: HE grants wisdom to whom HE wills.
compare: HE grants wisdom to whom HE wants.

src: Die Entscheidung liegt nur bei Allah. Er legt die Wahrheit dar, und Er ist der beste Richter."
ref: He relates the truth, and He is the Best of deciders.'
draft: "The decision lies only with Allah. He presents the truth, and He is the best judge."
hil: The decision lies only with God. He presents the truth and He is the best judge.
compare: "The decision lies only with Allah. He presents the truth, and He is the best judge."

src: Das ist eine Erinnerung für die, die (Gottes) gedenken.
ref: This is a reminder for those who are observant.
draft: This is a reminder for those who remember (God).
hil: This serves as a reminder for those who remember (God).
compare: This is a reminder for those who remember (God).

src: Also erbärmlich ist die Bleibe der Arroganten."
ref: How grievous a destination for the haughty!
draft: "Also pathetic is the abode of the arrogant."
hil: "Thus, wretched is the abode of the arrogant."
compare: "Thus, wretched is the abode of the arrogant."

src: Und Wir ließen einen Regen auf sie niedergehen; wie böse war der Regen für diejenigen, die gewarnt worden waren!
ref: And rained on them a shower (of Stones). How terrible was the rain (that fell) on those who had been warned!
draft: And We caused a rain [of stones] to descend upon them, and how wretched was the rain of those who had been warned.
hil: And We caused a rain [of stones] to descend upon them, and how wretched was the rain of those who had been warned!
compare: And We caused a rain [of stones] to descend upon them, and how wretched was the rain of those who had been warned.

src: Keineswegs! Beim Mond
ref: I say the truth, and call the moon to witness,
draft: Not at all! On the moon.
hil: No way! On the moon.
compare: Not at all! On the moon.

src: Hast du nicht gesehen, daß Allah Wasser vom Himmel herniedersendet?
ref: Have you not seen that it is Allah Who causes the water to descend from the sky?
draft: Did you not see that Allah sends water down from the sky?
hil: Did you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky?
compare: Did you not see that Allah sends down water from the sky?

src: Dann verbarg er Furcht vor ihnen. Sie sagten: "Fürchte dich nicht!"
ref: (When they did not eat), He conceived a fear of them.
draft: Then he concealed fear from them. They said, "Do not be afraid!"
hil: He concealed fear of them. They said, 'Do not be afraid.'
compare: He concealed fear of them. They said, 'Do not be afraid.'

src: Nennt sie nach ihren Vätern; das ist gerechter vor Allah.
ref: Call them by the names of their fathers. This is the right course in the sight of God.
draft: Call them by [the names of] their fathers; it is more just in the sight of Allah.
hil: Call them by [the names of] their fathers; it is more just in the sight of Allah.
compare: Call them by [the names of] their fathers; it is more just in the sight of Allah.

src: Ich habe ihnen nichts gesagt außer dem, womit DU mich beauftragt hast: Dient ALLAH, meinem HERRN und eurem HERRN. Und ich war Zeuge über sie, solange ich unter ihnen weilte.
ref: I only said to them what Thou didst command me: "Serve God, my Lord and your Lord."
draft: I have told them nothing except what YOU have instructed me to: Serve ALLAH, my Lord and your Lord. And I was a witness over them as long as I dwelled among them.
hil: I have not told them anything except what YOU have instructed me to: Serve ALLAH, my Lord and your Lord. And I was a witness over them as long as I dwelled among them.
compare: I have not told them anything except what YOU have instructed me to: Serve ALLAH, my Lord and your Lord. And I was a witness over them as long as I dwelled among them.

src: Auch wenn ein Koran käme, mit dem die Berge versetzt oder die Erde zerstückelt oder zu den Toten gesprochen werden könnte... Nein, bei der ganzen Angelegenheit hat Gott allein zu entscheiden. Wissen denn diejenigen, die glauben, nicht, daß Gott, wenn Er wollte, die Menschen alle rechtleiten würde? Diejenigen, die ungläubig sind, wird immer eine Katastrophe treffen für das, was sie gemacht haben, oder sie wird in der Nähe ihrer Wohnstätten niedergehen, bis das Versprechen Gottes eintrifft. Und Gott bricht das Versprechen nicht.
ref: And were such a Qur’an to come that would cause the mountains to move, or the earth to split asunder, or the dead to speak, even then these disbelievers would not believe; in fact, all matters are only at Allah’s discretion; so have not the Muslims despaired in that, had Allah willed, He would have guided all mankind? Disasters shall continue to strike the disbelievers on account of their deeds, or descend near their homes until Allah’s promise comes; indeed Allah does not break the promise.
draft: Even if a Quran were to come with which the mountains were moved or the earth was rent in sunder or the dead were made to speak... Nay, in the whole affair the decision rests with God. Do those who believe not know that, had God willed, He would have guided all men aright? As for those who deny the truth, disaster awaits them, or a [violent] storm-wind [which will wreck their boats] will lay waste their homes. This will be so for [the reason that] they were wont to blaspheme against God's messages and to scorn them. And God's will prevails in all the world #ref_2.
hil: Even if a Quran were to come with which the mountains were moved or the earth was rent in sunder or the dead were made to speak... Nay, in the whole affair the decision rests with God. Do those who believe not know that, had God willed, He would have guided all men aright? As for those who deny the truth, disaster awaits them, or a [violent] storm-wind [which will wreck their boats] will lay waste their homes. This will be so for [the reason that] they were wont to blaspheme against God's messages and to scorn them. And God's will prevails in all the world.
compare: Even if a Quran were to come with which the mountains were moved or the earth was rent in sunder or the dead were made to speak... Nay, in the whole affair the decision rests with God. Do those who believe not know that, had God willed, He would have guided all men aright? As for those who deny the truth, disaster awaits them, or a [violent] storm-wind [which will wreck their boats] will lay waste their homes. This will be so for [the reason that] they were wont to blaspheme against God's messages and to scorn them. And God's will prevails in all the world #ref_2.

src: Und (eines Tages) trat er in die Stadt, ohne von ihren Einwohnern bemerkt zu werden, dann fand er zwei Männer, die gegeneinander kämpften, dieser gehörte seiner Partei an und jener war von seinen Feinden, dann bat ihn derjenige, der seiner Partei angehörte, um Hilfe gegen denjenigen, der von seinen Feinden war, dann schlug Musa mit der Faust auf ihn, dann tötete er ihn. Er sagte: "Dies ist vom Werk des Satans, gewiß, er ist ein verleitender, entschiedener Feind."
ref: And he entered the city when its inhabitants were sleeping unaware in the afternoon – he therefore found two men fighting; one was from Moosa’s group, and the other from among his enemies; so the one who was of Moosa’s group pleaded to Moosa for help against him who was of his enemies – therefore Moosa punched him thereby finishing him; he said, “This act was from the devil*; indeed he is an open enemy, a misleader.” (* The act of oppressing the man from Bani Israel).
draft: And (one day) he entered the town without being noticed by its inhabitants, then he found two men fighting against each other, one belonging to his party and the other from his enemies, then the one who belonged to his party asked him for help against the one who was from his enemies, then Musa hit him with his fist, then he killed him. He said, "This is from the work of Satan, surely he is a seducing, determined enemy."
hil: "One day, he entered the town unnoticed by its inhabitants. Then, he found two men fighting against each other, one was from his party and the other was from his enemies. Then, the one from his party asked him for help against the one who was from his enemies. Then Musa struck him with his fist and finished him off. This is of Satan's doing," said him. "Surely, he is a misleading, the work of Satan's doing, decisive enemy."
compare: "One day, he entered the town unnoticed by its inhabitants. Then, he found two men fighting against each other, one was from his party and the other was from his enemies. Then, the one from his party asked him for help against the one who was from his enemies. Then Musa struck him with his fist and finished him off. This is of Satan's doing," said him. "Surely, he is a misleading, the work of Satan's doing, decisive enemy."

src: Da wurden ihre Herzen versiegelt, so daß sie nicht begreifen.
ref: So their hearts were sealed; and now they do not understand.
draft: Their hearts were sealed so that they cannot understand.
hil: Their hearts were sealed so that they would not understand.
compare: Their hearts were sealed so that they would not understand.

src: Dies sind Allahs Zeichen, die Wir dir der Wahrheit entsprechend verlesen. Und du bist wahrlich einer der Gesandten.
ref: These are the messages of God. We recite them to you in all truth, as indeed you are one of the apostles.
draft: These are Allah's signs that We recite to you in truth. And you are certainly one of the messengers.
hil: These are the signs of Allah, which We recite to you in accordance with the truth. And you are indeed one of the messengers.
compare: These are Allah's signs that We recite to you in truth. And you are certainly one of the messengers.

src: Und keiner ist unter euch, der nicht daran vorbeikommen wird das ist eine von deinem Herrn beschlossene Fügung.
ref: There is not one among you who will not reach it. Your Lord has made this incumbent on Himself.
draft: And none of you is there who will not pass by it; this is a decree of your Lord, which must be fulfilled.
hil: And there is none among you who will not pass by it; this is a decree from your Lord which must be fulfilled.
compare: And none of you is there who will not pass by it; this is a decree of your Lord, which must be fulfilled.

src: Viele von den Besitzern des Buches möchten euch, nachdem ihr gläubig geworden seid, gern wieder zu Ungläubigen machen, aus Neid in ihren Seelen, nachdem ihnen die Wahrheit klar gemacht wurde. Doch vergebt und seid nachsichtig, bis Allah Seine Entscheidung ergehen läßt. Wahrlich, Allah hat zu allem die Macht.
ref: Many among People given the Book(s) wished to turn you to disbelief after you had accepted faith; out of hearts’ envy, after the truth has become very clear to them; so leave them and be tolerant, until Allah brings His command; indeed Allah is Able to do all things.
draft: Many of the owners of the book would like to make you unbelievers again out of envy in their souls after the truth has been made clear to them, once you have become believers. But forgive and be patient until Allah makes His decision. Truly, Allah has power over all things.
hil: Many of the people of the book would fain turn you infidels after ye have believed, out of envy from their souls after the truth hath been manifest unto them. But pardon them, and pass over, until Allah sendeth His command. Surely, Allah hath power over all things.
compare: Many of the owners of the book would like to make you unbelievers again out of envy in their souls after the truth has been made clear to them, once you have become believers. But forgive and be patient until Allah makes His decision. Truly, Allah has power over all things.

src: Dir steht es nicht zu, dich darin hochmütig zu verhalten.
ref: You have no right to be insolent here.
draft: "You're not entitled to behave arrogantly about it."
hil: It is not for thee to show pride here!
compare: "You're not entitled to behave arrogantly about it."

src: Und das Herz der Mutter Musas wurde leer.
ref: The mother of Moses was perturbed in the morning.
draft: And the heart of the mother of Musa became empty.
hil: And the heart of Musa's mother became empty.
compare: And the heart of Musa's mother became empty.

src: (Es ist) der durchbohrend helle Stem.
ref: It is the star that shines with a piercing brightness --
draft: (The) piercingly bright stem.
hil: "The piercingly bright stem."
compare: (The) piercingly bright stem.

src: Sie beide unterstanden zwei rechtschaffenen (Dienern) von Unseren Dienern, doch handelten sie verräterisch an ihnen, und so haben ihnen diese vor Allah nichts genützt.
ref: They were under two of Our righteous servants, but they betrayed them.
draft: They both were subordinate to two righteous (servants) of Our Servants, but they acted treacherously towards them, and thus they have been of no avail to them before Allah.
hil: Both of them were under two righteous servants of Our servants, yet they acted treacherously towards them, and so they were of no avail to them before Allah.
compare: They both were subordinate to two righteous (servants) of Our Servants, but they acted treacherously towards them, and thus they have been of no avail to them before Allah.

src: Und die den Tag des Gerichtes für wahr halten,
ref: And those who believe in the Day of Judgement,
draft: And those who believe in the Day of Judgment as true,
hil: Those who hold to the Day of Judgment as true,
compare: And those who believe in the Day of Judgment as true,

src: Habt ihr betrachtet, was euch an Sperma entfließt?
ref: Just consider (the semen) that you emit,
draft: Have you considered what sperm comes out of you?
hil: Have you considered what sperm is flowing out of you?
compare: Have you considered what sperm is flowing out of you?

src: Gewiß, bereits erwies ALLAH den Mumin Gutes, als ER ihnen einen Gesandten schickte, der zu ihnen gehört, der ihnen Seine Ayat vorträgt, sie läutert und ihnen die Schrift und die Weisheit lehrt.
ref: Allah has indeed bestowed a great favour upon the Muslims, in that He sent to them a Noble Messenger (Prophet Mohammed – peace and blessings be upon him) from among them, who recites to them His verses, and purifies them, and teaches them the Book and wisdom; and before it, they were definitely in open error.
draft: Certainly, Allah has already shown goodness to the believers when HE sent them a messenger from among themselves who recites HIS verses to them, purifies them, and teaches them the Book and wisdom.
hil: And surely Allah hath already shown goodness to the believers when He sent among them a messenger from among themselves, reciting to them His revelations, and making them pure, and teaching them the Book and wisdom.
compare: And surely Allah hath already shown goodness to the believers when He sent among them a messenger from among themselves, reciting to them His revelations, and making them pure, and teaching them the Book and wisdom.

src: Wo geht ihr denn hin?
ref: So whither do you stray?
draft: Where are you going?
hil: Where are you going?
compare: Where are you going?

src: Fügt sie sich, so stiftet in Ge rechtigkeit Frieden zwischen ihnen und seid gerecht. Wahrlich, Allah liebt die Gerechten.
ref: And if it does revert, make peace between them with justice, and be equitable for Allah loves the equitable.
draft: If they submit, they will find peace, so let justice prevail between them, and be fair. Truly, Allah loves the just.
hil: Submit yourselves, and reconcile with justice between them, and be fair. Truly, Allah loves the just.
compare: If they submit, they will find peace, so let justice prevail between them, and be fair. Truly, Allah loves the just.

src: So ist die Pein. Doch die Pein des Jenseits ist größer, wenn sie es nur wüßten!
ref: Such is Our chastisement; and the punishment of the Hereafter will be greater, if only they knew!
draft: So is the pain. But the pain of the hereafter is greater, if only they knew it!
hil: Thus is the pain, but the pain of the hereafter is greater, if only they knew it!
compare: Thus is the pain, but the pain of the hereafter is greater, if only they knew it!

src: Gewiß, im Aufeinanderfolgen von Nacht und Tag und was ALLAH in den Himmeln und der Erde erschaffen hat, gibt es sicherlich Ayat für Menschen, die Taqwa gemäß handeln.
ref: In the alternation of night and day, and all that He has created in the heavens and the earth, are certainly signs for people who fear God.
draft: Certainly, in the succession of night and day, and in all that Allah created in the heavens and the earth, there are signs indeed for people who are mindful.
hil: Indeed, in the alternation of night and day, and in all that Allah has created in the heavens and on earth, there are signs for those who act in accordance with Taqwa.
compare: Certainly, in the succession of night and day, and in all that Allah created in the heavens and the earth, there are signs indeed for people who are mindful.

src: Unser HERR umfaßt alles mit Wissen.
ref: Our Lord embraces all things in His knowledge.
draft: "Our LORD encompasses everything with knowledge."
hil: "Our Lord encompasses everything with knowledge."
compare: "Our LORD encompasses everything with knowledge."

src: Dieser ist Der Allwissende über das Verborgene und das Sichtbare, Der Allwürdige, Der Allgnädige.
ref: Such is (He) the knower of the unknown and the known, the mighty and the merciful,
draft: "This is the All-Knowing One about the hidden and the visible, the All-Honorable, the All-Merciful."
hil: "He is the All-Knowing One about the unknown and the known, the Most Honorable, the Most Merciful."
compare: "This is the All-Knowing One about the hidden and the visible, the All-Honorable, the All-Merciful."

src: Das ist etwas von dem, was mich mein Herr gelehrt hat.
ref: This knowledge is one of the things my Lord has taught me.
draft: This is something my master has taught me.
hil: This is part of what my Lord has taught me.
compare: This is something my master has taught me.

src: Gewiß, WIR umhüllten ihre Herzen doch mit Bedeckung, damit sie ihn (den Quran) nicht begreifen, und machten ihre Ohren schwerhörig. Selbst dann, wenn du sie zur Rechtleitung einladen würdest, werden sie nie einer Rechtleitung folgen.
ref: Verily We have placed a covering on their hearts so that they do not understand, and a deafness in their ears so that however you may call them to guidance they will never be guided aright.
draft: Surely, we have covered their hearts with covers, so that they do not understand it (the Quran), and made their ears deaf. Even if you invite them to guidance, they will never follow any guidance.
hil: Assuredly, We have veiled their hearts so that they may not comprehend it (the Quran), and We have made their ears hard of hearing. Even if you invite them to guidance, they will never be guided.
compare: Surely, we have covered their hearts with covers, so that they do not understand it (the Quran), and made their ears deaf. Even if you invite them to guidance, they will never follow any guidance.

src: Er sagte: "Gewiß, ich bin dein Bruder. So sei nicht bekümmert wegen dessen, was sie getan haben."
ref: He said, "I am your brother, so do not feel distressed about whatever they have been doing."
draft: He said: "Surely, I am your brother. So, don't be worried about what they have done."
hil: "Surely," he said, "I am your brother. So don't be worried about what they have done."
compare: "Surely," he said, "I am your brother. So don't be worried about what they have done."

src: (WIR offenbarten dir) wie WIR (den Gesandten) derjenigen Einteilenden hinabsandten,
ref: Like (those) We had sent to those schismatics who slandered their Books
draft: We revealed to you how We sent down (the Messenger) of the ones who divide (the scripture).
hil: We revealed to you how We sent down (the Messenger) of those who divide (the scripture).
compare: We revealed to you how We sent down (the Messenger) of those who divide (the scripture).

src: Immer wieder, wenn ihre Häute gargekocht sein werden, werden WIR sie ihnen gegen andere Häute austauschen, damit sie die Peinigung (richtig) erfahren.
ref: We shall burn them in Fire. As often as their skins are roasted through, We shall change them for other skins that they may taste the punishment.
draft: Again and again, when their skins will have been boiled tender, we will exchange them for other skins so that they may (rightly) experience the punishment.
hil: "Again and again, whenever their skins have been boiled tender, we will exchange them with other skins, so that they can experience the punishment (properly)."
compare: Again and again, when their skins will have been boiled tender, we will exchange them for other skins so that they may (rightly) experience the punishment.

src: Erhebe dich und warne
ref: Arise and warn,
draft: Rise up and warn.
hil: Rise up and warn.
compare: Rise up and warn.

src: Gewiß, ALLAH ist allwissend, allkundig.
ref: Surely God knows and is cognisant.
draft: Certainly, ALLAH is omniscient, all-knowing.
hil: ALLAH is all-knowing, all-wise.
compare: Certainly, ALLAH is omniscient, all-knowing.

src: Allah ist mit den Standhaften."
ref: God is with those who are patient (and persevere)."
draft: "Allah is with the steadfast."
hil: Verily, Allah is with the steadfast.
compare: Verily, Allah is with the steadfast.

src: Aber nein! Wenn ihr es sicher wüßtet!
ref: And yet if you knew with positive knowledge
draft: But no! If you only knew it for sure!
hil: But no! If you only knew it for sure!
compare: But no! If you only knew it for sure!

src: Und sie fragen dich nach den Felsenbergen, dann sag: "Mein HERR wird sie in (kleinste) Teilchen zerkleinern.
ref: They will ask you about the mountains. Tell them: "My Lord will uproot them from the base,
draft: And when they ask you about the mountain rocks, then say, "My LORD will pulverize them into (tiny) particles."
hil: And if they ask you about the mountain rocks, say, "My LORD will crush them into (tiny) particles."
compare: And when they ask you about the mountain rocks, then say, "My LORD will pulverize them into (tiny) particles."

src: Und diejenigen von euch, die abberufen werden und Gattinnen hinterlassen - so sollen diese (mit sich) selbst vier Monate und zehn (Tage) abwarten. Wenn sie dann ihre festgesetzte Zeit erreicht haben, so ist für euch keine Sünde in dem, was sie in rechtlicher Weise mit sich selbst unternehmen. Allah ist dessen, was ihr tut, Kundig.
ref: Wives of men who die among you should wait (after their husbands death) for four months and ten days; and when the term is over there is no sin if they do what they like with themselves honourably, for God is aware of all that you do.
draft: And those of you who are taken away and leave wives behind - they shall wait for themselves four months and ten (days). And when they have reached their appointed time, there is no sin on you for what they do with themselves in a lawful manner. Allah is aware of what you do.
hil: And those of you who are taken away and leave wives behind - they shall wait for themselves four months and ten days. And when they have reached their appointed time, there is no sin on you for what they do with themselves in a lawful manner. Allah is aware of what you do.
compare: And those of you who are taken away and leave wives behind - they shall wait for themselves four months and ten (days). And when they have reached their appointed time, there is no sin on you for what they do with themselves in a lawful manner. Allah is aware of what you do.

src: Behaltet sie aber nicht aus Schadenslust, um Übertretungen zu begehen. Wer dies tut, der hat sich selbst Unrecht getan.
ref: It is transgression to retain them merely for harassment; and whoever' does that indeed wrongs his own self.
draft: Keep them not out of malicious pleasure, to commit transgressions. Whoever does this has done wrong to themselves.
hil: But do not keep them out of malice to commit transgressions. Whoever does this has done wrong to themselves.
compare: But do not keep them out of malice to commit transgressions. Whoever does this has done wrong to themselves.

src: Und diejenigen, die Kufr betrieben haben, sagen: "Würde ihm doch eine Aya von seinem HERRN hinabgesandt!" Sag: "Gewiß ALLAH läßt abirren, wen ER will, und leitet zu Sich denjenigen recht, der sich reumütig besinnt.
ref: And those who disbelieve say: 'Why has no sign been sent down to him by his Lord' Say: 'Allah leads astray whom He will, and guides those who repent,
draft: And those who disbelieved said, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "Indeed, Allah leaves astray whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him] in repentance."
hil: And those who disbelieved said: 'If only a sign from his Lord had been sent down to him!' Say: 'Indeed, Allah leads astray whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him] in repentance.'
compare: And those who disbelieved said, "Why has a sign not been sent down to him from his Lord?" Say, "Indeed, Allah leaves astray whom He wills and guides to Himself whoever turns back [to Him] in repentance."

src: Als er sie nun mit ihrem Bedarf ausgestattet hatte, sagte er: "Bringt mir einen (Halb)bruder von euch väterlicherseits. Seht ihr denn nicht, daß ich volles Maß gebe und daß ich der beste Obdachgeber bin?
ref: And when he provided them with their provisions he said, “Bring your step-brother to me; do you not see that I measure in full and that I am the best host?”
draft: Once he had provided her with her needs, he said, "Bring me a (half)brother of yours on your father's side. Don't you see that I give it my all and that I am the best provider of shelter?".
hil: Once he had provided her with her needs, he said, "Bring me a (half)brother of yours on your father's side. Have you not seen that I have given full measure, and that I am the best of hosts?"
compare: Once he had provided her with her needs, he said, "Bring me a (half)brother of yours on your father's side. Don't you see that I give it my all and that I am the best provider of shelter?".

src: Schlecht ist, was sie erkaufen.
ref: Vile is that wherewith they have bartered.
draft: "Bad is what they buy".
hil: "Bad is what they acquire".
compare: "Bad is what they acquire".

src: Was für eine erfreuliche Belohnung nach dem Diesseits!"
ref: How excellent the recompense of Paradise!
draft: "What a delightful reward after this life!"
hil: What a delightful reward after this life!
compare: What a delightful reward after this life!

src: Und sie sagen: "Der Allerbarmer hat Sich Kinder genommen." Preis sei Ihm!
ref: And they said, “The Most Gracious has chosen a son – Purity is to Him!
draft: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken children to Himself." Praise be to Him!
hil: And they said, "The Most Merciful has taken an offspring for Himself." Purity is to Him! Rather, to Him belongs all that is in the heavens and on earth. All are submissive to Him.
compare: And they say, "The Most Merciful has taken children to Himself." Praise be to Him!

src: Meidet darum den Greuel der Götzen und meidet das Wort der Lüge.
ref: Avoid the repugnance of idols, and false and frivolous talk.
draft: Therefore, avoid the abomination of idols and avoid the word of lies.
hil: Therefore, avoid the abomination of idols and avoid the word of lies.
compare: Therefore, avoid the abomination of idols and avoid the word of lies.

src: Und weshalb speist ihr nicht von dem, worauf ALLAHs Name (beim Schächten) erwähnt wurde, nachdem ER euch deutlich das vorgetragen hat, was ER euch für haram erklärte - außer dem, wozu ihr gezwungen werdet?!
ref: And why should you not eat of that over which the name of God has been pronounced, when He has made it distinctly clear what is forbidden, unless you are constrained to do so.
draft: And why do you not eat from that upon which Allah's name has been mentioned, while He has explained in detail to you what He has forbidden you, excepting that to which you are compelled?
hil: And why do you not eat from that upon which Allah's name has been mentioned, while He has explained in detail to you what He has forbidden you, except for carrion, spilt blood, or pork - for that which is certainly impure - or that which has been killed by strangling, or by a violent blow, or by a headlong fall, or that which has been gored by horns, and that which has been partly eaten by a wild animal - unless you are able to purify it- and that which has been sacrificed on altars'. But whoever is compelled, neither desiring nor transgressing, then surely your Lord is Forgiving, Merciful.'
compare: And why do you not eat from that upon which Allah's name has been mentioned, while He has explained in detail to you what He has forbidden you, excepting that to which you are compelled?

src: Sag: "Egal ob ihr das, was ihr in euren Brüsten tragt, verheimlicht oder offenbart, ALLAH weiß darüber Bescheid, und ER weiß, was in den Himmeln und was auf Erden ist. Und ALLAH ist über alles allmächtig.
ref: Say: "Whether you conceal or reveal whatsoever is in your hearts it is all known to God, as is known to Him all that is in the heavens and the earth; and God has the power over all things."
draft: Say: "Whether you hide or reveal what you carry in your chests, Allah knows about it, and He knows what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. And Allah is over all things competent."
hil: Say: Whether you keep hidden or reveal what you carry in your breasts, Allah knows it well, and He knows what is in the heavens and on the earth. And Allah is all-powerful over everything.
compare: Say: Whether you keep hidden or reveal what you carry in your breasts, Allah knows it well, and He knows what is in the heavens and on the earth. And Allah is all-powerful over everything.

src: Esset von dem, was Allah euch gegeben hat und folgt nicht die Fußstapfen des Satans.
ref: Eat of what Allah has provided for you, and follow not the footsteps of Shaitan (Satan).
draft: Eat from what Allah has given you and do not follow the footsteps of Satan.
hil: Eat from what Allah has given you and do not follow the footsteps of Satan.
compare: Eat from what Allah has given you and do not follow the footsteps of Satan.

src: Wenn ihr leidet, so leiden sie auch, wie ihr leidet; ihr aber erhofft von Gott, was sie nicht erhoffen. Gott weiß Bescheid und ist weise.
ref: If you are suffering, they are also suffering like you, but you expect from Allah what they do not expect, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
draft: If you suffer, they also suffer, as you suffer; but you hope from God what they do not hope for. God knows and is wise.
hil: If you suffer, they suffer as well, as you suffer, but you hope for from God, what they do not hope for. God knows and is wise.
compare: If you suffer, they suffer as well, as you suffer, but you hope for from God, what they do not hope for. God knows and is wise.

src: Und sollte ER dir Gutes bestimmen, so kann niemand Seine Gunst abwenden.
ref: And if He wants good for you, none can repel His grace.
draft: And if HE determines good things for you, no one can turn away His favor.
hil: If HE should determine good for you, no one can turn away His favor.
compare: If HE should determine good for you, no one can turn away His favor.

src: Sie befragen dich über Berauschendes und Glücksspiel. Sprich: "In beiden liegt großes Übel und Nutzen für die Menschen.
ref: They ask you about drinking and gambling.
draft: They ask you about intoxicants and gambling. Say, "In both is great sin and benefit for people.
hil: They ask you about intoxicants and gambling. Say, "In both there is great sin and benefit for people, but their sin is greater than their benefit."
compare: They ask you about intoxicants and gambling. Say, "In both there is great sin and benefit for people, but their sin is greater than their benefit."

src: über den Sieg von ALLAH. ER verhilft zum Sieg, wem ER will.
ref: He helps whomever He wants.
draft: About the victory of Allah. He grants victory to whom He wills.
hil: He helps whom He will, for Allah is all-mighty and ever-merciful.
compare: About the victory of Allah. He grants victory to whom He wills.

src: Sie sagten: "Halte ihn mit seinem Bruder hin, und schicke in die Städte Boten,
ref: They said: "Put him and his brother off (awhile) and send out heralds to the cities
draft: They said, "Keep him waiting with his brother and send messengers to the cities,".
hil: They said, "Keep him waiting with his brother and send messengers to the cities."
compare: They said, "Keep him waiting with his brother and send messengers to the cities,".

src: Du meinst, sie bilden eine Einheit, aber ihre Herzen sind geteilt. Dies, weil sie Leute sind, die keinen Verstand haben.
ref: Their valour is great, among themselves; you think of them as a host; but their hearts are scattered; that is because they are a people who have no sense.
draft: You mean they form a unity, but their hearts are divided. This is because they are people who lack intelligence.
hil: You think they form a unity, but their hearts are divided. This is because they are people who lack intelligence.
compare: You mean they form a unity, but their hearts are divided. This is because they are people who lack intelligence.

src: Am Tag, da Wir mit der größten Gewalt zupacken werden, gewiß, da werden Wir Vergeltung üben.
ref: The day that We shall seize them with a grievous hold, We will indeed castigate them.
draft: On the day when we will strike with the greatest force, indeed, then we will exact revenge.
hil: On the day when we seize with the greatest force, surely we will exact retribution.
compare: On the day when we will strike with the greatest force, indeed, then we will exact revenge.

src: Und ihr seid die Überlegenen!
ref: You shall prevail.
draft: And you are the superior ones!
hil: And you are the superior ones!
compare: And you are the superior ones!

src: Frag die Kinder Israels, wie viele deutliche Zeichen Wir ihnen zukommen ließen. Wenn aber einer die Gnade Gottes eintauscht, nachdem sie zu ihm gekommen ist, so verhängt Gott eine harte Strafe.
ref: Ask the Descendants of Israel how many clear signs We gave them; and whoever alters Allah’s favour which came to him, then indeed Allah’s punishment is severe.
draft: Ask the Children of Israel how many clear signs We have sent them. But whoever exchanges the grace of God after it has come to him - indeed, God is severe in penalty.
hil: Ask the Children of Israel how many clear signs We have sent them. But whoever exchanges the grace of God after it has come to him - indeed, God is severe in penalty.
compare: Ask the Children of Israel how many clear signs We have sent them. But whoever exchanges the grace of God after it has come to him - indeed, God is severe in penalty.

src: Gewiß, WIR sind es, Der belebt und sterben läßt, und zu Uns ist das Werden,
ref: We are the one who give life and death, and to Us will be the destination.
draft: Certainly, WE are the one who gives life and death, and to Us is the becoming.
hil: Indeed, it is WE who give life and cause death, and to Us is the return.
compare: Indeed, it is WE who give life and cause death, and to Us is the return.

src: Da schmetterte ihr Herr sie für ihre Sünde nieder, und so ebnete Er über ihnen die Erde ein.
ref: So God obliterated them for their crime, and (destroyed) all of them alike.
draft: "Thus her Lord smote her down for her sin and leveled the earth above her"
hil: "Thus her Lord struck her down for her sin, and so He leveled the Earth above them."
compare: "Thus her Lord struck her down for her sin, and so He leveled the Earth above them."

src: Da brachen aus ihm zwölf Quellen hervor, so daß jede Menschengruppe wußte, wo ihre Trinkstelle war. - «Eßt und trinkt von dem, was Gott beschert hat, und verbreitet nicht Unheil auf der Erde.»
ref: 'Eat and drink of God's providing, and mischief not in the earth, doing corruption.'
draft: "Twelve springs burst from him, so that every group of people knew where their drinking spot was. - "Eat and drink from what God has provided, and do not spread mischief on earth."
hil: From him broke forth twelve springs, so that every group of people knew where their drinking spot was. 'Eat and drink from what God has provided, and do not spread mischief on earth.'
compare: "Twelve springs burst from him, so that every group of people knew where their drinking spot was. - "Eat and drink from what God has provided, and do not spread mischief on earth."

src: Und wenn du sie fragst, wer Wasser vom Himmel herabkommen läßt und die Erde damit nach ihrem Absterben belebt, sagen sie bestimmt: «Gott.» Sprich: Lob sei Gott!
ref: And if you asked them, "Who sends down rain from the sky and gives life thereby to the earth after its lifelessness?" they would surely say " Allah."
draft: And if you ask them who causes water to come down from the sky and thereby revives the earth after its death, they will definitely say "God". Say: Praise be to God!
hil: If you ask them who causes water to come down from the sky and thereby revives the earth after its death, they will certainly say 'God'. Say: Praise be to God!
compare: And if you ask them who causes water to come down from the sky and thereby revives the earth after its death, they will definitely say "God". Say: Praise be to God!

src: Und übereile dich nicht mit dem Koran, bevor er dir zu Ende offenbart worden ist.
ref: And be not in haste (O Muhammad SAW) with the Quran before its revelation is completed to you, and say: "My Lord!
draft: And do not hurry with the Quran before it has been completely revealed to you.
hil: Do not try to anticipate the Quran before the completion of its revelation, but pray, 'My Lord, increase me in knowledge.'
compare: Do not try to anticipate the Quran before the completion of its revelation, but pray, 'My Lord, increase me in knowledge.'

src: Gewiß, ALLAH wird die Nifaq- und die Kufr-Betreibenden in Dschahannam versammeln, allesamt.
ref: Indeed God will put the hypocrites and infidels together in Hell.
draft: Certainly, ALLAH will gather the hypocrites and the disbelievers in Jahannam, all of them.
hil: Certainly, ALLAH will gather together the hypocrites and the disbelievers in Jahannam, all of them.
compare: Certainly, ALLAH will gather together the hypocrites and the disbelievers in Jahannam, all of them.

src: Wenn Gott für mich Schaden will, können sie denn seinen Schaden beheben?
ref: If God willed any harm for me, can they lift His harm?
draft: If God wants to harm me, can they repair his damage?
hil: If God wants to harm me, can they repair his damage?
compare: If God wants to harm me, can they repair his damage?

src: Nein, es ist schlechter für sie. Am Tag der Auferstehung wird ihnen das, womit sie gegeizt haben, als Halskette umgelegt werden.
ref: In fact, it is worse; for what they grudged will be hung around their necks on the Day of Resurrection.
draft: No, it is worse for them. On the Day of Resurrection, what they have hoarded will be put around their necks as a necklace.
hil: No, it is worse for them. On the Day of Resurrection, what they have hoarded will be put around their necks as a necklace.
compare: No, it is worse for them. On the Day of Resurrection, what they have hoarded will be put around their necks as a necklace.

src: Und ihr werdet befragt werden.
ref: You will surely be questioned about it.
draft: And you will be questioned.
hil: And you will be questioned.
compare: And you will be questioned.

src: Unser Herr umfaßt alle Dinge in seinem Wissen. Auf Gott vertrauen wir.
ref: For our Lord has embraced everything with knowledge, and in Allah we have put our trust.
draft: Our Lord encompasses all things in His knowledge. We trust in God.
hil: Our Lord encompasses all things in His knowledge. We rely on God.
compare: Our Lord encompasses all things in His knowledge. We trust in God.

src: Und führe ihnen als Gleichnis zwei Männer an.
ref: Tell them the parable of two men.
draft: And present to them as a parable two men.
hil: "And present to them as a parable two men."
compare: And present to them as a parable two men.

src: Diese sind wie die An'am, nein, sondern sie sind noch abirrender! Diese sind die wirklichen Achtlosen.
ref: They are people unconcerned.
draft: These are like the An'am, no, but they are even more astray! These are the real heedless ones.
hil: They are like the An'am, no, but they are even more astray! These are the real heedless ones.
compare: They are like the An'am, no, but they are even more astray! These are the real heedless ones.

src: "Mein Söhnchen! Sollte es sich auch nur um das Gewicht eines Senfkorns handeln, das sich in einem Stein, in den Himmeln oder auf Erden befinden sollte, ALLAH bringt sie.
ref: "O my son, whatsoever it may be, even though equal to a mustard seed in weight, or within a rock or in the sky or in the earth, God will bring it forth.
draft: "My little son! Even if it should only be the weight of a mustard seed, which should be in a stone, in the heavens or on Earth, ALLAH will bring them."
hil: My son! If it be (anything) equal to the weight of a mustard-seed, and though it be in a rock, or in the heavens, or in the earth, Allah will bring it forth. Verily, Allah is Subtle (in bringing out that grain), Aware (of its place).
compare: My son! If it be (anything) equal to the weight of a mustard-seed, and though it be in a rock, or in the heavens, or in the earth, Allah will bring it forth. Verily, Allah is Subtle (in bringing out that grain), Aware (of its place).

src: Sie werden aber (seiner) nicht gedenken, außer daß Allah es will.
ref: And what advice will they heed, except if Allah wills?
draft: They will not remember him except if Allah wills it.
hil: They will, however, not remember him unless Allah wills it.
compare: They will not remember him except if Allah wills it.

src: Und WIR haben dir die Schrift mit der Wahrheit hinabgesandt als Bestätigung dessen, was ihr von der Schrift voranging, und als Hüter über sie.
ref: And to you We have revealed the Book containing the truth, confirming the earlier revelations, and preserving them (from change and corruption).
draft: And WE have revealed to you the scripture with the truth confirming what was before it of the scripture and as a guardian over it.
hil: And We have revealed to you the scripture with the truth, confirming what preceded it of the scripture and as a guardian over it.
compare: And WE have revealed to you the scripture with the truth confirming what was before it of the scripture and as a guardian over it.

src: Und sollten sie dem Salam zugeneigt sein, dann sei ihm ebenfalls zugeneigt und übe ALLAH gegenüber Tawakkul!
ref: But if they incline to peace, you also incline to it, and (put your) trust in Allah.
draft: And if you are inclined towards peace, then incline towards it as well and practice Tawakkul towards Allah!
hil: Those who are inclined towards peace, be similarly inclined towards them and put your trust in Allah!
compare: Those who are inclined towards peace, be similarly inclined towards them and put your trust in Allah!

src: Und erzähle von der Gnade deines Herrn.
ref: And keep recounting the favours of your Lord.
draft: And speak of the grace of your Lord.
hil: And speak of the grace of your Lord.
compare: And speak of the grace of your Lord.

src: Und jedes Volk hat einen, der es rechtleitet.
ref: You are only a warner, and every people has its guide.
draft: And every nation has one who guides it.
hil: And every nation has one who guides it.
compare: And every nation has one who guides it.

src: Und Saatfelder und eine treffliche Stätte,
ref: And fields and stately mansions,
draft: And seed fields and an excellent place.
hil: And seed fields and an excellent place.
compare: And seed fields and an excellent place.

src: Danach werdet ihr zu eurem Herrn heimkehren; und Er wird euch verkünden, was ihr zu tun pflegtet. Wahrlich, Er weiß wohl, was in den Herzen ist.
ref: You will return to your Lord in the end and He will declare to you what you have done: He knows well what is in the hearts of men.
draft: Then you will return to your Lord, and He will announce to you what you used to do. Indeed, He is Knowing of that is within the breasts.
hil: Then you will be sent back to Him who knows the unknown and the known, and He will inform you of what you used to do. Indeed, He is All-Knowing of what is within the hearts.
compare: Then you will return to your Lord, and He will announce to you what you used to do. Indeed, He is Knowing of that is within the breasts.

src: Dann ließen Wir Unsere Gesandten ihren Spuren folgen; und Wir ließen (ihnen) Jesus, den Sohn der Maria, folgen, und Wir gaben ihm das Evangelium. Und in die Herzen derer, die ihm folgten, legten Wir Güte und Barmherzigkeit.
ref: Thereafter in their footsteps We caused Our apostles to follow, and We caused lsa, son Of Maryam, to follow them, and We vouchsafed Unto him the Injil, and We placed In the hearts of those who followed him tenderness and mercy.
draft: Then We caused Our messengers to follow in their footsteps; and We caused Jesus, the son of Mary, to follow them, and We gave him the Gospel. And We placed in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy.
hil: Thus, We followed Our messengers in their footsteps; and We let Jesus, the son of Mary, follow them, and We gave him the Gospel. And We placed kindness and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him.
compare: Then We caused Our messengers to follow in their footsteps; and We caused Jesus, the son of Mary, to follow them, and We gave him the Gospel. And We placed in the hearts of those who followed him compassion and mercy.

src: Gewiß, Pharao erhob sich in Arroganz im Lande und machte dessen Bewohner zu Parteien.
ref: Pharaoh exalted himself in the land, and divided its people into factions.
draft: Surely, Pharaoh rose in arrogance in the land and made its inhabitants into factions.
hil: Certainly, Pharaoh showed arrogance in the land and divided its inhabitants into factions.
compare: Surely, Pharaoh rose in arrogance in the land and made its inhabitants into factions.

src: - Am Tag, da die Erde, sie freilassend, sich ihnen aufspalten wird und sie eilig (hervorkommen).
ref: The day the earth will split asunder they will come out hurriedly.
draft: On the day when the Earth will split open and they will rush out (hastily) as if they were a [great] swarm of locusts, [Quran 54:7].
hil: On the day when the earth will split open, releasing them hastily as they come forth.
compare: On the day when the Earth will split open and they will rush out (hastily) as if they were a [great] swarm of locusts, [Quran 54:7].

src: Dann tut Er ihnen am Tag der Auferstehung kund, was sie getan haben.
ref: And on the Day of Judgement He will announce their deeds to them.
draft: Then on the Day of Resurrection, He will declare to them what they have done.
hil: Then on the Day of Resurrection, He will declare to them what they have done.
compare: Then on the Day of Resurrection, He will declare to them what they have done.

src: Er (Zakariyya) sagte: "Mein Herr, setze mir ein Zeichen." Er sagte: "Dein Zeichen ist, daß du drei Tage lang nicht zu den Menschen sprechen wirst außer durch Gebärden. Und gedenke deines Herrn häufig und preise (Ihn) am Abend und am frühen Morgen!"
ref: He said: 'Lord, appoint for me a sign' He said: 'Your sign is that you shall not speak to people except by signs for three days' And remember your Lord abundantly, exalt Him in the evening and at the dawn'
draft: He (Zakariya) said: "My Lord, give me a sign." He said: "Your sign is that you shall not speak with mankind for three consecutive days, except by gestures. And remember your Lord often and praise (Him) in the evening and early morning!"
hil: He (Zakariya) said, 'My Lord, give me a sign.' He said, 'Your sign is that you shall not speak with mankind for three consecutive days, except by gestures. And remember your Lord often and glorify Him in the evening and early morning!
compare: He (Zakariya) said: "My Lord, give me a sign." He said: "Your sign is that you shall not speak with mankind for three consecutive days, except by gestures. And remember your Lord often and praise (Him) in the evening and early morning!"

src: Und Salomo (machten Wir) den Wind (dienstbar), der in seinem Auftrage in das Land blies, das Wir gesegnet hatten.
ref: We made tempestuous winds obedient to Solomon which blew swiftly to sail at his bidding (with his ships) to the land We had blessed.
draft: And Solomon (made us) the wind (serviceable), which blew in his command to the land that we had blessed.
hil: And We made the wind subservient to Solomon, blowing towards the land which We had blessed at his bidding.
compare: And We made the wind subservient to Solomon, blowing towards the land which We had blessed at his bidding.

src: Meine Macht hat mich verlassen."
ref: Vanished has my power from me."
draft: "My power has left me."
hil: My power has deserted me.
compare: My power has deserted me.

src: Und subhanallah, Der HERR aller Schöpfung.
ref: Praised be God, the Lord of all the worlds.
draft: And subhanallah, the LORD of all creation.
hil: "And subhanallah, the Lord of all creation."
compare: And subhanallah, the LORD of all creation.

src: Dann sagten WIR: "Adam!
ref: Then We said: "O Adam!
draft: Then WE said, "Adam!"
hil: Then WE said, 'Adam!'
compare: Then WE said, "Adam!"

src: Sag: "ALLAH leitet die Erschaffung ein, dann wiederholt ER sie!"
ref: Say: "It is God alone who first creates and then reverts it.
draft: Say: "ALLAH initiates creation, then repeats it!"
hil: Say, 'Allah initiates creation, then repeats it!'
compare: Say: "ALLAH initiates creation, then repeats it!"

src: Und in die Herzen derer, die ihm folgten, legten Wir Güte und Barmherzigkeit.
ref: And We set in the hearts of those who followed him tenderness and mercy.
draft: And in the hearts of those who followed him, we laid kindness and mercy.
hil: And We placed kindness and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him.
compare: And We placed kindness and mercy in the hearts of those who followed him.

src: Und (mir wurde befohlen): "Richte dein Antlitz auf die einzig wahre Religion, und sei nicht einer der Götzendiener.
ref: And to set my face toward the way, as one upright, and not be one of those who associate others with God.
draft: And (I was commanded): "Direct your face towards the only true religion, and do not be one of the idolaters."
hil: And (I was commanded): "Direct your face towards the only true religion, and do not be one of the idolaters."
compare: And (I was commanded): "Direct your face towards the only true religion, and do not be one of the idolaters."

src: Mose sagte zu ihm: «Darf ich dir folgen, auf daß du mich von dem lehrst, was du über den rechten Weg belehrt worden bist?»
ref: Moses said to him: "May I attend upon you that you may instruct me in the knowledge you have been taught of the right way?"
draft: Moses said to him: "May I follow you, so that you may teach me what you have been taught about the right way?"
hil: "Moses said to him: “May I follow you, so that you may teach me what you have been taught about the right way?”"
compare: Moses said to him: "May I follow you, so that you may teach me what you have been taught about the right way?"

src: Dann haben Wir das Zeichen der Nacht ausgelöscht und das Zeichen des Tages hell gemacht, damit ihr nach Huld von eurem Herrn trachtet und damit ihr die Zahl der Jahre und die (Zeit)rechnung wißt. Und alles haben Wir ganz ausführlich dargelegt.
ref: Then We make dark the portent of the night, and We make the portent of the day sight-giving, that ye may seek bounty from your Lord, and that ye may know the computation of the years, and the reckoning; and everything have We expounded with a clear expounding.
draft: Then We erased the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible, so that you may seek bounty from your Lord, and that you may know the count of the years, and the calculation (of time). And everything We have explained in detail.
hil: Then We erased the sign of the night and illuminated the sign of the day, so that you may seek favor from your Lord, and that you may know the count of the years and the calculation of time. And We have explained everything in detail.
compare: Then We erased the sign of the night and made the sign of the day visible, so that you may seek bounty from your Lord, and that you may know the count of the years, and the calculation (of time). And everything We have explained in detail.

src: Also Niedergang ist für diejenigen, die Unrecht begingen, bei der Peinigung eines qualvollen Tages bestimmt.
ref: Woe alas to the sinners for the torment of the grievous Day!
draft: Also downfall is determined for those who committed injustice on the day of torment of a painful day.
hil: "So downfall is determined for those who have committed injustice on the day of torment of an excruciating day."
compare: "So downfall is determined for those who have committed injustice on the day of torment of an excruciating day."

src: Hat er Brüder, so steht seiner Mutter ein Sechstel zu. (Dies gilt) nach Berücksichtigung eines Testamentes, das er etwa gemacht hat, oder einer (bestehenden) Schuld. - Eure Väter und eure Söhne: Ihr wißt nicht, wer von ihnen euch im Nutzen nähersteht. - (Dies ist) eine Pflicht von seiten Gottes.
ref: Your fathers and your sons -- you know not which out of them is nearer in profit to you.
draft: If he has brothers, his mother is entitled to one sixth. (This applies) after taking into account a testament he may have made or an (existing) debt. - Your fathers and your sons: you do not know who of them is closer to you in benefit. - (This is) an obligation from God's side.
hil: If he has siblings, then his mother is entitled to one sixth. This applies after taking into account a possible testament he may have made or an (existing) debt. Your parents and your children: you do not know who of them is closer to you in terms of benefit. This is an obligation from God.
compare: If he has siblings, then his mother is entitled to one sixth. This applies after taking into account a possible testament he may have made or an (existing) debt. Your parents and your children: you do not know who of them is closer to you in terms of benefit. This is an obligation from God.

src: Dachten die Menschen etwa, daß sie in Ruhe gelassen werden, zu sagen: "Wir verinnerlichten den Iman", ohne daß sie einer Fitna unterzogen werden?!
ref: Do men think they will get away by saying: "We believe," and will not be tried?
draft: Did people really think that they would be left alone to say, "We internalized the imam," without being subjected to a Fitna?!
hil: Did people really think they would be left alone to say, 'We internalized the imam' without being subjected to a Fitna?
compare: Did people really think they would be left alone to say, 'We internalized the imam' without being subjected to a Fitna?

src: O die ihr glaubt, entweiht nicht die Kultzeichen Allahs, noch den Schutzmonat, noch die Opfertiere, noch die Halsgehänge, noch die, die das geschützte Haus aufsuchen, indem sie nach Huld von ihrem Herrn trachten und nach Wohlgefallen. - Wenn ihr den Weihezustand abgelegt habt, dann dürft ihr jagen. - Und der Haß, den ihr gegen (bestimmte) Leute hegt, weil sie euch von der geschützten Gebetsstätte abgehalten haben, soll euch ja nicht dazu bringen zu übertreten.
ref: O you who believe, do not violate the (sanctity of) offerings to God, nor the rites of the holy month, nor sacrificial cattle with garlands (that are brought to the Ka'bah), nor of the people who flock to the Holy House seeking the bounties of their Lord, and His pleasure. Hunt when you have laid aside the robe of the pilgrim.
draft: O you who believe, defile not the offerings of your Lord, nor any sacred month, nor the animals brought for sacrifice, nor the garlands that mark them, nor the people toiling to and from the Sacred House. Seeking grace from their Lord and pleasure. But when you lay aside the offerings at the close of the sacred months, if any of you is ill or on a journey, let him then fast a similar number of days later. For those who are able by no means is it a hardship. And those who cannot, they will feed a poor man. And those who do good and And when you travel through the land, there is no blame on you if you shorten your prayers, if you fear Us may intend some mischief against you, for the unbelievers are manifest enemies unto you.
hil: "O you who believe, do not defile the signs of Allah, nor the Sacred Month, nor the offerings, nor the garlands, nor those repairing to the Sacred House, seeking grace and good pleasure from their Lord. But when you have finished the state of consecration, then you may hunt. And do not let the hatred you have for certain people make you exceed the limits. Do not transgress; Allah does not love the transgressors."
compare: "O you who believe, do not defile the signs of Allah, nor the Sacred Month, nor the offerings, nor the garlands, nor those repairing to the Sacred House, seeking grace and good pleasure from their Lord. But when you have finished the state of consecration, then you may hunt. And do not let the hatred you have for certain people make you exceed the limits. Do not transgress; Allah does not love the transgressors."

src: Das ist die Huld Gottes. Und Gott genügt als der, der Bescheid weiß.
ref: This is a favour from God; and sufficient is God, the all-knowing.
draft: "This is the grace of God. And God suffices as the one who knows best."
hil: "This is the grace of God. And none knows best but He."
compare: "This is the grace of God. And none knows best but He."

src: Sag: "Sollen wir euch eine Mitteilung über die Erfolglosesten beim Handeln machen?!"
ref: Say: "Shall I tell you whose labour will be wasted?
draft: Say: "Should we give you a report on the most unsuccessful traders?!"
hil: Say: 'Should we give you a report on the least successful traders?!'
compare: Say: 'Should we give you a report on the least successful traders?!'

src: Doch ALLAH leitet recht, wen ER will.
ref: Allah guides whom He will.
draft: But ALLAH guides the right, whom HE wills.
hil: Indeed, Allah guides whom He wills to the straight path.
compare: Indeed, Allah guides whom He wills to the straight path.

src: Gewiß, ALLAH bleibt nichts verborgen, weder auf Erden noch im Himmel.
ref: There is nothing in the earth and the heavens that is hidden from God.
draft: Definitely, Allah leaves nothing hidden, neither on earth nor in heaven.
hil: Verily, Allah does not leave anything hidden, neither on earth nor in the heavens.
compare: Definitely, Allah leaves nothing hidden, neither on earth nor in heaven.

src: Euch werden weder eure Verwandten noch eure Kinder nützen. Am Tag der Auferstehung richtet ALLAH unter euch. Und ALLAH ist dessen, was ihr tut, allsehend.
ref: Neither your relations nor your offspring will in the least benefit you, on the Day of Resurrection; He will separate you from them; and Allah is seeing your deeds.
draft: You will not benefit from your relatives or your children. On the Day of Resurrection, Allah will judge among you. And Allah is Seeing of what you do.
hil: Your relatives or your children will not benefit you. On the Day of Resurrection, Allah judges among you. And Allah sees all that you do.
compare: Your relatives or your children will not benefit you. On the Day of Resurrection, Allah judges among you. And Allah sees all that you do.

src: Und dein HERR ist Der Allvergebende, mit der Allgnade. Würde ER sie belangen für das, was sie sich erworben haben, hätte ER ihnen die Peinigung beschleunigt. Nein, sondern für sie ist ein Termin bestimmt, vor dem sie keine Zuflucht finden werden.
ref: And your Lord is the Oft Forgiver, the Merciful; if He seized them for their deeds, He would soon send the punishment upon them; but for them is an appointed time from which they will not find any refuge.
draft: And your LORD is The Most Forgiving, with The All-Grace. If HE were to take them to task for what they have acquired, HE would have hastened the punishment for them. No, but there is a appointed time for them before which they will find no refuge.
hil: And your LORD is The Most Forgiving, with The All-Grace. If HE were to take them to task for what they have acquired, HE would have hastened the punishment for them. No, but there is a appointed time for them before which they will find no refuge.
compare: And your LORD is The Most Forgiving, with The All-Grace. If HE were to take them to task for what they have acquired, HE would have hastened the punishment for them. No, but there is a appointed time for them before which they will find no refuge.

src: Aber sie schnitten ihr die Sehnen durch. Da sagte er: "Genießt (euer Leben) in eurer Wohnstätte noch drei Tage lang.
ref: But they hamstrung her, and so He said, “Enjoy yourselves in your homes for three days.
draft: But they cut her tendons. Then he said, "Enjoy (your life) in your dwelling for three more days."
hil: But they cut her tendons. Then he said, "Enjoy (your life) in your dwelling for three more days."
compare: But they cut her tendons. Then he said, "Enjoy (your life) in your dwelling for three more days."

src: Wenn ihr sie anruft, hören sie euer Bittgebet nicht, und wenn sie (es) auch hörten, würden sie euch doch nicht erhören. Und am Tag der Auferstehung verleugnen sie, daß ihr (sie Allah) beigesellt habt. Keiner kann dir kundtun wie Einer, der Kenntnis von allem hat.
ref: If you call them, they do not hear your call; and supposedly if they heard it, they cannot fulfil your needs; and on the Day of Resurrection they will deny your ascribed partnership; and none will inform you like Him Who informs.
draft: If you call them, they do not hear your supplication prayer, and even if they were to hear it, they would not answer you. And on the Day of Resurrection, they deny that you have associated them with Allah. No one can inform you like One who has knowledge of everything.
hil: If you call them, they don't hear your supplication prayer, and even if they were to hear it, they wouldn't answer you. And on the Day of Resurrection, they deny that you have associated them with God. No one can inform you like One who has knowledge of everything.
compare: If you call them, they do not hear your supplication prayer, and even if they were to hear it, they would not answer you. And on the Day of Resurrection, they deny that you have associated them with Allah. No one can inform you like One who has knowledge of everything.

src: ER ist Der absolut Autarke!
ref: He is Rich (Free of all wants).
draft: He is the absolutely self-sufficient!
hil: He is the Perfectly Self-Sufficient, (not needing anything)!
compare: He is the Perfectly Self-Sufficient, (not needing anything)!

src: O mein Volk, erfleht Vergebung von eurem Herrn, dann bekehrt euch reumütig zu Ihm; Er wird (den Segen) in reichlicher Weise vom Himmel über euch schicken und wird euch Kraft zu eurer Kraft hinzugeben. So wendet euch nicht als Schuldige ab."
ref: “And O my people! Seek forgiveness from your Lord, then incline towards Him in repentance – He will send abundant rain from the sky upon you and will give you much more strength than you have – and do not turn away committing crimes!”
draft: O my people, seek forgiveness from your Lord and then repent to Him in submission; He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in showers and increase you in strength [added] to your strength. But do not turn away as criminals."
hil: O my people, seek forgiveness from your Lord and then repent to Him in submission; He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in showers and increase you in strength [added] to your strength. So do not turn away as guilty ones.
compare: O my people, seek forgiveness from your Lord and then repent to Him in submission; He will send [rain from] the sky upon you in showers and increase you in strength [added] to your strength. But do not turn away as criminals."

src: Und wir erwarten für euch, daß ALLAH euch mit einer Peinigung trifft entweder (direkt) von Sich oder durch uns.
ref: Yet what we are waiting for you is the punishment of God, direct or through us.
draft: And we expect for you that ALLAH will punish you either (directly) from Himself or through us.
hil: We expect that Allah will inflict punishment upon you either directly from Himself or through us.
compare: We expect that Allah will inflict punishment upon you either directly from Himself or through us.

src: Diejenige, in deren Haus er war, suchte ihn dann gegen seine Neigung zu verführen.
ref: Now the woman in whose house he was solicited him, and closed the doors on them.
draft: The one in whose house he was, then tried to seduce him against his will.
hil: The one in whose house he was, then tried to seduce him against his will.
compare: The one in whose house he was, then tried to seduce him against his will.

src: über diese Welt und das Jenseits. Sie befragen dich über die Waisen.
ref: (Their bearings) on this life and the Hereafter.
draft: "about this world and the afterlife. They ask you about the orphans."
hil: They ask you about this world and the afterlife. Say, "In both there is great sin and benefit for people, but their sin is greater than their benefit." And they ask you about the orphans. Say, "The excess." Thus does Allah make clear to you the verses [of revelation] that you might give thought.
compare: "about this world and the afterlife. They ask you about the orphans."

src: Ihre Angelegenheit steht (allein) bei Allah. Hierauf wird Er ihnen kundtun, was sie zu tun pflegten.
ref: Their case rests with God; then He will inform them of what they used to do.
draft: Your matter rests solely with Allah. He will then inform them of what they used to do.
hil: Your affair is solely with Allah. He will then inform them of what they used to do.
compare: Your matter rests solely with Allah. He will then inform them of what they used to do.

src: Warum verbietest du das, was Allah dir erlaubt hat, um nach der Zufriedenheit deiner Frauen zu trachten?
ref: Why do you ban (for yourself) that which Allah has made lawful to you, seeking to please your wives?
draft: Why do you forbid what Allah has allowed you, in order to seek the satisfaction of your women?
hil: Why do you forbid what Allah has allowed you, in order to seek the satisfaction of your women?
compare: Why do you forbid what Allah has allowed you, in order to seek the satisfaction of your women?

src: (Das sind) diejenigen, die zu ihren Brüdern sagten, während sie daheim blieben: "Hätten sie uns gehorcht, wären sie nicht erschlagen worden."
ref: who said of their brothers (and they themselves held back), 'Had they obeyed us, they would not have been slain.'
draft: (Those are) the ones who said to their brothers while staying at home: "If they had listened to us, they would not have been slain."
hil: Those are the ones who said to their brothers while staying at home, 'If they had listened to us, they would not have been slain.'
compare: (Those are) the ones who said to their brothers while staying at home: "If they had listened to us, they would not have been slain."

src: damit ihr euch auf ihren Rücken/Decks zurechtsetzt, dann euch an die Wohltat eures HERRN erinnert, wenn ihr euch darauf zurechtgesetzt habt, und sagt: "subhanal-ladhi sach-chara lana hadha wama kunna lahu muqrinin
ref: So that when you sit astride of them and think of the bounties of your Lord, you may say: "All glory to Him who subjugated these for us. We were incapable of doing so.
draft: So that you can settle yourselves on their backs/decks, then remember the favor of your Lord when you have settled on them, and say: "Glory be to Him who has subjected this to us, and we could not have it under our control".
hil: So that you settle yourselves on their backs/decks, then remember the favor of your Lord when you have settled on them, and say: "Glory be to Him who has subjected this to us, and we could not have it under our control."
compare: So that you can settle yourselves on their backs/decks, then remember the favor of your Lord when you have settled on them, and say: "Glory be to Him who has subjected this to us, and we could not have it under our control".

src: ER ließ beide Meere aufeinandertreffen,
ref: He has set two seas in motion that flow side by side together,
draft: He caused both seas to meet each other.
hil: He caused both seas to meet each other.
compare: He caused both seas to meet each other.

src: Sind sie dir dann aber ungehorsam, so sprich: "lch bin schuldlos an dem, was ihr tut."
ref: If they do not obey you, tell them: "I am not responsible for what you do."
draft: If they are disobedient to you, then say, "I am innocent of what you do."
hil: If they are disobedient to you, then say, 'I am innocent of what you do.'
compare: If they are disobedient to you, then say, 'I am innocent of what you do.'

src: Und (auch) mit denen, die sagen: "Wir sind Christen'" haben Wir ihr Abkommen getroffen. Aber dann vergaßen sie einen Teil von dem, womit sie ermahnt worden waren.
ref: And with those who say 'We are Christians' We took compact; and they have forgotten a portion of that they were reminded of.
draft: And (also) with those who say, "We are Christians," we have made their covenant. But then they forgot a part of what they were admonished.
hil: And (also) with those who say, 'We are Christians,' we have made their covenant. But then they forgot some of what they were reminded of.
compare: And (also) with those who say, 'We are Christians,' we have made their covenant. But then they forgot some of what they were reminded of.

src: Und sie können es nicht vereiteln.
ref: They cannot get the better (of Us).
draft: And they cannot thwart it.
hil: And they cannot thwart it.
compare: And they cannot thwart it.

src: Du bist ja der Steinigung würdig.
ref: [Tafsir At-Tabari]
draft: You are worthy of stoning.
hil: You are indeed deserving of stoning.
compare: You are indeed deserving of stoning.

src: Gibt es denn einen (anderen) Gott neben Allah? Nein!
ref: Is there another god with God?
draft: Is there any (other) god beside Allah? No!
hil: Is there any other god beside Allah? No!
compare: Is there any other god beside Allah? No!

src: "Wurde den Kafir vergolten, was sie zu machen pflegten?"
ref: Will not the infidels pay for what they had done?
draft: "Did the infidels get what they used to do paid back?"
hil: Did the infidels receive retribution for what they used to do?
compare: Did the infidels receive retribution for what they used to do?

src: Sind diese gleich? Preis sei Allah!
ref: Are they equal in comparison?
draft: Are these the same? Price be to Allah!
hil: Are they the same? Glory be to Allah!
compare: Are they the same? Glory be to Allah!

src: Also hinsichtlich derjenigen, die den Iman verinnerlicht und gottgefällig Gutes getan haben, diese sind in einem Garten, sie freuen sich.
ref: Those who believed and did the right will be feasted in a rich, well-watered meadow.
draft: Regarding those who internalized the faith and did good deeds pleasing to God, they are in a garden, they rejoice.
hil: Regarding those who have believed and done righteous deeds pleasing to God, they will be in gardens [of Paradise], enjoying themselves.
compare: Regarding those who have believed and done righteous deeds pleasing to God, they will be in gardens [of Paradise], enjoying themselves.

src: Dann nachdem von ihren Herzen der Schrecken weggenommen worden war, sagten sie: "Was sagte denn euer HERR?" Sie sagten: "Die Wahrheit!"
ref: When terror is lifted from their hearts, they shall say: 'What did your Lord say' 'The truth' they shall answer.
draft: Then after the terror had been taken away from their hearts, they said: "What did your Lord say?" They said: "The truth!"
hil: "Then, after the fear was taken away from their hearts, they said, 'What did your Lord say?' They said, 'The truth!'".
compare: Then after the terror had been taken away from their hearts, they said: "What did your Lord say?" They said: "The truth!"

src: Sag: "Ich bin über euch kein Wakil."
ref: Say: "I am not a warden over you."
draft: Say: "I am not your wakil."
hil: Say, 'I am not your wakil.'
compare: Say: "I am not your wakil."

src: Dann gewiß, sie werden doch in Dschahannam hineingeworfen.
ref: Then they will indeed burn in Hell.
draft: Then certainly they will be thrown into Jahannam.
hil: Then indeed, they will be thrown into Jahannam.
compare: Then certainly they will be thrown into Jahannam.

src: Es gibt keinen Platz für euch hier, so kehrt um!"
ref: There is no stand (possible) for you (against the enemy attack!)
draft: "There is no place for you here, so turn back!"
hil: There is no place here for you, so turn back!
compare: "There is no place for you here, so turn back!"

src: Sie sagten: "O unser Vater, wir gingen, um einen Wettlauf zu machen, und ließen Yusuf bei unseren Sachen zurück. Da fraß ihn der Wolf.
ref: And said: "We went racing with one another and left Joseph to guard our things when a wolf devoured him.
draft: They said, "O our father, we went to make a race and left Yusuf by our things. Then the wolf ate him."
hil: They said, "O our father, we went to make a race and left Yusuf with our things. Then the wolf ate him."
compare: They said, "O our father, we went to make a race and left Yusuf with our things. Then the wolf ate him."

src: Doch wenn eine entscheidende Sura herabgesandt wird und darin von Kampf die Rede ist, dann siehst du die, in deren Herzen Krankheit ist, dich mit dem Blick eines (Menschen) anschauen, der im Sterben von Ohnmacht befallen wird; also wehe ihnen!
ref: But when a categorical Surah is revealed that mentions war, you should see those who are sceptical staring at you like a man in the swoon of death. Alas the woe for them!
draft: But when a decisive Surah is revealed and therein is mentioned the fighting, you see those in whose hearts is a disease looking at you with the look of someone overcome by death. So woe to them!
hil: But when a decisive Surah is revealed in which there is mention of fighting, you will see those in whose hearts there is sickness looking at you with the eyes of someone being overcome by death. So woe to them!
compare: But when a decisive Surah is revealed and therein is mentioned the fighting, you see those in whose hearts is a disease looking at you with the look of someone overcome by death. So woe to them!

src: Zweifellos sind sie es, die im Jenseits die Verlierenden sein werden.
ref: They will surely be losers in the life to come,
draft: Undoubtedly, they will be the losers in the afterlife.
hil: Undoubtedly, they will be the losers in the afterlife.
compare: Undoubtedly, they will be the losers in the afterlife.

src: ER ist Derjenige, Der diejenigen von den Schriftbesitzern, die Kufr betrieben haben, von ihren Wohnstätten zur ersten Vertreibung heraustreiben ließ. Ihr dachtet nicht, daß sie herauskommen werden, und sie dachten, daß ihre Burgen sie vor ALLAH schützen würden. Dann kam ALLAH zu ihnen von da, womit sie nicht rechneten, und warf in ihre Herzen den Schrecken. Sie zerstörten ihre Häuser mit ihren eigenen Händen und den Händen der Mumin. So zieht (daraus) eine Lehre, ihr mit Einblick!
ref: It is He Who expelled the disbelievers among the People given the Book(s) from their homes, for their first gathering; you did not expect them to leave, whereas they assumed that their fortresses would save them from Allah, so Allah’s command came to them from a place they had not imagined; and He instilled awe in their hearts, so they ruin their own houses by their own hands and at the hands of the Muslims; therefore learn a lesson, O those who can perceive!
draft: HE is the one who expelled those among the people of the Scripture who disbelieved from their homes at the first gathering. You did not think they would leave, and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allah; but [the decree of] Allah came upon them from where they had not expected, and He cast terror into their hearts [so] they destroyed their houses by their [own] hands and the hands of the believers. So take warning, O people of vision.
hil: HE is the one who expelled those among the people of the Scripture who disbelieved from their homes at the first gathering. You did not think they would leave, and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allah; but [the decree of] Allah came upon them from where they had not expected, and He cast terror into their hearts [so] they destroyed their houses by their [own] hands and the hands of the believers. So take warning, O people of vision.
compare: HE is the one who expelled those among the people of the Scripture who disbelieved from their homes at the first gathering. You did not think they would leave, and they thought that their fortresses would protect them from Allah; but [the decree of] Allah came upon them from where they had not expected, and He cast terror into their hearts [so] they destroyed their houses by their [own] hands and the hands of the believers. So take warning, O people of vision.

src: Einer Seele wird nicht auferlegt, außer was sie vermag.
ref: No person shall have a burden laid on him greater than he can bear.
draft: A soul is not burdened with more than it can bear.
hil: No soul is burdened with more than it can bear.
compare: A soul is not burdened with more than it can bear.

src: So handelten (auch) diejenigen, die vor ihnen waren. Obliegt denn den Gesandten etwas anderes als die deutliche Übermittlung (der Botschaft)?
ref: So did those before them; yet is aught for the Messengers, but to deliver the manifest Message?
draft: So acted (also) those who were before them. Do envoys have anything other than the clear transmission (of the message)?
hil: Thus acted also those who were before them. Do envoys have anything else other than the clear transmission of the message?
compare: Thus acted also those who were before them. Do envoys have anything else other than the clear transmission of the message?

src: Gewiß, die Stunde wird sicher eintreffen. So übe schöne Nachsicht.
ref: Surely the Hour is coming; so pardon thou, with a gracious pardoning.
draft: Certainly, the hour will surely come. So exercise beautiful forbearance.
hil: Surely, the hour will certainly come. So exercise beautiful patience.
compare: Surely, the hour will certainly come. So exercise beautiful patience.

src: Doch sie folgten ihren Neigungen.
ref: And they follow their own desires?
draft: But they followed their inclinations.
hil: But they followed their inclinations.
compare: But they followed their inclinations.

src: Und unter den Menschen gibt es auch manch einen, der sich selbst veräußern würde im Streben nach dem Wohlwollen Gottes.
ref: And of mankind is he who would sell himself, seeking the Pleasure of Allah.
draft: And among people there are also some who would sell themselves in the pursuit of God's favor.
hil: And among people there are also some who would sell themselves in pursuit of God's favor.
compare: And among people there are also some who would sell themselves in the pursuit of God's favor.

src: Bereits ist zu euch doch eine Bestätigung von eurem HERRN gekommen. Und WIR haben euch ein klares Licht hinabgesandt.
ref: Verily, there has come to you a convincing proof (Prophet Muhammad SAW) from your Lord, and We sent down to you a manifest light (this Quran).
