That is when you also get gray hair. And some of you may pass away early, while others may reach their appointed term, so that you may [better] understand.

src: Und es kamen die Brüder Yusufs und traten zu ihm ein; er erkannte sie, sie aber erkannten ihn nicht.
ref: The brothers of Joseph came (to Egypt) and visited him. He recognised them, though they did not recognise him.
draft: And the brothers of Joseph came and entered unto him; he recognized them, but they didn't recognize him.
hil: "And Joseph's brothers came to him and entered; he recognized them, but they didn't recognize him."
compare: "And Joseph's brothers came to him and entered; he recognized them, but they didn't recognize him."

src: Seid ihr darin also gleich (und) fürchtet sie, wie ihr einander fürchtet?
ref: Whom you fear as you fear each other?
draft: Are you therefore equal in it (and) fear them as you fear each other?
hil: So are you equal in it and fear them as much as you fear each other?
compare: Are you therefore equal in it (and) fear them as you fear each other?

src: Dies sind (die Mittel) zur Aufklärung für die Menschheit und eine Führung und Barmherzigkeit für Leute, die einen festen Glauben haben.
ref: These are precepts of wisdom for men, and guidance and grace for people who believe with certainty.
draft: These are (the means) of enlightenment for humanity and a guidance and mercy for people who have a strong faith.
hil: These are (the means) of enlightenment for humanity and a guidance and mercy for people who have a strong faith.
compare: These are (the means) of enlightenment for humanity and a guidance and mercy for people who have a strong faith.

src: Und zehrt nicht ihr Vermögen auf zu eurem Vermögen hinzu. Das wäre eine große Sünde.
ref: And do not consume their properties by combining them with yours, for that would be a serious sin.
draft: And do not consume your wealth by adding it to your wealth. That would be a great sin.
hil: And do not squander your wealth so as to add to it. That would be a great sin.
compare: And do not consume your wealth by adding it to your wealth. That would be a great sin.

src: Verderben auf den Menschen! Wie undankbar ist er!
ref: May man be slain – how ungrateful he is!
draft: Destruction upon mankind! How ungrateful he is!
hil: Destruction upon mankind! How ungrateful he is!
compare: Destruction upon mankind! How ungrateful he is!

src: Also und wer ALLAHs Hurumat hochachtet, dies ist gut für ihn bei seinem HERRN.
ref: Apart from this, whoever respects the sacred ordinances of God, will find a better reward for him with his Lord.
draft: Therefore, whoever respects ALLAH's prohibitions, it is good for him with his Lord.
hil: Thus, whoever respects the boundaries of Allah, it is good for him with his Lord.
compare: Thus, whoever respects the boundaries of Allah, it is good for him with his Lord.

src: Und (erinnere daran), als WIR dir sagten: "Gewiß, dein HERR wird die Menschen zugrunde richten!" Und WIR machten das Traumgesicht, dasWIR dich sehen ließen, nur als Fitna für die Menschen, so auch den verfluchten Baum im Quran. Und WIR ermahnen sie, doch dies bestärkt sie nur zu einer noch größeren Übertretung.
ref: And when We proclaimed to you, “Indeed all mankind is within the control of your Lord”; and We did not create the spectacle* which We showed you except to try mankind, and the Tree** which is cursed in the Qur’an; and We warn them – so nothing increases for them except extreme rebellion. (* The Ascent of the Holy Prophet to the heavens and beyond, which the disbelievers denied as just a dream. ** The Zakkum tree which will grow in hell and be the food for its inhabitants.)
draft: And (remember) when WE told you: "Surely, your Lord will destroy the people!" And WE made the vision, which We showed you, only as a trial for the people, as well as the cursed tree mentioned in the Quran. And WE warn them (the people), but it only increases them in great transgression.
hil: And (remember) when WE said to you: "Surely, your LORD will destroy mankind!" And WE made the vision, which we showed you, only as a temptation for the people, like the cursed tree in the Qur'an. Thus do We (instil) fear in them, but they only transgress more.
compare: And (remember) when WE told you: "Surely, your Lord will destroy the people!" And WE made the vision, which We showed you, only as a trial for the people, as well as the cursed tree mentioned in the Quran. And WE warn them (the people), but it only increases them in great transgression.

src: Und er sprach: "O meine Söhne, zieht nicht durch ein einziges Tor ein, sondern zieht durch verschiedene Tore ein; ich kann euch nichts gegen Allah nützen. Die Entscheidung ruht bei Allah allein.
ref: (As they were leaving) their father said to them: "O my sons, do not seek one approach but employ different ways (of attaining your object). If anything should befall you from God I shall not be able to avert it, for all authority belongs to God.
draft: And he said, "O my sons, do not enter through a single gate, but enter through different gates; I cannot benefit you against Allah. The decision lies solely with Allah."
hil: And he said, "My sons! Do not enter through a single gate, but enter through different gates! I cannot benefit you against Allah. The decision lies solely with Allah."
compare: And he said, "My sons! Do not enter through a single gate, but enter through different gates! I cannot benefit you against Allah. The decision lies solely with Allah."

src: Da sagte er: "O mein Volk, dient Allah, erwartet den Jüngsten Tag und richtet auf der Erde nicht unheilstiftend Verderben an."
ref: He said: "O people, worship God and be ready for the Day of Resurrection. Do no evil, and create no mischief in the land."
draft: Then he said: "O my people, worship Allah, await the Last Day, and do not cause mischief on earth as corrupters."
hil: Then he said, 'O my people, worship Allah, await the Last Day, and do not cause mischief on earth as corrupters.'
compare: Then he said: "O my people, worship Allah, await the Last Day, and do not cause mischief on earth as corrupters."

src: Ist es denn für die Menschen verwunderlich, daß Wir einem Mann von ihnen (als Offenbarung) eingegeben haben: "Warne die Menschen und verkünde denen, die glauben, die frohe Botschaft, daß sie bei ihrem Herrn einen wahrhaftigen Stand haben"?
ref: Are the people astonished that a man who is one of them was commanded by Us to warn them and to bring glad tidings to those who believe that they have a true precedence with their Lord?
draft: Is it surprising then for people that We have revealed to a man from among themselves (the command), "Warn the people and give good tidings to those who believe that they will have a [firm] precedence of honor with their Lord"?
hil: Is it astonishing for mankind that We revealed to a man among them (saying), 'Warn mankind and give good news to those who believe that they shall hold firmly to their place of standing with their Lord'?
compare: Is it surprising then for people that We have revealed to a man from among themselves (the command), "Warn the people and give good tidings to those who believe that they will have a [firm] precedence of honor with their Lord"?

src: Als der Schrecken von Abraham gewichen und die frohe Botschaft zu ihm gekommen war, begann er mit Uns über das Volk von Lot zu streiten.
ref: When Abraham's fear was dispelled, and the good news had come to him, he pleaded for the people of Lot with Us.
draft: When the terror had subsided for Abraham and the good news had come to him, he began to argue with us about the people of Lot.
hil: "As the terror subsided for Abraham and the good news came to him, he started arguing with us about the people of Lot."
compare: When the terror had subsided for Abraham and the good news had come to him, he began to argue with us about the people of Lot.

src: Das ist, was euch für den Tag der Abrechnung verheißen ist.
ref: This is what is promised you for the Day of Reckoning.
draft: This is what is promised to you for the day of reckoning.
hil: This is what is promised to you for the day of reckoning.
compare: This is what is promised to you for the day of reckoning.

src: Da fanden sie in ihr eine Mauer, die einzustürzen drohte, und so richtete er sie auf.
ref: There they found a wall that was crumbling, which he repaired.
draft: They found a wall inside that was about to collapse, and so he straightened it up.
hil: They found a wall inside that was about to collapse, and so he straightened it up.
compare: They found a wall inside that was about to collapse, and so he straightened it up.

src: Das verursacht dem Propheten Ungelegenheit, und er ist scheu vor euch, jedoch Allah ist nicht scheu vor der Wahrheit.
ref: And when ye ask of them aught, ask it of them from behind a curtain.
draft: This causes inconvenience to the Prophet and he is shy before you, but Allah is not shy of the truth.
hil: This causes inconvenience to the Prophet and he is shy before you, but Allah is not shy of the truth.
compare: This causes inconvenience to the Prophet and he is shy before you, but Allah is not shy of the truth.

src: Sie machten für ihn, was er begehrte: Paläste und Bildwerke, Becken wie Teiche und feststehende Kochbottiche: "Wirkt ihr vom Hause Davids in Dankbarkeit." Und nur wenige von Meinen Dienern sind dankbar.
ref: fashioning for him whatsoever he would -- places of worship, statues, porringers like water-troughs, and anchored cooking-pots. 'Labour, O House of David, in thankfulness; for few indeed are those that are thankful among My servants.'
draft: They made for him what he desired: palaces and sculptures, basins like pools and fixed cooking vats: "Work with gratitude from the house of David." And only a few of My servants are grateful.
hil: They made for him what he desired: palaces and sculptures, basins like pools and fixed cooking vats: 'Work with gratitude from the house of David.' And only a few of My servants are grateful.
compare: They made for him what he desired: palaces and sculptures, basins like pools and fixed cooking vats: "Work with gratitude from the house of David." And only a few of My servants are grateful.

src: Sei geduldig.
ref: So be patient.
draft: Be patient.
hil: Be patient.
compare: Be patient.

src: So wurde Fir'aun sein böses Tun ausgeschmückt, und er wurde vom (rechten) Weg abgehalten. Aber Fir'auns listige Tat wird nur zugrunde gehen.
ref: So the evil of his deeds was decked out fair to Pharaoh, and he was barred from the way, and Pharaoh's guile came only to ruin.
draft: "Thus Pharaoh's evil deed was embellished, and he was diverted from the (right) path. But Pharaoh's cunning act will only perish."
hil: "Thus, Pharaoh's evil deed was embellished, and he was diverted from the (right) path. But Pharaoh's cunning act will only come to naught."
compare: "Thus, Pharaoh's evil deed was embellished, and he was diverted from the (right) path. But Pharaoh's cunning act will only come to naught."

src: (Schon) vor ihnen haben das Volk Nuhs und nach diesen die Gruppierungen (ihre Gesandten) der Lüge bezichtigt.
ref: The people of Noah had denied before them, and many factions after them.
draft: (Prior to them), the people of Nuh and after them the groups (their messengers) also accused of falsehood.
hil: (Prior to them), the people of Nuh and after them, the groups (their messengers) were accused of falsehood.
compare: (Prior to them), the people of Nuh and after them, the groups (their messengers) were accused of falsehood.

src: Und wenn ihr euch mit ihnen zusammentut, so sind sie eure Brüder. Allah weiß den Unheilstifter vom Heilstifter (zu unterscheiden).
ref: Say: "The best thing to do is what is for their good; if ye mix their affairs with yours, they are your brethren; but Allah knows the man who means mischief from the man who means good.
draft: And if you make common cause with them, then they are your brothers. Allah knows the mischief-maker from the reconciler.
hil: If you join forces with them, they will be your brothers; Allah knows how to distinguish the evildoer from the doer of good.
compare: If you join forces with them, they will be your brothers; Allah knows how to distinguish the evildoer from the doer of good.

src: Die Woge trennte sie beide, und so war er einer von denen, die ertränkt wurden.
ref: And a wave came between them, and he was among those who were drowned.
draft: The wave separated both of them, and he was one of those who drowned.
hil: "The wave separated both of them and so he was one of those who drowned."
compare: The wave separated both of them, and he was one of those who drowned.

src: Dann sagten sie: "ALLAH gegenüber üben wir doch Tawakkul.
ref: They answered: "We have placed our trust in God.
draft: Then they said: "We do exercise Tawakkul towards Allah."
hil: They said, 'We rely only on Allah.'
compare: They said, 'We rely only on Allah.'

src: Und wirf nur, was in deiner Rechten ist; es wird das verschlingen, was sie gemacht haben; denn das, was sie gemacht haben, ist nur die List eines Zauberers. Und ein Zauberer soll keinen Erfolg haben, woher er auch kommen mag."
ref: Throw down what is in your right hand: It will swallow up what they have conjured. For what they have fashioned is only a trick of the sorcerer; and a sorcerer does not succeed wherever he may come."
draft: "And throw only what is in your right hand; it will swallow up what they have made; for what they have made is only the trick of a magician. And the magician will not succeed wherever he may come from."
hil: And throw that which is in your right hand. It will swallow up that which they have made, for what they have made is but the trick of a magician. A magician will not succeed wherever he may come from.
compare: "And throw only what is in your right hand; it will swallow up what they have made; for what they have made is only the trick of a magician. And the magician will not succeed wherever he may come from."

src: Bitte also deinen Herrn für uns, daß Er uns (Speise) von dem hervorbringe, was die Erde wachsen läßt, (von) Kräutern, Gurken, Knoblauch, Linsen und Zwiebeln Da sagte er: "Wollt ihr etwa das, was geringer ist, in Tausch nehmen für das, was besser ist?
ref: We shall never put up with only one kind of food, so call upon your Lord to produce for us what the earth grows – some herbs, cucumbers, corn, lentils and onions”; he said, “What!
draft: Please ask your Lord for us to produce (food) from what the earth makes grow, (from) herbs, cucumbers, garlic, lentils, and onions." He said, "Do you wish to exchange what is inferior for what is better?"
hil: Please ask your Lord to bring forth for us (food) from what the earth produces, (from) herbs, cucumbers, garlic, lentils, and onions. He said, 'Do you wish to exchange what is inferior for what is better?'
compare: Please ask your Lord to bring forth for us (food) from what the earth produces, (from) herbs, cucumbers, garlic, lentils, and onions. He said, 'Do you wish to exchange what is inferior for what is better?'

src: Und wer mehr Gutes freiwillig gibt, so ist dies besser für ihn. Und wenn ihr fastet, ist es besser für euch, würdet ihr es nur wissen.
ref: Should anyone do good of his own accord, that is better for him, and to fast is better for you, should you know.
draft: And whoever gives more voluntarily is better off. And if you fast, it is better for you, if only you knew.
hil: And whoever gives more voluntarily is better off. And if you fast, it is better for you, if only you knew.
compare: And whoever gives more voluntarily is better off. And if you fast, it is better for you, if only you knew.

src: Hast du nicht gesehen, wie dein Herr an den Aad gehandelt hat,
ref: Have you not seen what your Lord did to the 'Ad
draft: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the Aad?
hil: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the Aad?
compare: Have you not seen how your Lord dealt with the Aad?

src: Sag: "Den Überschuß."
ref: Tell them: "The utmost you can spare."
draft: Say: "The surplus."
hil: Say: "The surplus."
compare: Say: "The surplus."

src: Dies sind die Verse des Quran - eines deutlichen Buches.
ref: THESE are the verses of the Qur'an, and collection of explicit laws,
draft: These are the verses of the Quran - a clear book.
hil: These are the verses of the perspicuous Book.
compare: These are the verses of the perspicuous Book.

src: O Prophet, Wir erlaubten dir deine Gattinnen, denen du ihre Brautgabe gegeben hast, und jene, die du von Rechts wegen aus (der Zahl) derer besitzt, die Allah dir als Kriegsbeute gegeben hat, und die Töchter deines Vaterbruders und die Töchter deiner Vaterschwestern und die Töchter deines Mutterbruders und die Töchter deiner Mutterschwestern, die mit dir ausgewandert sind, und jedwede gläubige Frau, die sich dem Propheten schenkt, vorausgesetzt, daß der Prophet sie zu heiraten wünscht; (dies gilt) nur für dich und nicht für die Gläubigen. Wir haben bereits bekanntgegeben, was Wir ihnen bezüglich ihrer Frauen und jener, die sie von Rechts wegen besitzen, verordnet haben, so daß sich (daraus) keine Verlegenheit für dich ergibt. Und Allah ist Allverzeihend, Barmherzig.
ref: O Prophet, We have made lawful for thee thy wives whom thou hast given their wages and what thy right hand owns, spoils of war that God has given thee, and the daughters of thy uncles paternal and aunts paternal, thy uncles maternal and aunts maternal, who have emigrated with thee, and any woman believer, if she give herself to the Prophet and if the Prophet desire to take her in marriage, for thee exclusively, apart from the believers -- We know what We have imposed upon them touching their wives and what their right hands own -- that there may be no fault in thee; God is All-forgiving, All-compassionate.
draft: O Prophet, We have permitted you your wives to whom you have given their due compensation and those your right hand possesses from what Allah has returned to you [of captives] and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts who emigrated with you and a believing woman if she gives herself to the Prophet [and] if the Prophet wishes to marry her, [this is] only for you, excluding the [other] believers. We certainly know what We have made obligatory upon them concerning their wives and those their right hands possess, [but] about this there is no blame upon you. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
hil: O Prophet, We have permitted you your wives to whom you have given their due compensation and those whom your right hand possesses from among those Allah has given you as spoils of war and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts who emigrated with you and a believing woman, if she gives herself to the Prophet [and] if the Prophet wishes to marry her. [This is] only for you, excluding the [other] believers. We have already made known what We have enjoined upon them concerning their wives and those [slaves] their right hands possess. [So,] that you may be not in difficutly. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.
compare: O Prophet, We have permitted you your wives to whom you have given their due compensation and those whom your right hand possesses from among those Allah has given you as spoils of war and the daughters of your paternal uncles and the daughters of your paternal aunts and the daughters of your maternal uncles and the daughters of your maternal aunts who emigrated with you and a believing woman, if she gives herself to the Prophet [and] if the Prophet wishes to marry her. [This is] only for you, excluding the [other] believers. We have already made known what We have enjoined upon them concerning their wives and those [slaves] their right hands possess. [So,] that you may be not in difficutly. And ever is Allah Forgiving and Merciful.

src: Sag: "Ich sage euch nicht, daß ich über dieMagazine von ALLAHs (Rizq) verfüge. Auch kenne ich das Verborgene nicht.
ref: Tell them: "I do not say that I possess the treasures of God, or have knowledge of the Unknown, or that I am an angel.
draft: Say: "I do not tell you that I have control over ALLAH's (Rizq) magazines. Nor do I know the unseen.
hil: Say, 'I do not tell you that I have control over ALLAH's (Rizq) magazines. Nor do I know the unseen.'
compare: Say: "I do not tell you that I have control over ALLAH's (Rizq) magazines. Nor do I know the unseen.

src: Wahrlich, der Messias, Jesus, Sohn der Maria, ist nur der Gesandte Allahs und Sein Wort, das Er Maria entboten hat, und von Seinem Geist. Darum glaubt an Allah und Seine Gesandten, und sagt nicht: "Drei."
ref: The Messiah 'Iesa (Jesus), son of Maryam (Mary), was (no more than) a Messenger of Allah and His Word, ("Be!" - and he was) which He bestowed on Maryam (Mary) and a spirit (Ruh) created by Him; so believe in Allah and His Messengers.
draft: Truly, the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, is only the messenger of Allah and His word that He communicated to Mary, and a spirit from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers, and do not say, "Three."
hil: Truly, the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, is only the messenger of Allah and His word that He communicated to Mary, and a spirit from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers, and do not say, "Three."
compare: Truly, the Messiah, Jesus, son of Mary, is only the messenger of Allah and His word that He communicated to Mary, and a spirit from Him. So believe in Allah and His messengers, and do not say, "Three."

src: Wenn wir und unsere Väter zu Staub geworden sind, sollen wir dann wirklich wieder hervorgebracht werden?
ref: When we and our fathers have become dust shall we be raised [from the dead]?
draft: If we and our fathers have turned to dust, shall we then really be brought forth again?
hil: If we and our fathers have turned to dust, how shall we be raised again?
compare: If we and our fathers have turned to dust, shall we then really be brought forth again?

src: Und sie sagen: "Sollen wir etwa, wenn wir (bereits) Knochen und Überreste geworden sind, denn wirklich als neue Schöpfung auferweckt werden?"
ref: Yet they say: "When we are turned to bones and bits, shall we be raised as a new creation?"
draft: And they say, "Shall we indeed be resurrected as a new creation when we have become bones and dust?"
hil: And they say, 'Shall we truly be resurrected as a new creation when we have become bones and remains?'
compare: And they say, "Shall we indeed be resurrected as a new creation when we have become bones and dust?"

src: Die Barmherzigkeit Gottes ist den Rechtschaffenen nahe.
ref: The blessing of God is at hand for those who do good.
draft: The mercy of God is close to the righteous.
hil: The mercy of God is near to the righteous.
compare: The mercy of God is close to the righteous.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Fügt euch ALLAH und dem Gesandten, wenn er euch zu dem aufruft, was euch lebendig macht. Und wisst, daß ALLAH gewiß dem Menschen die Verfügung über sein Inneres verwehren kann und daß ihr gewiß zu Ihm versammelt werdet.
ref: O believers, respond to God and the Messenger when He calls you unto that which will give you life; and know that God stands between a man and his heart, and that to Him you shall be mustered.
draft: You, who have internalised faith! Submit to Allah and the Messenger when He calls you to that which gives you life. And know that Allah can surely deny man control over his inner self, and that you will surely be gathered to Him.
hil: O you who have internalized faith! Present yourselves upon the command of Allah and His Messenger, when the Noble Messenger calls you towards the matter that will bestow you life; and know that the command of Allah can become a barrier between a man and his heart’s intentions and that you will all be raised towards Him.
compare: You, who have internalised faith! Submit to Allah and the Messenger when He calls you to that which gives you life. And know that Allah can surely deny man control over his inner self, and that you will surely be gathered to Him.

src: Und sollten sie dem Salam zugeneigt sein, dann sei ihm ebenfalls zugeneigt und übe ALLAH gegenüber Tawakkul! ER ist gewiß Der Allhörende, Der Allwissende.
ref: But if they are inclined to peace, make peace with them, and have trust in God, for He hears all and knows everything.
draft: And if you are inclined towards the Salam, then be inclined towards it, and exercise Tawakkul towards ALLAH! HE is certainly the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
hil: And if they are inclined towards the salam, then be inclined towards it, and exercise Tawakkul towards Allah! He is certainly the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.
compare: And if they are inclined towards the salam, then be inclined towards it, and exercise Tawakkul towards Allah! He is certainly the All-Hearing, the All-Knowing.

src: Dann erfüllten WIR ihnen das Versprechen und erretteten sie und diejenigen, die WIR wollten, und richteten die Maßlosen zugrunde.
ref: Then We made Our promise good to them and delivered whomsoever We pleased, and destroyed the transgressors.
draft: Then WE fulfilled the promise to them, and saved them and those whom WE wanted, and destroyed the transgressors.
hil: "Then WE fulfilled the promise to them, and saved them and those whom WE wanted, and destroyed the transgressors."
compare: Then WE fulfilled the promise to them, and saved them and those whom WE wanted, and destroyed the transgressors.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Gehorcht ALLAH und gehorcht dem Gesandten und laßt eure Handlungen nicht nichtig werden!
ref: O you who believe, obey God and the Prophet, and do not waste your deeds.
draft: You, who have internalized the Imam! Obey Allah and obey the messenger and do not let your actions become void!
hil: Those of you who have internalized the faith! Obey Allah and obey the messenger and do not let your actions become void!
compare: Those of you who have internalized the faith! Obey Allah and obey the messenger and do not let your actions become void!

src: Heute versiegeln WIR ihnen ihre Münder, und zu Uns sprechen dann ihre Hände, auch ihre Beine legen Zeugnis ab für das, was sie zu erwerben pflegten.
ref: We shall seal their lips that day; and their hands will speak, their feet testify to what they had done.
draft: Today we seal their mouths, and then their hands speak to us, and even their legs bear witness to what they used to acquire.
hil: Today we seal their mouths, and then their hands speak to us, and even their legs bear witness to what they used to acquire.
compare: Today we seal their mouths, and then their hands speak to us, and even their legs bear witness to what they used to acquire.

src: Du bist nichts (anderes) als ein Mensch wie wir. So bringe ein Zeichen, wenn du zu den Wahrhaftigen gehörst."
ref: “You are just a human like us; therefore bring some sign if you are truthful.”
draft: You are nothing but a human like us. So bring a sign if you belong to the truthful ones.
hil: You are nothing but a human like us. So bring a sign if you belong to the truthful ones.
compare: You are nothing but a human like us. So bring a sign if you belong to the truthful ones.

src: Und derjenige, der zu seinen Eltern sagt: "Pfui über euch!
ref: And the one who said to his parents, “Uff – I am fed up with both of you! What!
draft: And whoever says to his parents, "shame on you!"
hil: And whoever says to his parents, 'Shame on you!'
compare: And whoever says to his parents, "shame on you!"

src: Und sei nicht laut beim Gebet, und auch nicht leise dabei.
ref: (Muhammad), do not be too loud or slow in your prayer.
draft: And do not be loud during prayer, nor quiet.
hil: And do not be loud during prayer, nor quiet.
compare: And do not be loud during prayer, nor quiet.

src: Es wurde von dem einen angenommen und von dem anderen nicht angenommen. Der sagte: «Ich schlage dich tot.»
ref: God accepted the sacrifice of one of them (Abel) but not that of the other (Cain) who then said to his brother, "I shall certainly kill you."
draft: It was accepted by one and not accepted by the other. He said: "I'll kill you."
hil: "It was accepted by one and not accepted by the other. He said, 'I'll kill you.'"
compare: "It was accepted by one and not accepted by the other. He said, 'I'll kill you.'"

src: Sie sind bei ALLAH nicht gleich!
ref: They are not equal before Allah.
draft: You are not equal to Allah!
hil: You are not equal to Allah! What is with Allah is better and more lasting, do you not have sense?
compare: You are not equal to Allah!

src: Und der, der zu seinen Eltern sagt: «Pfui über euch! Wollt ihr denn mir versprechen, ich würde hervorgebracht werden, wo vor mir Generationen dahingegangen sind?»...
ref: But he who says to his parents: "Shame on you: You intimidate me that I will be resurrected when many generations will have passed before me?"
draft: And he who says to his parents, "Shame on you! Do you promise me that I will be brought forth while generations before me have passed away?"...
hil: And he who says to his parents, 'disgrace on you! Do you promise me that I would be brought forth where generations before me have passed away?'...
compare: And he who says to his parents, 'disgrace on you! Do you promise me that I would be brought forth where generations before me have passed away?'...

src: Das ist die Bedeutung dessen, was du nicht in Geduld zu ertragen vermöchtest."
ref: So, I did not do that of my own accord. This is the explanation of things you could not bear with patience."
draft: "This is the meaning of what you cannot bear patiently."
hil: Say: 'This is the meaning of what you cannot bear patiently.'
compare: "This is the meaning of what you cannot bear patiently."

src: Und Allah ist wahrlich Allwissend und Nachsichtig.
ref: Verily God is all-knowing and forbearing.
draft: And Allah is truly all-knowing and forgiving.
hil: And Allah is truly All-Knowing and Forbearing.
compare: And Allah is truly All-Knowing and Forbearing.

src: Und sie sagen: "Wir glauben an Allah und an den Gesandten, und wir gehorchen."
ref: They say, 'We believe in God and the Messenger, and we obey.'
draft: And they say, "We believe in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey."
hil: And they say, 'We believe in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey.'
compare: And they say, "We believe in Allah and in the Messenger, and we obey."

src: Er sagte: "Bei ALLAH!
ref: He said: "By Allah!
draft: He said: "By Allah!
hil: He said, 'By Allah!'
compare: He said: "By Allah!

src: Es gibt unter ihnen aber auch manche, die, wenn du ihnen (nur) einen Dinar anvertraust, ihn dir nicht (wieder) aushändigen, es sei denn, du bist ständig hinter ihnen her. Dies, weil sie sagen: "Gegen uns kann man der Schriftunkundigen wegen nicht vorgehen".
ref: 6 lbs.), will return it to you, and there are others, who, if you trust him with a dinar will not hand it back unless you stand over him, for they say: 'As for the common people, they have no recourse to us' They say lies against Allah while they know.
draft: There are also some among them who, if you entrust them with a dinar, will not return it to you unless you are constantly after them. This is because they say, "No action can be taken against us because of the ignorance of the illiterate."
hil: There are also some among them who, if you entrust them with a Dinar, will not return it to you unless you are constantly after them. For they say, 'No action can be taken against us because of the ignorance of the illiterate.'
compare: There are also some among them who, if you entrust them with a dinar, will not return it to you unless you are constantly after them. This is because they say, "No action can be taken against us because of the ignorance of the illiterate."

src: Diejenigen aber, die Widerwillen zeigen und sich hochmütig verhalten, wird Er mit einer schmerzhaften Pein peinigen. Und sie werden für sich anstelle Gottes weder Freund noch Helfer finden.
ref: He will bestow upon those who have been disdainful and arrogant a painful chastisement; and they will find for themselves neither a guardian nor a helper besides Allah.
draft: But those who show aversion and behave arrogantly will be tormented with painful torment. And they will not find for themselves, instead of Allah, any friend or helper.
hil: And those who show aversion and behave arrogantly, He will torment them with painful punishment. And they will not find for themselves instead of Allah, any friend or helper.
compare: And those who show aversion and behave arrogantly, He will torment them with painful punishment. And they will not find for themselves instead of Allah, any friend or helper.

src: Gewiß, ALLAH ist mein HERR und euer HERR.
ref: Surely God is my Lord and your Lord; so serve Him.
draft: Certainly, ALLAH is my Lord and your Lord.
hil: Surely, Allah is my Lord and your Lord.
compare: Certainly, ALLAH is my Lord and your Lord.

src: Er läßt die Nacht in den Tag eindringen, und Er läßt den Tag in die Nacht eindringen. Und Er hat die Sonne und den Mond dienstbar gemacht - ein jedes läuft auf eine festgesetzte Frist zu. Dies ist doch Allah, euer Herr; Ihm gehört die Herrschaft. Diejenigen aber, die ihr anstatt Seiner anruft, verfügen nicht einmal über das Häutchen eines Dattelkerns.
ref: He brings the night in a part of the day and He brings the day in a part of the night; and He has subjected the sun and moon; each one runs to its fixed term; such is Allah, your Lord – only His is the kingship; and those whom you worship instead of Him do not own even the husk of a date-seed.
draft: He causes the night to enter the day, and He causes the day to enter the night. And He has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs sovereignty. But those whom you invoke other than Him do not possess [as much as] the membrane of a date seed.
hil: He turns the night into the day and turns the day into the night. And He has made the sun and the moon subservient, each running for an appointed term. This is Allah, your Lord, to whom belongs sovereignty. But those whom you call upon besides Him do not possess [even] a membrane of a date seed.
compare: He causes the night to enter the day, and He causes the day to enter the night. And He has subjected the sun and the moon, each running [its course] for a specified term. That is Allah, your Lord; to Him belongs sovereignty. But those whom you invoke other than Him do not possess [as much as] the membrane of a date seed.

src: Allah wird aber keine Seele zurückstellen, wenn ihre Frist kommt.
ref: But God does not grant a soul respite once its term has come to end.
draft: Allah, however, will not postpone any soul when its time has come.
hil: Allah, however, will not delay any soul when its term comes.
compare: Allah, however, will not postpone any soul when its time has come.

src: Und ER fand dich irrend, so leitete ER dich recht.
ref: Did He not find you perplexed, and show you the way?
draft: And HE found you wandering, so HE guided you right.
hil: And if He found you wandering, He guided you rightly.
compare: And if He found you wandering, He guided you rightly.

src: Sie sagten: "Wir haben zugehört und uns widersetzt." So wurde in ihren Herzen (die Zuneigung) zum Kalb wegen ihres Kufr eingeprägt.
ref: They said, 'We hear, and rebel'; and they were made to drink the Calf in their hearts for their unbelief.
draft: They said, "We have listened and opposed." Thus, in their hearts (affection) for the calf was imprinted because of their kufr.
hil: They said, "We have listened and opposed." Thus, in their hearts (affection) for the calf was imprinted because of their kufr.
compare: They said, "We have listened and opposed." Thus, in their hearts (affection) for the calf was imprinted because of their kufr.

src: Und keiner begeht mehr Unrecht als derjenige, der Lügen im Namen ALLAHs erfindet oder Seine Ayat ableugnet.
ref: Who could be more wicked than he who imputes lies to God or denies His revelations?
draft: And no one commits more injustice than the one who invents lies in the name of Allah or denies His signs.
hil: Whoever invents lies in the name of Allah or denies His signs commits the greatest injustice.
compare: And no one commits more injustice than the one who invents lies in the name of Allah or denies His signs.

src: Und von den Satanen gab es welche, die für ihn tauchten und andere Arbeit als diese verrichten.
ref: And of the devils were some that dived for him, and performed other, lesser tasks.
draft: And there were some of the satans who immersed themselves for him and perform other work than this.
hil: And among the Satans there were those who dived for him and performed other work than this.
compare: And there were some of the satans who immersed themselves for him and perform other work than this.

src: Erwarten Sie denn etwas anderes, als daß die Engel zu ihnen kommen, oder daß der Befehl deines Herrn eintrifft? So handelten auch diejenigen, die vor ihnen lebten.
ref: What! Do the (unbelievers) expect that the angels should descend, or the sentence of your Lord come to pass?
draft: Do you expect anything other than that the angels come to them, or that the command of your Lord arrives? Thus did those before them.
hil: Do you expect anything different than that the angels come to them or that the command of your Lord arrives? Thus came also the ones who lived before them.
compare: Do you expect anything other than that the angels come to them, or that the command of your Lord arrives? Thus did those before them.

src: Er sagte: "Ja! Und gewiß, ihr werdet dann doch von den Vertrauten sein."
ref: He said, “Yes, and you will then become close to me.”
draft: He said, "Yes! And surely, you will then be among the confidants."
hil: "He said: 'Yes! And surely, you will then be among the confidants.'"
compare: He said, "Yes! And surely, you will then be among the confidants."

src: Das sind ja nichts als Fabeln der Früheren."
ref: This is only the tales of the ancients!"
draft: "That's nothing but the fables of the ancients."
hil: These are nothing but fables of the ancients.
compare: "That's nothing but the fables of the ancients."

src: Und die Ungläubigen werden in Scharen zu Gahannam geführt werden, bis daß, wenn sie sie erreichen, sich ihre Pforten öffnen und ihre Wächter zu ihnen sprechen: "Sind nicht Gesandte aus eurer Mitte zu euch gekommen, um euch die Verse eures Herrn zu verlesen und euch vor dem Eintreffen dieses euren Tages zu warnen?"
ref: The unbelievers will be driven into Hell in groups till, when they reach it and its doors are opened up, its keepers will say to them: "Did not apostles of your own come to you reciting your Lord's revelations, warning you of this your day of Doom?"
draft: And the unbelievers will be led in crowds to Gahannam until, when they reach it, its gates open and its guards say to them, "Have not messengers from among yourselves come to you, reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the coming of this, your day?"
hil: And the unbelievers will be led in crowds to Gehenna until, when they reach it, its gates will open and its keepers will say to them, 'Did not apostles from among yourselves come to you, reciting the signs of your Lord and warning you of the coming of this, your day?'
compare: And the unbelievers will be led in crowds to Gahannam until, when they reach it, its gates open and its guards say to them, "Have not messengers from among yourselves come to you, reciting to you the verses of your Lord and warning you of the coming of this, your day?"

src: Und Gott genügt als Freund, und Gott genügt als Helfer.
ref: Sufficieth Allah as a Friend and sufficieth Allah as a Helper.
draft: "And God suffices as a friend, and God suffices as a helper."
hil: And Allah suffices as a friend, and Allah suffices as a helper.
compare: "And God suffices as a friend, and God suffices as a helper."

src: Beinahe hätte er uns doch von unseren Gottheiten abirren lassen, hätten wir uns nicht in Geduld ihnen gegenüber geübt!" Und sie werden wissen, wenn sie die Peinigung sehen, wer weiter vom Weg abgeirrt ist.
ref: “Possibly he would have misled us away from our Gods had we not been firm upon them”; soon they will know, when they see the punishment, who was astray from the path.
draft: Almost he would have led us astray from our deities, had we not practiced patience towards them!" And they will know, when they see the punishment, who has deviated further from the path.
hil: Almost he would have led us astray from our deities had we not exercised patience towards them! And they will know, when they see the punishment, who has deviated further from the path.
compare: Almost he would have led us astray from our deities had we not exercised patience towards them! And they will know, when they see the punishment, who has deviated further from the path.

src: Es ist für euch kein Vergehen, unbewohnte Häuser zu betreten, in denen sich eine Nutznießung für euch befindet. Und Gott weiß, was ihr offenlegt und was ihr verschweigt.
ref: There is no harm in going into uninhabited houses where there is some convenience for you, as God has knowledge of what you hide and what you disclose.
draft: It is not a sin for you to enter uninhabited houses in which there is something beneficial for you. And God knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
hil: It is not an offence for you to enter uninhabited houses in which there is something beneficial for you. And God knows what you reveal and what you conceal.
compare: It is not a sin for you to enter uninhabited houses in which there is something beneficial for you. And God knows what you reveal and what you conceal.

src: Die Zurückgebliebenen werden sagen: "Wenn ihr zu den Beutegütern aufbrecht, um sie einzunehmen, dann laßt uns euch folgen!" Sie wollen ALLAHs Worte ändern.
ref: The Bedouins who were left behind will say, when you set forth after spoils, to take them, 'Let us follow you,' desiring to change God's words.
draft: The remaining will say, "If you set off for the spoils of war to take them, then let us follow you!" They want to change Allah's words.
hil: "Those who stayed behind will say, 'When you depart for taking the spoils, allow us to follow you.' They wish to change the word of Allah."
compare: "Those who stayed behind will say, 'When you depart for taking the spoils, allow us to follow you.' They wish to change the word of Allah."

src: Da ergriff sie Allah für ihre Sünden, und sie hatten vor Allah keinen Beschützer.
ref: Yet they were seized by God for their sins, and had none to protect them against God.
draft: Then Allah seized them for their sins, and they had no protector against Allah.
hil: Therefore, Allah seized them for their sins, and they had no protector against Allah.
compare: Therefore, Allah seized them for their sins, and they had no protector against Allah.

src: Eignet euch euer Vermögen untereinander nicht durch das für nichtig Erklärte an! Nicht verboten ist es, (es euch anzueignen) durch einen Handel, den ihr in gegenseitigem Einvernehmen abschließt.
ref: Eat not up your property among yourselves unjustly except it be a trade amongst you, by mutual consent.
draft: Do not transfer your property among yourselves by means of what has been declared invalid! It is not prohibited to appropriate it by means of a transaction that you conclude in mutual agreement.
hil: Do not transfer your property among yourselves by means of what has been declared invalid! It is not prohibited to appropriate it by means of a transaction that you conclude in mutual agreement. And take witnesses when you conclude commercial transactions with each other.
compare: Do not transfer your property among yourselves by means of what has been declared invalid! It is not prohibited to appropriate it by means of a transaction that you conclude in mutual agreement.

src: Ich wußte für euch von keinem anderen Gott außer mir! Also Haman behandle meinetwegen die Erde mit Feuer und lasse für mich einen Turm errichten!
ref: I know not that ye have a god other than me, so kindle for me (a fire), O Haman, to bake the mud; and set up for me a lofty tower in order that I may survey the god of Moses; and lo!
draft: I knew for you of no other god but me! So because of me, let Haman treat the earth with fire and build a tower for me!
hil: I knew for you of no other lord but myself! So let Haman burn the earth for me with fire and build a tower for me!
compare: I knew for you of no other lord but myself! So let Haman burn the earth for me with fire and build a tower for me!

src: Und wisset, daß der Gesandte Allahs unter euch ist. Würde er sich in so vielen Dingen nach euren Wünschen richten, würdet ihr sicher in Bedrängnis kommen; jedoch Allah hat euch den Glauben lieb gemacht und sehr begehrenswert für eure Herzen; und Er hat euch Unglauben, Widersetzlichkeit und Ungehorsam verabscheuenswert gemacht.
ref: Know that the Apostle of God is among you: If he agreed with you in most matters you would surely come to grief. But God has made faith more desirable to you, and attractive to your hearts, and rendered disbelief and sin and disobedience repugnant.
draft: And know that the messenger of Allah is among you. If he were to comply with your wishes in many matters, you would surely be in difficulty. But Allah has made faith dear to you and has adorned it in your hearts, and He has made disbelief, defiance, and disobedience hateful to you.
hil: And know that the messenger of Allah is among you. If he were to comply with your wishes in many matters, you would surely be in difficulty. But Allah has made faith dear to you and adorned it in your hearts, and He has made disbelief, defiance, and disobedience hateful to you.
compare: And know that the messenger of Allah is among you. If he were to comply with your wishes in many matters, you would surely be in difficulty. But Allah has made faith dear to you and has adorned it in your hearts, and He has made disbelief, defiance, and disobedience hateful to you.

src: Sie werden nicht sprechen, ausgenommen der, dem der Erbarmer es erlaubt und der das Richtige sagt.
ref: None will speak except who is permitted by Ar-Rahman and says what is right.
draft: They will not speak, except for the one whom the Merciful allows and who speaks rightly.
hil: They shall not speak except for he whom the Merciful allows, and he shall speak rightly.
compare: They will not speak, except for the one whom the Merciful allows and who speaks rightly.

src: (sie), die auf Lügen horchen, und die darauf aus sind, unrechtmäßig Erworbenes zu verschlingen.
ref: Eavesdropping for telling lies, earning through unlawful means!
draft: (They) who listen to lies and are eager to swallow unlawfully acquired things.
hil: "They", who listen to lies and are eager to devour unlawfully acquired things.
compare: "They", who listen to lies and are eager to devour unlawfully acquired things.

src: Jede Seele wird den Tod kosten, und euch wird euer Lohn am Tag der Auferstehung vollständig gegeben; und wer da vom Feuer ferngehalten und ins Paradies geführt wird, der soll glücklich sein. Und das irdische Leben ist nichts als ein trügerischer Nießbrauch.
ref: Every soul must taste death; and only on the Day of Resurrection will you be fully recompensed; so the one who is saved from the fire and is admitted into Paradise – he is undoubtedly successful; and the life of this world is just counterfeit wealth.
draft: Every soul will taste death, and you will be given your full compensation on the Day of Resurrection; and whoever is kept away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise, he will surely triumph. And what is the life of this world except the enjoyment of delusion.
hil: Every soul shall taste death, and you shall be fully paid your wages on the Day of Resurrection; and whoever is kept far away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise shall indeed be successful. And the life of this world is nothing but an illusory enjoyment.
compare: Every soul will taste death, and you will be given your full compensation on the Day of Resurrection; and whoever is kept away from the Fire and admitted to Paradise, he will surely triumph. And what is the life of this world except the enjoyment of delusion.

src: Also Vernichtung sei den Weggenossen der Gluthitze!
ref: Deprived (of all joys) will be the inmates of Hell.
draft: Also destruction to the companions of the heat!
hil: So destruction be upon the companions of the heat!
compare: Also destruction to the companions of the heat!

src: Sie möchten Allah und diejenigen, die glauben, betrügen. Aber sie betrügen nur sich selbst, ohne zu merken.
ref: They (try to) deceive God and those who believe, yet deceive none but themselves although they do not know.
draft: They want to deceive Allah and those who believe. But they only deceive themselves without realizing it.
hil: They seek to deceive Allah and those who believe, but they only deceive themselves without realizing it.
compare: They seek to deceive Allah and those who believe, but they only deceive themselves without realizing it.

src: Und ALLAH gewährt Rizq, wem er will, ohne Berechnung.
ref: And Allah provideth whomsoever He listeth without reckoning.
draft: And Allah grants Rizq to whom He wills, without calculation.
hil: And God provides sustenance to whom He will, without measure.
compare: And Allah grants Rizq to whom He wills, without calculation.

src: In Gärten und an Quellen,
ref: In these gardens and these springs,
draft: In gardens and at springs,
hil: In gardens and at springs,
compare: In gardens and at springs,

src: Unter ihnen gab es Rechtschaffene und solche, die dies nicht waren.
ref: Some of them righteous, and some of them short of that.
draft: Among them there were righteous people and those who weren't.
hil: Among them there were righteous people and those who were not.
compare: Among them there were righteous people and those who weren't.

src: Fühlt ihr euch etwa sicher vor Dem, Dessen (Anweisung) im Himmel ist, daß ER mit euch die Erde versinkt, und daß sie gleich bebt?!
ref: Are you so unafraid that He who is in Heaven will not open up the earth to swallow you, when it will begin to tremble?
draft: Do you feel safe from the One whose instruction is in heaven, that He may cause the earth to swallow you and it suddenly shakes?
hil: Do you feel safe from the One whose instruction is in heaven, that He may cause the earth to swallow you and it suddenly shakes?
compare: Do you feel safe from the One whose instruction is in heaven, that He may cause the earth to swallow you and it suddenly shakes?

src: Unser HERR! Lasse in unseren Herzen keine Falschheit entstehen, nachdem DU uns rechtgeleitet hast, und schenke uns von Dir aus Gnade! Gewiß, DU bist zweifellos Der großzügigste Schenkende.
ref: Our Lord, make not our hearts to swerve after that Thou hast guided us; and give us mercy from Thee; Thou art the Giver.
draft: "Our LORD! Let no falsehood arise in our hearts after You have guided us, and grant us mercy from Yourself! Indeed, You are the Bestower."
hil: Our Lord! Let no falsehood arise in our hearts after You have guided us, and grant us mercy from Yourself! Indeed, You are the most generous Bestower.
compare: Our Lord! Let no falsehood arise in our hearts after You have guided us, and grant us mercy from Yourself! Indeed, You are the most generous Bestower.

src: Hättest du alles, was auf der Erde ist, dafür ausgegeben, hättest du ihre Herzen nicht vereint!
ref: Had you given away all the riches of the earth you could not have joined their hearts, but it is Allah Who joined their hearts.
draft: If you had spent everything on Earth for it, you would not have united their hearts!
hil: If you had spent all that is on earth, you could not have united their hearts.
compare: If you had spent all that is on earth, you could not have united their hearts.

src: Wenn dem Menschen Unheil widerfährt, ruft er Uns an.
ref: When adversity touches the human being, he calls on Us.
draft: If harm befalls a person, he calls upon Us.
hil: When adversity strikes man, he calls upon Us.
compare: If harm befalls a person, he calls upon Us.

src: (Dies ist) eine Verpflichtung von ALLAH, und ALLAH ist allwissend, allweise.
ref: God is all-knowing and all-wise.
draft: This is a commitment from Allah, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
hil: This is a commitment from Allah, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.
compare: This is a commitment from Allah, and Allah is all-knowing, all-wise.

src: Dies ist eine Erinnerung.
ref: This is indeed a reminder.
draft: This is a reminder.
hil: This is a reminder.
compare: This is a reminder.

src: Für euch gibt es anstelle von Ihm weder Wali noch Fürbittenden. Wollt ihr euch etwa nicht entsinnen?!
ref: Apart from Him, you have no protector neither mediator; will you not remember?
draft: "For you there is neither a guardian nor an intercessor instead of Him. Don't you want to remember?!"
hil: For you there are neither guardians nor intercessors in place of Him. Don't you want to remember?
compare: For you there are neither guardians nor intercessors in place of Him. Don't you want to remember?

src: Er sagte: "Meine Leute! Wie seht ihr es? Wenn ich über ein eindeutiges Zeichen von meinem HERRN verfüge und ER mir Gnade von Ihm erwies, die euch verborgen blieb, sollen wir diese euch etwa zur Pflicht machen, wenn ihr demgegenüber abgeneigt seid?
ref: He said: bethink ye, O my people! if I rested upon an evidence from my Lord, and a mercy hath come unto me from Him, and that hath been obscured unto you, Shall we make you adhere to it while ye are averse thereto?
draft: He said: "My people! How do you see it? If I have a clear sign from my Lord and He granted me grace from Him that was hidden from you, should we make it a duty for you if you are averse to it?
hil: "He said: 'My people! Tell me, if I have a clear evidence from my Lord, and He has given me a good sustenance from Himself (shall I corrupt it by mixing it with the unlawfully earned money), if you are averse to it?'".
compare: He said: "My people! How do you see it? If I have a clear sign from my Lord and He granted me grace from Him that was hidden from you, should we make it a duty for you if you are averse to it?

src: Oder wer wird ihr Beschützer sein?
ref: Or who will be their representative?
draft: Or who will be her protector?
hil: Or who will be their protector?
compare: Or who will be her protector?

src: Kehrt zurück zu eurem Vater, dann sagt: "Unser Vater! Dein Sohn hat gestohlen, und wir haben nur das bezeugt, was wir wußten. Und wir hatten über das Verborgene keine Kenntnis.
ref: Return you all to your father, and say, "Father, thy son stole; we do not testify except that we know; we were no guardians of the Unseen.
draft: Return to your father, then say, "Our father! Your son has stolen, and we have only testified to what we knew. And we had no knowledge of the hidden."
hil: Go to your father and tell him: 'O father, your son has committed a theft. We bear witness to only what we know, and we could not prevent the unknown'.
compare: Return to your father, then say, "Our father! Your son has stolen, and we have only testified to what we knew. And we had no knowledge of the hidden."

src: Nein, sie leugnen die Stunde; und denen, welche die Stunde leugnen, haben Wir einen Höllenbrand bereitet.
ref: Yet they reject the Hour as untrue. We have prepared a Fire for those who deny the Resurrection.
draft: No, they deny the Hour; and those who deny the Hour - We have prepared for them a Blaze.
hil: No, they deny the Hour; and those who deny the Hour - We have prepared for them a Blaze.
compare: No, they deny the Hour; and those who deny the Hour - We have prepared for them a Blaze.

src: Doch nie war ich mit dem Bittgebet zu Dir - HERR!  erfolglos.
ref: And in calling on Thee, my Lord, I have never been hitherto unprosperous.
draft: But I was never unsuccessful with the supplication to you - LORD!
hil: But I have never been unsuccessful with the prayer to You - LORD!
compare: But I have never been unsuccessful with the prayer to You - LORD!

src: Er sagte: "Nein! Vielmehr habt ihr selbst euch etwas eingeredet.
ref: (Their father) said: "It is not so; you have made up the story.
draft: He said, "No! Rather, you have convinced yourselves of something."
hil: He said, 'No! Rather, you have convinced yourselves of something.'
compare: He said, "No! Rather, you have convinced yourselves of something."

src: ALLAH wird ihnen gewiß vergelten Besseres als das, wie sie handelten, und wird ihnen noch mehr von Seiner Gunst geben.
ref: That Allah may reward them according to the best of their deeds, and add even more for them out of His Grace.
draft: "ALLAH will certainly repay them with something better than what they did, and will give them even more of His grace."
hil: Surely Allah will repay them with something better than what they did, and will give them even more of His grace.
compare: Surely Allah will repay them with something better than what they did, and will give them even more of His grace.

src: Sie sagten: "Wir glauben an den Herrn der Welten
ref: And said: "We have come to believe in the Lord of all the worlds,
draft: They said: "We believe in the Lord of the worlds".
hil: They said, "We believe in the Lord of the worlds."
compare: They said: "We believe in the Lord of the worlds".

src: So haben Wir bemessen.
ref: Then We facilitated (your birth).
draft: So have we measured.
hil: Thus have We measured.
compare: So have we measured.

src: Bereits sehen WIR das Schweifen deines Gesichts himmelwärts. So werden WIR dich gewiß eine Gebetsrichtung einnehmen lassen, an der du Wohlgefallen findest.
ref: We have seen thee turning thy face about in the heaven; now We will surely turn thee to a direction that shall satisfy thee.
draft: Already we see the wandering of your face towards heaven. Thus we will certainly let you take a prayer direction that you find pleasing.
hil: "We already see the wandering of your face towards the sky. Thus we will certainly let you take a prayer direction that you find pleasing."
compare: "We already see the wandering of your face towards the sky. Thus we will certainly let you take a prayer direction that you find pleasing."

src: Die Gesandten unseres Herrn haben in der Tat die Wahrheit gebracht."
ref: The apostles of our Lord had indeed brought the truth."
draft: "The messengers of our Lord have indeed brought the truth."
hil: The messengers of our Lord have indeed brought the truth.
compare: "The messengers of our Lord have indeed brought the truth."

src: Und sollten sie für euch auf etwas davon freiwillig verzichten, dann nehmt es als Gutes Unschädliches an.
ref: But if they willingly forego some of it, then consume it with enjoyment and pleasure.
draft: And if they voluntarily abstain from something for you, then accept it as good and harmless.
hil: And if they voluntarily abstain from something for you, then accept it as good and harmless.
compare: And if they voluntarily abstain from something for you, then accept it as good and harmless.

src: Er sagte: "Nein, sondern euer Ego machte euch etwas leicht! (Ich übe mich) in klagloser Geduld.
ref: He said, ‘No, your souls have made a matter seem decorous to you.
draft: He said, "No, but your ego made something easy for you! (I practice) in patience without complaint."
hil: He said, "No, but your ego made something easy for you! (I practice) in patience without complaint."
compare: He said, "No, but your ego made something easy for you! (I practice) in patience without complaint."

src: Gott wollte feststellen, wer Ihn und seine Gesandten unterstützt, auch in Abwesenheit.
ref: That God may know who supports Him and His messengers invisibly.
draft: God wanted to determine who supports Him and His messengers, even in their absence.
hil: God wanted to determine who supports Him and His messengers, even in their absence.
compare: God wanted to determine who supports Him and His messengers, even in their absence.

src: Hätten sie doch dafür vier Zeugen gebracht! Und sollten sie nun die Zeugen nicht bringen, dann sind diese selbst bei ALLAH die wirklichen Lügner.
ref: Would that they had brought four witness to testify to their report. Since they brought none, they are liars before God.
draft: If only they had brought four witnesses for it! And if they do not bring the witnesses now, they themselves are the real liars before Allah.
hil: If only they had brought four witnesses for it! And if they do not bring the witnesses now, they themselves are the real liars before Allah.
compare: If only they had brought four witnesses for it! And if they do not bring the witnesses now, they themselves are the real liars before Allah.

src: Gewiß, bereits entsandten WIR (Gesandte) zu Umam vor dir, dann hat diesen der Satan ihre (schlechten) Taten schön erscheinen lassen, so ist er ihr Wali heute.
ref: We have sent messengers before you to other nations. But Satan made their [foul] deeds seem fair to them and today he is their patron.
draft: Sure, we have already sent messengers to Umam before you, but Satan has made their bad deeds appear attractive to them, so he is their ally today.
hil: "Indeed, we have previously sent messengers to people living in Umam before you, but Satan had made their (evil) deeds look attractive to them, so he is their ally today."
compare: "Indeed, we have previously sent messengers to people living in Umam before you, but Satan had made their (evil) deeds look attractive to them, so he is their ally today."

src: Mit denen, die ihr Vermögen spenden im Streben nach dem Wohlwollen Gottes und zur Festigung ihrer Seelen, ist es wie mit einem Garten auf einer Anhöhe.
ref: And the parable of those who spend their wealth seeking God’s approval, and to strengthen their souls, is that of a garden on a hillside.
draft: Those who donate their wealth in pursuit of God's favor and to strengthen their souls are like a garden on a hill.
hil: "Those who donate their wealth in pursuit of God's favor and to strengthen their souls are like a garden on a hill."
compare: Those who donate their wealth in pursuit of God's favor and to strengthen their souls are like a garden on a hill.

src: Gewiß, bereits waren sie vorher um Fitna bemüht und wollten deine Angelegenheiten (durch Intrigen) durcheinander bringen, bis dieWahrheit kam und die Sache ALLAHs siegte, während sie (diesem) abgeneigt sind.
ref: They had tried to create disorder before and intrigued against you, but truth came out in the end and God's will prevailed, even though they did not like it.
draft: Certainly, they were already concerned about Fitna before and wanted to disrupt your affairs (through intrigues) until the truth came and the matter of Allah prevailed, while they are averse to it.
hil: Surely, they were already striving before for Fitna and wanted to mess up your affairs (by intrigues), until the truth came and the matter of Allah triumphed, while they are averse to it.
compare: Certainly, they were already concerned about Fitna before and wanted to disrupt your affairs (through intrigues) until the truth came and the matter of Allah prevailed, while they are averse to it.

src: Ergötzt euch denn (eine Weile), bald jedoch werdet ihr es wissen.
ref: Please yourselves for a time; you will come to know soon.
draft: Enjoy yourselves for (a while), but soon you will know it.
hil: Enjoy yourselves for (a while), but soon you will know it.
compare: Enjoy yourselves for (a while), but soon you will know it.

src: Und wen ALLAH rechtleitet, ist zweifellos der Rechtgeleitete, und wen ER abirren läßt, für die findest du gewiß keine Wali anstelle von Ihm! Und WIR werden sie am Tag der Auferstehung auf ihren Gesichtern versammeln - blind, stumm und taub.
ref: Whomsoever God guides, he is rightly guided; and whom He leads astray -- thou wilt not find for them protectors, apart from Him.
draft: And whoever Allah guides, he is undoubtedly the guided one, and whoever He leads astray, you will certainly not find a guardian for him besides Him! And We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf.
hil: And whoever Allah guides is undoubtedly the guided one, and whoever He leads astray, you will certainly not find a guardian for him besides Him! And We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection on their faces - blind, dumb, and deaf.
compare: And whoever Allah guides, he is undoubtedly the guided one, and whoever He leads astray, you will certainly not find a guardian for him besides Him! And We will gather them on the Day of Resurrection on their faces - blind, dumb and deaf.

src: Da warfen sie sich nieder, außer Iblis. Er weigerte sich.
ref: They fell prostrate, but Iblis did not; he refused.
draft: They threw themselves down, except Iblis. He refused.
hil: Then they threw themselves down, except Iblis, who refused.
compare: Then they threw themselves down, except Iblis, who refused.

src: Und darin haben sie vollkommen gereinigte Gattinnen. Und ewig werden sie darin bleiben.
ref: And they shall have fair spouses there, and live there abidingly.
draft: And therein they have purified wives completely. And they will remain therein forever.
hil: And they will have therein purified spouses completely and they will remain therein forever.
compare: And they will have therein purified spouses completely and they will remain therein forever.

src: Nehmt euch daher keine Beschützer von ihnen, solange sie nicht auf Allahs Weg wandern. Und wenn sie sich abwenden, dann ergreift sie und tötet sie, wo immer ihr sie auffindet; und nehmt euch keinen von ihnen zum Beschützer oder zum Helfer
ref: Wherefore take not friends from among them until they migrate for the sake of Allah; and if they turn away, then lay hold of them and slay them, wheresoever ye find them, and take not from among them a friend or a helper.
draft: Therefore, do not take protectors from them as long as they do not walk in Allah's path. And if they turn away, seize and kill them wherever you find them; and do not take any of them as a protector or helper.
hil: Do not take protectors from them as long as they do not walk in Allah's path. And if they turn away, seize and kill them wherever you find them; and do not take any of them as a protector or helper.
compare: Therefore, do not take protectors from them as long as they do not walk in Allah's path. And if they turn away, seize and kill them wherever you find them; and do not take any of them as a protector or helper.

src: So sollen sie Mich nicht um Beschleunigung bitten.
ref: So let them not ask Me to hasten (the punishment).
draft: So they should not ask me to speed up.
hil: "They should not ask me to speed up."
compare: So they should not ask me to speed up.

src: Sie gehören nicht zu euch, und auch nicht zu ihnen.
ref: They are not of you, nor of them.
draft: They do not belong to you, nor to them.
hil: They do not belong to you, nor to them.
compare: They do not belong to you, nor to them.

src: Und der Sünde der Juden wegen haben Wir ihnen gute Dinge verboten, die ihnen erlaubt waren, wie auch, weil sie viele Hindernisse in Allahs Weg legten
ref: Because of the wickedness of some among the Jews, and because they obstructed people from the way of God, We forbade them many things which were lawful for them;
draft: And because of the Jews' sin, We have forbidden them some things that were previously allowed for them, and because they have put many obstacles in the way of Allah.
hil: And because of the Jews' sins, We have forbidden them some good things that were previously allowed for them, as well as because they placed many obstacles in the way of Allah.
compare: And because of the Jews' sins, We have forbidden them some good things that were previously allowed for them, as well as because they placed many obstacles in the way of Allah.

src: Seine Leute kamen eilig zu ihm getrieben.
ref: His people came excited to him.
draft: His people came hurriedly driven to him.
hil: "People hurriedly came driven to him."
compare: His people came hurriedly driven to him.

src: Hinsichtlich derjenigen, in deren Herzen Falschheit ist, so folgen sie dem, was darin mehrdeutig ist  in Bestrebung nach Fitna und in Bestrebung nach (irriger) Auslegung.
ref: As for those in whose hearts is swerving, they follow the ambiguous part, desiring dissension, and desiring its interpretation; and none knows its interpretation, save only God.
draft: Regarding those in whose hearts there is falsehood, they follow that which is ambiguous therein - in pursuit of Fitnah and in pursuit of (erroneous) interpretation.
hil: Regarding those in whose hearts there is falsehood, they follow that which is ambiguous therein - in pursuit of Fitnah and in pursuit of (erroneous) interpretation.
compare: Regarding those in whose hearts there is falsehood, they follow that which is ambiguous therein - in pursuit of Fitnah and in pursuit of (erroneous) interpretation.

src: Vor dem Unheil dessen, was Er erschaffen hat,
ref: From the evil of what He has created,
draft: Before the evil of what He has created,
hil: Before the evil of what He has created,
compare: Before the evil of what He has created,

src: Ist etwa derjenige, der ins Feuer geworfen wird, besser oder derjenige, der am Tage der Auferstehung sicher kommt?! Tut, was ihr wollt!
ref: Is he who is hurled into the Fire better? Or he who arrives safely on the Day of Resurrection?
draft: "Is the one who is thrown into the fire better, or the one who comes on the day of resurrection safely?! Do what you want!"
hil: Is the one who is thrown into the fire better, or is the one who comes safely on the Day of Resurrection? Do as you please!
compare: "Is the one who is thrown into the fire better, or the one who comes on the day of resurrection safely?! Do what you want!"

src: Dies sind die Gesandten; einige von ihnen haben Wir vor anderen bevorzugt. Unter ihnen gibt es manche, zu denen Allah gesprochen hat, und einige, die Er um Rangstufen erhöht hat.
ref: Of those messengers, some of whom We have caused to excel others, and of whom there are some unto whom Allah spake, while some of them He exalted (above others) in degree; and We gave Jesus, son of Mary, clear proofs (of Allah's Sovereignty) and We supported him with the holy Spirit.
draft: These are the messengers; some of them We have preferred over others. Among them are those to whom Allah spoke, and some He has raised in degree.
hil: These are the messengers; some of them We have preferred over others. Among them are those to whom Allah spoke, and some He has raised in degree.
compare: These are the messengers; some of them We have preferred over others. Among them are those to whom Allah spoke, and some He has raised in degree.

src: Dient ALLAH, meinem HERRN und eurem HERRN.
ref: Worship Allah, my Lord and your Lord."
draft: Serve ALLAH, my Lord and your Lord.
hil: Serve ALLAH, my Lord and your Lord.
compare: Serve ALLAH, my Lord and your Lord.

src: Ehefrauen des Propheten! Ihr seid nicht wie irgendeine (Gruppe) der Frauen, wenn ihr Taqwa gemäß handelt.
ref: O wives of the Prophet, you are not like other women.
draft: Wives of the Prophet! You are not like any other women, if you act according to Taqwa.
hil: Wives of the Prophet! You are not like any other women if you act according to Taqwa.
compare: Wives of the Prophet! You are not like any other women, if you act according to Taqwa.

src: ALLAH möge ihnen vergeben. Gewiß, ALLAH ist allvergebend, allgnädig.
ref: It may be that God will accept their repentance, for God is forgiving and kind.
draft: ALLAH may forgive them. Indeed, ALLAH is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
hil: May Allah forgive them. Indeed, Allah is all-forgiving, ever-merciful.
compare: ALLAH may forgive them. Indeed, ALLAH is all-forgiving, all-merciful.

src: "Es gibt nur unseren ersten Tod, und wir werden nicht wiedererweckt werden.
ref: "There is no dying for us but once; and we shall not be raised again.
draft: "There is only our first death, and we will not be revived."
hil: "According to what they say, there is no other life except for this world, and we will not be raised (from the dead)."
compare: "There is only our first death, and we will not be revived."

src: Als er dort ankam, wurde ihm zugerufen: "Gesegnet ist wer im Feuer und wer in dessen Umgebung ist, und Preis sei Allah, dem Herrn der Weltenbewohner!
ref: But when he reached it, a voice called out: "Blessed is He who is in the fire and all around it. Praised be God, the Lord of all the worlds.
draft: When he arrived there, he was shouted at: "Blessed is he who is in the fire and he who is around it, and praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds inhabitants!"
hil: When he arrived there, he was called out: 'Blessed is he who is in the fire and he who is around it, and praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds inhabitants!'
compare: When he arrived there, he was shouted at: "Blessed is he who is in the fire and he who is around it, and praise be to Allah, the Lord of the worlds inhabitants!"

src: Als ihr fortlieft und euch nach niemandem umdrehtet, während der Gesandte euch von hinten her rief. Da belohnte Er euch mit Kummer für (den) Kummer (des Propheten), damit ihr weder traurig wäret über das, was euch entgangen war, noch über das, was euch getroffen hatte. Und Allah ist Kundig dessen, was ihr tut.
ref: Remember, as you were rushing up (the hill) without turning back to look, though the Prophet was calling you from the rear, He requited you with anguish for an anguish that you do not fret for missed opportunity and what befell you, for God is aware of all that you do,
draft: When you left and did not turn to anyone while the messenger called you from behind. He rewarded you with sorrow for the sorrow (of the Prophet), so that you would not be sad about what you missed or what had happened to you. And Allah is aware of what you do.
hil: As ye ran off and looked not back, when the apostle called unto you from behind, He caused sorrow to overtake you for sorrow, that ye might not grieve for that which ye might lose nor for that which might befall you. And Allah is aware of what ye do.
compare: When you left and did not turn to anyone while the messenger called you from behind. He rewarded you with sorrow for the sorrow (of the Prophet), so that you would not be sad about what you missed or what had happened to you. And Allah is aware of what you do.

src: Am Morgen war er in der Stadt furchtsam und hielt (immer wieder) Ausschau. Auf einmal schrie derjenige, der ihn am Tag zuvor um Hilfe gebeten hatte, zu ihm um Beistand. Musa sagte zu ihm: "Du bist offenkundig einer, der wahrlich (zu Gewalttaten) verleitet."
ref: So he was in the city at morning fearing, waiting to see what happens – thereupon he sighted the one who had appealed to him the day before, crying out to him for help; Moosa said to him, “Indeed you are clearly astray.”
draft: In the morning he was fearful in the city and kept (constantly) looking around. Suddenly, the one who had asked him for help the day before screamed to him for assistance. Musa said to him: "You are obviously one who is truly (inclined to violence)."
hil: In the morning he was fearful in the city and kept (constantly) looking around. Suddenly, the person who had asked him for help the day before screamed to him for assistance. Musa said to him: 'You are obviously one who is truly (inclined to violence).'
compare: In the morning he was fearful in the city and kept (constantly) looking around. Suddenly, the one who had asked him for help the day before screamed to him for assistance. Musa said to him: "You are obviously one who is truly (inclined to violence)."

src: Und WIR senden nach und nach vom Quran hinab, was eine Heilung und Gnade für die Mumin ist. Doch er bestärkt die Unrecht-Begehenden nur noch im Fehlgehen.
ref: What We have sent down of the Qur'an is a healing and a grace for the faithful, and adds only loss for the sinners.
draft: And WE send down gradually from the Quran what is a healing and a mercy for the believers. But it only increases the wrongdoing of the unjust.
hil: And WE send down gradually from the Quran what is a healing and a mercy for the believers. But it only further confirms the wrongdoing of the unjust.
compare: And WE send down gradually from the Quran what is a healing and a mercy for the believers. But it only further confirms the wrongdoing of the unjust.

src: Solcherart erläutert ALLAH für euch Seine Ayat.
ref: Thus Allah makes clear His Ayat (Commandments and legal obligations) for you.
draft: Such does Allah explain His Ayat to you.
hil: Say, "Thus does Allah explain His Ayat to you."
compare: Such does Allah explain His Ayat to you.

src: Und gäbe es nicht das Wort des Richtens, würde bestimmt unter ihnen gerichtet.
ref: But for the decisive Word (of God) a sentence would have been passed amongst them.
draft: And if there were no word of judgment, they would certainly be judged among themselves.
hil: And were it not for a Word that has gone forth before from your Lord, the judgment would surely have been passed between them; and those who were made to inherit the Book after them are certainly in disquieting doubt about it.
compare: And if there were no word of judgment, they would certainly be judged among themselves.

src: Sollen wir etwa Sudschud zu dem vollziehen, den du uns anweist?!"
ref: Should we adore whoever you ask us to?"
draft: "Should we really execute Sudschud according to the orders you give us?!"
hil: Should we really carry out Sudschud following the instructions you give us?!
compare: "Should we really execute Sudschud according to the orders you give us?!"

src: Also richte deine Bittgebete an keinen anderen Gott neben ALLAH, sonst wirst du von den Gepeinigten.
ref: So call on no other god but God, lest you are condemned to torment;
draft: Also direct your supplications to no other God than ALLAH, or else you will be among the tormented.
hil: So direct your supplications to no other god than Allah, otherwise you will be among the tormented.
compare: Also direct your supplications to no other God than ALLAH, or else you will be among the tormented.

src: Nach dem Gesetz des Königs hätte es ihm nicht zugestanden, seinen Bruder (als Sklaven) zu nehmen, außer daß Allah es wollte. Wir erhöhen, wen Wir wollen, um Rangstufen.
ref: He could not take his brother by the law of the king (as a slave), except that Allah willed it. (So Allah made the brothers to bind themselves with their way of "punishment, i.e. enslaving of a thief.")
draft: According to the king's law, he would not have been allowed to take his brother (as a slave), except that Allah wanted it. We raise whom We will in degrees.
hil: According to the law of the king, he would not have been allowed to take his brother (as a slave), except that Allah wanted it. We exalt whom We will in degrees.
compare: According to the law of the king, he would not have been allowed to take his brother (as a slave), except that Allah wanted it. We exalt whom We will in degrees.

src: Diejenigen, die aus Furcht vor ihrem Herrn erschrecken,
ref: Surely those who live in awe of their Lord,
draft: Those who tremble in fear of their Lord,
hil: Those who tremble in fear of their Lord,
compare: Those who tremble in fear of their Lord,

src: Gut wart ihr, so betretet es; darin werdet ihr ewig weilen.»...
ref: So enter here to live for ever."
draft: Well were you, so enter it; therein shall you dwell forever.
