ref: They will all publicly come in the presence of Allah – then those who were weak will say to those who were the leaders, “We were your followers – is it possible for you to avert some of Allah’s punishment from us?” They will answer, “If Allah had guided us, we would have guided you; it is the same for us, whether we panic or patiently endure – we have no place of refuge.” (* This conversation will take place between the disbelievers and their leaders.)
draft: And they all came before Allah. Then the weak ones said to those who were arrogant, "We were indeed your followers; can you protect us at all from Allah's punishment?" They said, "If Allah had guided us, we would have guided you. It is now the same for us whether we bear it with patience or without patience, for there is no escape for us."
hil: And they all came before Allah. The weak ones said to the proud assembly, 'We were indeed your followers! Can you protect us at all from Allah's punishment?'. They said, 'If Allah had guided us, we would have guided you. It is the same for us whether we bear it with patience or without patience, for there is no escape for us.'
compare: And they all came before Allah. The weak ones said to the proud assembly, 'We were indeed your followers! Can you protect us at all from Allah's punishment?'. They said, 'If Allah had guided us, we would have guided you. It is the same for us whether we bear it with patience or without patience, for there is no escape for us.'

src: (Und ich bin zu euch gesandt worden, auf) daß ihr Vergebung von eurem Herrn erflehet und euch dann reumütig zu Ihm bekehret. Er wird euch dann bis zum Ende einer festgesetzten Frist reich versorgen.
ref: and: 'Ask forgiveness of your Lord, then repent to Him, and He will give you fair enjoyment unto a term stated, and He will give of His bounty to every man of grace.
draft: (And I have been sent to you so) that you seek forgiveness from your Lord and then repent to Him in remorse. He will then provide you with abundant provision until the end of an appointed term.
hil: And I have been sent to you so that you seek forgiveness from your Lord and then repent to Him in remorse. He will then provide you with abundant provision until the end of an appointed term.
compare: (And I have been sent to you so) that you seek forgiveness from your Lord and then repent to Him in remorse. He will then provide you with abundant provision until the end of an appointed term.

src: Kein Volk kann seine Frist überschreiten; noch können sie dahinter zurückbleiben.
ref: No people can hasten or delay the term already fixed for them.
draft: No people can exceed their deadline; nor can they fall behind it.
hil: No nation can exceed its deadline; nor can they fall behind it.
compare: No nation can exceed its deadline; nor can they fall behind it.

src: Sie belauschen nicht die hohen Angesehenen. Und sie werden von jeder Seite beworfen,
ref: So that they are not able to listen to the angels of higher (echelons), and are pelted from all sides
draft: They do not eavesdrop on the high and mighty. And they are bombarded from every side.
hil: They do not eavesdrop on the highly esteemed. And they are bombarded from every side.
compare: They do not eavesdrop on the high and mighty. And they are bombarded from every side.

src: Also Niedergang sei denjenigen, die Kufr betrieben haben, an ihrem Tag, der ihnen angedroht wird.
ref: Alas the woe for those who refuse to believe in the Day which has been promised them.
draft: Also downfall be to those who have committed Kufr on their day, which is threatened to them.
hil: Thus ruin be to those who have committed Kufr on their day, which is threatened to them.
compare: Also downfall be to those who have committed Kufr on their day, which is threatened to them.

src: Allah ist Gnädig zu den Menschen.
ref: God is Kind towards the servants.
draft: Allah is merciful to people.
hil: Allah is merciful to people.
compare: Allah is merciful to people.

src: Aber die Heuchler wissen nicht Bescheid.
ref: But the hypocrites do not know.
draft: But the hypocrites do not know.
hil: But the hypocrites do not know, as God knows.
compare: But the hypocrites do not know, as God knows.

src: Er sagte: "Nein! Vielmehr ist euer Herr der Herr der Himmel und der Erde, Der sie erschaffen hat. Und ich gehöre zu denjenigen, die euch darüber Zeugnis ablegen.
ref: He said: "In fact it was your Lord, the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who created them; and I bear witness to this.
draft: He said: "No! Rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them. And I am one of those who testify to this to you."
hil: He said, 'No! On the contrary, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth, who created them. And I am one of those who testify to this to you.'
compare: He said: "No! Rather, your Lord is the Lord of the heavens and the earth who created them. And I am one of those who testify to this to you."

src: Sie sagte: "Ach, wehe mir!
ref: She said: "Woe betide me!
draft: She said: "Oh, woe is me!"
hil: She said, 'Oh, woe is me!'
compare: She said: "Oh, woe is me!"

src: So darfst du nicht meinen, daß Gott sein Versprechen an die Gesandten bricht.
ref: Think not that God would go back on His promise (made) to the apostles.
draft: So you must not think that God breaks his promise to the messengers.
hil: So you must not think that God breaks his promise to the messengers.
compare: So you must not think that God breaks his promise to the messengers.

src: Ah sieh!
ref: Alas indeed!
draft: Ah see!
hil: Ah look!
compare: Ah look!

src: Ich schwöre bei den sich Verbergenden,
ref: I swear by the slinkers,
draft: I swear by those who hide themselves.
hil: I swear by those who hide themselves.
compare: I swear by those who hide themselves.

src: Und ich wurde angewiesen, von den Muslimen zu sein,
ref: And I have been commanded to be of those that surrender,
draft: And I was instructed to be among the Muslims.
hil: And I was commanded to be among the Muslims.
compare: And I was commanded to be among the Muslims.

src: ALLAH hat sie euch vergeben. Und ALLAH ist allvergebend, allnachsichtig.
ref: God has overlooked (your failings) in this (respect), for God is forgiving and forbearing.
draft: ALLAH has forgiven you. And ALLAH is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
hil: ALLAH has forgiven you. And ALLAH is all-forgiving, all-merciful.
compare: ALLAH has forgiven you. And ALLAH is all-forgiving, all-merciful.

src: Nein, sondern ALLAH gehört die Bestimmung insgesamt. Wollen diejenigen, die den Iman verinnerlichten, etwa nicht zur Kenntnis nehmen, daß wenn ALLAH wollte, ER alle Menschen rechtleitete?!
ref: So, do not the people of faith (still look forward to such a sign in response to the demand of the unbelievers and) despair as a result of knowing that had Allah so willed, He could have guided all to the Truth.
draft: No, but Allah holds the determination entirely. Do those who internalized faith not realize that if Allah wished, He could guide all people?
hil: No, but to Allah belongs the determination entirely. Do those who believe not realize that if Allah willed, He could guide all people?
compare: No, but Allah holds the determination entirely. Do those who internalized faith not realize that if Allah wished, He could guide all people?

src: Auch gewähre ICH ihnen noch mehr Zeit. Doch Meine Bestrafung ist hart.
ref: And I will give them respite; indeed My secret plan is extremely solid.
draft: Also, I grant them more time. But my punishment is severe.
hil: Also I grant them more time. But my punishment is severe.
compare: Also, I grant them more time. But my punishment is severe.

src: Und der geraden und der ungeraden (Zahl),
ref: The multiple and the one,
draft: "And the even and the odd (number),"
hil: And the even and the odd (number),
compare: "And the even and the odd (number),"

src: Da vergaben Wir ihm dies.
ref: So We forgave him.
draft: We forgave him this.
hil: Thus We forgave him for this.
compare: Thus We forgave him for this.

src: Da kehrte Er Sich ihnen mit Erbarmen zu, auf daß sie sich bekehren möchten. Wahrlich, Allah ist der Gnädige, der Barmherzige.
ref: So He softened towards them that they may repent; for God surely accepts repentance and is merciful.
draft: He turned to them in mercy so that they might repent. Truly, Allah is the Merciful, the Compassionate.
hil: He turned to them in mercy so that they might repent. Verily, Allah is the Merciful, the Compassionate.
compare: He turned to them in mercy so that they might repent. Verily, Allah is the Merciful, the Compassionate.

src: O die ihr glaubt, wenn ihr auf eine festgesetzte Frist, einer vom anderen, eine Geldschuld aufnehmt, dann schreibt es auf. Und ein Schreiber soll (es) für euch gerecht aufschreiben.
ref: O believers, when you negotiate a debt for a fixed term, draw up an agreement in writing, though better it would be to have a scribe write it faithfully down; and no scribe should refuse to write as God has taught him, and write what the borrower dictates, and have fear of God, his Lord, and not leave out a thing.
draft: O you who believe, when you incur a debt for a specified term, write it down between you. And let a scribe write [it] down for you in justice.
hil: O you who believe! When you incur a debt for a specified term, write it down between you. And let a scribe write [it] down for you in justice.
compare: O you who believe, when you incur a debt for a specified term, write it down between you. And let a scribe write [it] down for you in justice.

src: Gärten und Beerengehege
ref: Orchards and vineyards,
draft: Gardens and berry enclosures.
hil: Gardens and berry enclosures
compare: Gardens and berry enclosures.

src: Habt ihr etwa keinen Einblick?!
ref: Can you still not comprehend?
draft: Do you have no insight, by any chance?!
hil: Do you have no insight, by any chance?!
compare: Do you have no insight, by any chance?!

src: Und dein Herr wird dir wahrlich geben, und dann wirst du zufrieden sein.
ref: For your Lord will certainly give you, and you will be content.
draft: And your Lord will surely give to you, and then you will be satisfied.
hil: And your Lord will surely give to you, and then you will be content.
compare: And your Lord will surely give to you, and then you will be content.

src: Aber nein! Vielmehr sagen sie: "(Das ist) ein Bündel von wirren Träumen. Nein! Vielmehr hat er ihn ersonnen. Nein! Vielmehr ist er ein Dichter. So soll er uns ein Zeichen bringen, so wie die Früheren gesandt wurden."
ref: Yet they say: "These are only confused dreams," or rather: "He has invented them;" or: "He is only a poet. Let him therefore bring a miracle to us as the earlier (apostles) were sent with."
draft: But no! Rather, they say: "(That is) a bundle of confused dreams. No! Rather, he has conceived it. No! Rather, he is a poet. So he should bring us a sign, just like the way the ancients were sent."
hil: "But no! Rather, they say: "(That is) a bundle of confused dreams. No! Rather, he has fabricated it. No! Rather, he is a poet. So, he should bring us a sign in the manner that it used to be sent out."
compare: But no! Rather, they say: "(That is) a bundle of confused dreams. No! Rather, he has conceived it. No! Rather, he is a poet. So he should bring us a sign, just like the way the ancients were sent."

src: Und gebt den Frauen ihre Brautgabe als Schenkung.
ref: Give women their dowries graciously.
draft: And give women their bridal gift as a present.
hil: And give women their bridal gift as a gift.
compare: And give women their bridal gift as a gift.

src: Und bestimmt wirst du sie unter allen Menschen am gierigsten nach Leben finden, und mehr noch als diejenigen, die Götzen anbeten.
ref: You will see they are covetous of life more than other men, even more than those who practise idolatry.
draft: And certainly you will find her to be the most eager for life among all people, and even more so than those who worship idols.
hil: And you will certainly find her to be the most eager for life among all people, even more so than those who worship idols.
compare: And you will certainly find her to be the most eager for life among all people, even more so than those who worship idols.

src: "Mein Söhnchen! Sollte es sich auch nur um das Gewicht eines Senfkorns handeln, das sich in einem Stein, in den Himmeln oder auf Erden befinden sollte, ALLAH bringt sie. Gewiß, ALLAH ist allgütig, allkundig.
ref: 'O my son, if it should be but the weight of one grain of mustard-seed, and though it be in a rock, or in the heavens, or in the earth, God shall bring it forth; surely God is All-subtle, All-aware.
draft: "My little son! Even if it's only the weight of a mustard seed, that is in a rock, in the heavens or on earth, ALLAH will bring it forth. Indeed, ALLAH is kind and all-knowing."
hil: My little son! Even if it be (anything) equal to the weight of a mustard seed, and though it be in a rock, or in the heavens, or in the earth, Allah will bring it forth. Verily, Allah is Kind and All-Knowing.
compare: My little son! Even if it be (anything) equal to the weight of a mustard seed, and though it be in a rock, or in the heavens, or in the earth, Allah will bring it forth. Verily, Allah is Kind and All-Knowing.

src: Ich will auch nicht (einfach) euch widersprechen im Hinblick auf das, was ich euch verbiete.
ref: I have no desire to do what I forbid you from doing.
draft: I don't want to (simply) contradict you with regard to what I forbid you too.
hil: I do not want to contradict you (easily) with regard to what I forbid you.
compare: I don't want to (simply) contradict you with regard to what I forbid you too.

src: Und die Berge wie Wolleflocken sein werden,
ref: The mountains like the tufts of (carded) wool,
draft: And the mountains will be like woolen flakes.
hil: "And the mountains will be like woolen flakes."
compare: And the mountains will be like woolen flakes.

src: Und ihre Zungen behaupten lügnerisch, daß für sie das Beste bestimmt ist.
ref: Their tongues utter falsehoods (when they say) the finest of wages shall be theirs.
draft: And their tongues falsely assert that the best is determined for them.
hil: "And their tongues falsely assert that the best is determined for them."
compare: And their tongues falsely assert that the best is determined for them.

src: Diejenigen aber, die sich um Unsertwillen abmühen, werden Wir ganz gewiß Unsere Wege leiten. Und Allah ist wahrlich mit den Gutes Tuenden.
ref: And those who strove in Our way – We shall surely show them Our paths; and indeed Allah is with the virtuous.
draft: But those who strive for Our sake, We will surely guide them to Our paths. And Allah is indeed with the doers of good.
hil: But those who strive for Our sake, Allah will guide them to His way. And Allah is indeed with the doers of good.
compare: But those who strive for Our sake, Allah will guide them to His way. And Allah is indeed with the doers of good.

src: So diene Ihm und verlasse dich auf Ihn.
ref: So worship Him (O Muhammad SAW) and put your trust in Him.
draft: Serve Him and rely on Him.
hil: So worship Him, trusting in Him.
compare: So worship Him, trusting in Him.

src: Und solltet ihr darin niemanden finden, dann betretet sie nicht, bis euch Erlaubnis gewährt wird.
ref: If you find that no one is in, then do not enter unless you have received permission.
draft: And if you do not find anyone in it, do not enter until you are granted permission.
hil: "And if you do not find anyone in it, do not enter until you are granted permission."
compare: And if you do not find anyone in it, do not enter until you are granted permission.

src: Dann machte ich doch ihnen Da'wa öffentlich,
ref: Then I called them loudly and more openly,
draft: Then I publicly made Da'wa to them.
hil: Then I made public Da'wa to them.
compare: Then I publicly made Da'wa to them.

src: Doch wer ALLAH und Seinem Gesandten widerspricht und ALLAHs Richtlinien überschreitet, den wird ER ins Feuer eintreten lassen, darin wird er ewig bleiben. Und für ihn ist eine erniedrigende Peinigung bestimmt.
ref: Those who disobey God and the Prophet and exceed the bounds of law, will be taken to Hell and abide there for ever and shall suffer despicable punishment.
draft: But whoever contradicts Allah and His Messenger and exceeds the limits of Allah, he will be admitted to the Fire to abide eternally therein, and for him is a humiliating punishment destined.
hil: But whoever contradicts Allah and His Messenger and exceeds the limits of Allah, he will be admitted to the Fire to abide eternally therein, and for him is a humiliating punishment destined.
compare: But whoever contradicts Allah and His Messenger and exceeds the limits of Allah, he will be admitted to the Fire to abide eternally therein, and for him is a humiliating punishment destined.

src: Und Er hat eure Gattinnen, von denen ihr euch durch den Rückenschwur trennt, nicht (wirklich) zu euren Müttern gemacht. Und Er hat eure angenommenen Söhne nicht (wirklich) zu euren Söhnen gemacht.
ref: Neither has He made your wives whom you declare to be like your mothers' backs, your real mothers. [AzZihar is the saying of a husband to his wife, "You are to me like the back of my mother" i.e. You are unlawful for me to approach.], nor has He made your adopted sons your real sons.
draft: And He has not made your wives whom you separate from by [pronouncing] "Divorce" as your mothers. And He has not made your adopted sons [as] your [biological] sons.
hil: And He did not truly make your wives whom you divorce by pronouncing "Divorce" as your mothers. And He did not truly make your adopted sons as your sons.
compare: And He has not made your wives whom you separate from by [pronouncing] "Divorce" as your mothers. And He has not made your adopted sons [as] your [biological] sons.

src: Und ALLAH genügt als Allwissender.
ref: God suffices as Knower.
draft: And Allah suffices as All-Knowing.
hil: And God suffices as All-Knowing.
compare: And Allah suffices as All-Knowing.

src: Die Hölle, in der sie brennen. Welch schlimme Lagerstätte!
ref: Hell; which they shall enter; what an evil resting-place!
draft: The hell in which they burn. What a terrible place of storage!
hil: The hell in which they burn. What a terrible place of storage!
compare: The hell in which they burn. What a terrible place of storage!

src: Als er nun den Ort des Sonnenuntergangs erreichte, fand er, daß sie in einer verschlammten Quelle unterging.
ref: Until, when he reached the setting place of the sun, he found it setting in a spring of black muddy (or hot) water.
draft: When he reached the place where the sun sets, he found that it was sinking into a muddy spring.
hil: As he reached the place of sunset, he found that it was sinking into a muddy spring.
compare: As he reached the place of sunset, he found that it was sinking into a muddy spring.

src: Am Tag, da das Beben einsetzt
ref: The day the convulsive (first blast) shatters convulsively
draft: On the day the earthquake begins.
hil: On the Day when the earthquake begins.
compare: On the day the earthquake begins.

src: Und ER ist Derjenige, Der vom Himmel Wasser hinabsenden ließ. So haben WIR damit Pflanzenwuchs jeder Art ermöglicht, so haben WIR daraus Grünes sprießen lassen, von dem WIR übereinander liegende Saatkörner hervorbrachten. Und aus den Dattelpalmen, aus ihrem Blütenstand (haben WIR hervorgebracht) herunterhängende Dattelbüschel und Dschannat mit Trauben, Oliven und Granatäpfeln - einander ähnelnd und nicht ähnelnd. Betrachtet ihre Früchte, wenn sie Früchte tragen und reif werden. Gewiß, darin sind zweifelsohne Ayat für Menschen, die den Iman verinnerlichen.
ref: And it is He Who sends down water from the sky; so with it We produced all things that grow; hence We produce from it vegetation from which We bring forth grains in clusters; and from the pollen of dates, dense bunches – and gardens of grapes and olives and pomegranates, similar in some ways and unlike in some; look at its fruit when it bears yield, and its ripening; indeed in it are signs for the people who believe.
draft: And HE is the One who sent down water from the sky. In this way, We facilitated the growth of every type of plant and brought forth from it greenery, out of which We brought a multitude of layered grains. And from date palms, from the arrangement of their blossoms (We brought forth) hanging clusters of dates and gardens of grapes, olives, and pomegranates—similar and dissimilar. Look at their fruit when they produce it and ripen. Indeed, in this are signs for people who believe.
hil: HE is the One who sent down water from the sky. In this way, We facilitated the growth of every type of plant and brought forth from it greenery, out of which We brought a multitude of layered grains. And from date palms, from the arrangement of their blossoms (We brought forth) hanging clusters of dates and gardens of grapes, olives, and pomegranates—similar and dissimilar. Look at their fruit when they produce it and ripen. Indeed, in this are signs for people who believe.
compare: And HE is the One who sent down water from the sky. In this way, We facilitated the growth of every type of plant and brought forth from it greenery, out of which We brought a multitude of layered grains. And from date palms, from the arrangement of their blossoms (We brought forth) hanging clusters of dates and gardens of grapes, olives, and pomegranates—similar and dissimilar. Look at their fruit when they produce it and ripen. Indeed, in this are signs for people who believe.

src: Und daß Er der Herr des Sirius ist.
ref: That He is the Lord of Sirius;
draft: And that He is the Lord of Sirius.
hil: And that He is the Lord of Sirius.
compare: And that He is the Lord of Sirius.

src: Und da sie deinem Herrn in einer Reihe vorgeführt werden: «Ihr seid zu Uns gekommen, so wie Wir euch das erste Mal erschaffen haben.
ref: And they will be set before your Lord in (lines as) rows, (and Allah will say): "Now indeed, you have come to Us as We created you the first time.
draft: And when they are presented before your Lord in rows, [He will say], "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time.
hil: And when they are presented before your Lord in rows, [He will say], "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time."
compare: And when they are presented before your Lord in rows, [He will say], "You have certainly come to Us just as We created you the first time.

src: Da löschten Wir ihre Augen aus. "Kostet nun Meine Strafe und Meine Warnungen."
ref: So We blinded their eyes, "Then taste you My Torment and My Warnings."
draft: We extinguished their eyes. "Now taste My punishment and My warnings."
hil: We blinded their eyes and said, 'Now taste My punishment and My warnings.'
compare: We blinded their eyes and said, 'Now taste My punishment and My warnings.'

src: Als zu ihnen die Gesandten von vor ihnen und von hinter ihnen kamen: "Dient niemandem außer ALLAH."
ref: Their apostles came to them one after the other (saying): "Do not worship any one but God."
draft: When the messengers came to them from before them and from behind them, saying: "Serve none but Allah."
hil: When the messengers came to them from before them and from behind them, saying: "Serve none but Allah."
compare: When the messengers came to them from before them and from behind them, saying: "Serve none but Allah."

src: ER wird sie mit Seiner Gnade umgeben. Gewiß, ALLAH ist allvergebend, allgnädig.
ref: God will admit them into His mercy; God is indeed most forgiving and merciful.
draft: "He will surround them with His grace. Surely, Allah is All-Forgiving, All-Merciful."
hil: He will surround them with His grace. Surely, Allah is forgiving and merciful.
compare: "He will surround them with His grace. Surely, Allah is All-Forgiving, All-Merciful."

src: Ist derjenige, der qanit während der Nacht sudschud- und qiyam-vollziehend ist, der sich vor dem Jenseits in Acht nimmt und der sich die Gnade seines HERRN erhofft, (etwa mit dem Kafir gleich)?!
ref: Can one who prays in the watches of the night, bowing in homage or standing attentive, fearful of the life to come, and hoping for the mercy of his Lord, (be like one who does not)?
draft: Is the one who is obedient during the night while performing Sajdah and Qiyam (prayer positions), who is cautious of the afterlife and hopeful of the mercy of his Lord, equal to the disbeliever?!
hil: Is the one who is obedient during the night while performing Sajdah and Qiyam (prayer positions), who is cautious of the afterlife and hopeful of the mercy of his Lord, equal to the disbeliever?!
compare: Is the one who is obedient during the night while performing Sajdah and Qiyam (prayer positions), who is cautious of the afterlife and hopeful of the mercy of his Lord, equal to the disbeliever?!

src: Ausgenommen der auserwählten Diener Gottes.
ref: Other than the chosen creatures of God.
draft: Excluding the chosen servants of God.
hil: Excluding the chosen servants of God.
compare: Excluding the chosen servants of God.

src: Wir werden es gewiß nicht betreten, bis sie aus ihm herausgehen.
ref: We will not enter it until they leave it.
draft: We certainly won't go in until they come out of it.
hil: We will certainly not enter it until they come out of it.
compare: We certainly won't go in until they come out of it.

src: Allah verfährt barmherzig mit euch.
ref: Surely God is compassionate to you.
draft: Allah deals mercifully with you.
hil: Allah deals mercifully with you.
compare: Allah deals mercifully with you.

src: Schau, wie Wir die einen von ihnen vor den anderen auszeichnen; aber das Jenseits ist wahrlich größer an Rangstufen und größer an Auszeichnungen.
ref: "See, how We favour one over the other; and in life to come are higher ranks and favours greater still.
draft: Look how We distinguish some of them over others; but the Hereafter is truly greater in ranks and greater in distinctions.
hil: Look how We distinguish some of them over others; but the Hereafter is truly greater in ranks and greater in distinctions.
compare: Look how We distinguish some of them over others; but the Hereafter is truly greater in ranks and greater in distinctions.

src: Beide rannten dann zur Tür und sie zerriß sein Hemd von hinten, dann stießen beide auf ihren Ehemann an der Tür.
ref: Both of them raced to the door, and she (grabbed and) rent his shirt from behind.
draft: Both then ran to the door and she tore his shirt from behind, then both pushed against her husband at the door.
hil: Both then ran to the door and she tore his shirt from behind, then both pushed against her husband at the door.
compare: Both then ran to the door and she tore his shirt from behind, then both pushed against her husband at the door.

src: DU bist Unser Maula, so leiste uns Beistand gegen die kufr-betreibenden Leute!"
ref: And help us against the people of the unbelievers.
draft: "You are our Maula, so give us support against the kufr-promoting people!"
hil: You are our Maula, so give us support against those who engage in kufr!
compare: "You are our Maula, so give us support against the kufr-promoting people!"

src: Nein! Vielmehr haben Wir diesen da und ihren Vätern Nießbrauch gewährt, bis sie ein langes Leben geführt haben.
ref: We allowed them and their fathers time to enjoy till the very end of their lives.
draft: No! Rather, We have granted this one and their forefathers the usufruct until they have led a long life.
hil: Rather, We have granted this one and their forefathers the usufruct until they have led a long life.
compare: No! Rather, We have granted this one and their forefathers the usufruct until they have led a long life.

src: Als die Karawane aufgebrochen war, sprach ihr Vater: "Wahrlich, ich spüre den Geruch Yusufs, auch wenn ihr mich für schwachsinnig haltet."
ref: The caravan departed (from Egypt) and Jacob said (at home): "Say not that I am in my dotage, but I get the smell of Joseph."
draft: When the caravan had set off, her father said, "Truly, I can smell Joseph's scent even if you think I'm foolish."
hil: When the caravan had set off, her father said, 'Truly, I can smell Joseph's scent even if you think I'm foolish.'
compare: When the caravan had set off, her father said, 'Truly, I can smell Joseph's scent even if you think I'm foolish.'

src: So ließ der Satan sie diesbezüglich Fehler begehen, so brachte er sie hinaus von dem, wo sie sich befanden. Und WIR sagten: "Steigt ab!
ref: Then the Satan caused the twain to slip on account thereof, and drave them forth from that which the twain were in.
draft: So the Satan let them make mistakes in this regard, so he brought them out of where they were. And we said: "Descend!
hil: So the Satan let them make mistakes in this regard, so he brought them out of where they were. And We said: "Descend!"
compare: So the Satan let them make mistakes in this regard, so he brought them out of where they were. And we said: "Descend!

src: Auch Musa wurde der Lüge bezichtigt, so gewährte ICH den Kafir noch längere Zeit, dann richtete ICH sie zugrunde.
ref: Moses was also accused of lies. So I allowed the infidels respite and then seized them.
draft: Also Musa was accused of lying, so I granted the Kafir more time, then I destroyed them.
hil: Musa was also accused of lying, so I granted the Kafir more time, then I destroyed them.
compare: Also Musa was accused of lying, so I granted the Kafir more time, then I destroyed them.

src: Aber sie verleugnen den Erbarmer.
ref: But they do not believe in Ar-Rahman.
draft: But they deny the Merciful.
hil: "But they deny the Merciful."
compare: But they deny the Merciful.

src: Soll ich etwa andere außer Ihm zu Göttern nehmen?
ref: “What! Shall I appoint Gods other than Allah?
draft: Should I take others besides Him as gods?
hil: Should I take others besides Him as gods?
compare: Should I take others besides Him as gods?

src: Und bittet euren HERRN um Vergebung, dann seid Ihm gegenüber reumütig!
ref: "Beg your Lord to forgive you, and turn to Him.
draft: And ask your LORD for forgiveness, then be repentant towards Him!
hil: And seek forgiveness from your Lord, then turn to Him in repentance.
compare: And seek forgiveness from your Lord, then turn to Him in repentance.

src: Alles geschieht zu einem vorbestimmten Termin.
ref: For every age there is a law.
draft: All happens at a predetermined time.
hil: Everything happens at an appointed time.
compare: Everything happens at an appointed time.

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Bemüht euch eurer Verpflichtung ALLAH gegenüber nachzukommen und seid Zeugen in gerechter Weise!
ref: O you who believe, stand up as witnesses for God in all fairness, and do not let the hatred of a people deviate you from justice.
draft: You, who have internalized the imam! Make an effort to fulfill your obligations to ALLAH and be witnesses in a just manner!
hil: You who have internalized faith! Strive to fulfill your obligation to ALLAH and be witnesses in a just manner!
compare: You who have internalized faith! Strive to fulfill your obligation to ALLAH and be witnesses in a just manner!

src: Darum wartet ab; seht, ich warte auch mit euch ab."
ref: So watch and wait (for the sign); I am waiting and expecting with you."
draft: Therefore wait; see, I also wait with you."
hil: Therefore, wait; see, I am also waiting with you.
compare: Therefore, wait; see, I am also waiting with you.

src: Dem Allvergebenden der Verfehlung und Dem Annehmenden der Reue, Dem Harten im Strafen, Dem mit den Wohltaten. Es gibt keine Gottheit außer Ihm. Zu Ihm ist das Werden.
ref: The Forgiver of sin, and the Most Acceptor of Repentance, the Severe in Punishing, the Greatly Rewarding; there is no God except Him; towards Him only is the return.
draft: To the All-Forgiving of the fault and the Accepting of the repentance, the Harsh in punishment, the with the blessings. There is no deity except Him. To Him is the becoming.
hil: To the All-Forgiving of the fault and the Accepting of the repentance, the Harsh in punishment, the with the blessings. There is no deity except Him. To Him is the becoming.
compare: To the All-Forgiving of the fault and the Accepting of the repentance, the Harsh in punishment, the with the blessings. There is no deity except Him. To Him is the becoming.

src: Allah ist dessen, was ihr tut, Kundig.
ref: This will absolve you of some of your sins; and God is cognisant of all you do.
draft: Allah is aware of what you do.
hil: Allah is aware of what you do.
compare: Allah is aware of what you do.

src: Diejenigen aber, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, befinden sich in den Gärten des Paradieses. Sie haben bei ihrem Herrn, was sie wollen.
ref: And those who believe and work righteous works will be in meadows of the Gardens theirs will be whatsoever they list, in the presence of their Lord.
draft: Those, however, who believe and do good deeds, are in the gardens of paradise. They have with their Lord whatever they wish.
hil: Those who believe and do good deeds will be in the gardens of paradise, beneath which rivers flow, and they will abide there forever. That is the true promise of God which they will have with their Lord. And who is more truthful than God in statement?
compare: Those, however, who believe and do good deeds, are in the gardens of paradise. They have with their Lord whatever they wish.

src: Derjenige, den Allah rechtleitet, ist auf dem rechten Weg. Diejenigen aber, die Er irreführt, sind wahrlich jene, die verloren haben.
ref: He alone is guided whom God shows the way; and whom He leads astray is surely lost.
draft: The one whom Allah guides, is on the right path. But those whom he misleads, they are indeed the lost ones.
hil: Whomever Allah guides, is the guided one. And whomever He sends astray, these are the losers.
compare: The one whom Allah guides, is on the right path. But those whom he misleads, they are indeed the lost ones.

src: Ihr wendet euch jedoch davon ab.
ref: To which you pay no heed.
draft: You, however, turn away from it.
hil: But you turn away from it.
compare: You, however, turn away from it.

src: Siehst du!
ref: What thinkest thou?
draft: See!
hil: See!
compare: See!

src: Und sie ziehen sich den Zorn Allahs zu, und für sie ist die Armut vorgeschrieben, weil sie Allahs Zeichen verleugneten und die Propheten ungerechterweise ermordeten.
ref: That is because they have been disbelieving in the signs of Allah, and slaying the prophets without justice.
draft: And they incur the wrath of Allah, for them is poverty prescribed, because they denied Allah's signs and wrongly killed the prophets.
hil: And they incur the wrath of Allah, poverty is prescribed for them, because they denied Allah's signs and unjustly killed the prophets.
compare: And they incur the wrath of Allah, for them is poverty prescribed, because they denied Allah's signs and wrongly killed the prophets.

src: Allah weiß, was ihr offen tut und was ihr heimlich tut.
ref: God knows what you reveal and what you hide.
draft: Allah knows what you do openly and what you do in secret.
hil: Allah knows what you do openly and what you do in secret.
compare: Allah knows what you do openly and what you do in secret.

src: Am Tag, da du siehst, wie den gläubigen Männern und den gläubigen Frauen ihr Licht vor ihnen und zu ihrer Rechten eilt: «Eine frohe Botschaft für euch heute: Gärten, unter denen Bäche fließen; darin werdet ihr ewig weilen. Das ist der großartige Erfolg.»
ref: The day when you will see the believing men and believing women, that their light runs before them and on their right – it being said to them, “This day, the best tidings for you are the Gardens beneath which rivers flow – abide in it forever; this is the greatest success.”
draft: On the day that you see the believing men and believing women, with their light proceeding before them and on their right: "Good news for you today, gardens beneath which rivers flow, in which you will abide eternally." That is the great attainment.
hil: On the day when you see the believing men and believing women with their light proceeding before them and on their right, good tidings are yours today: gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein you will abide forever. That is the great attainment.
compare: On the day that you see the believing men and believing women, with their light proceeding before them and on their right: "Good news for you today, gardens beneath which rivers flow, in which you will abide eternally." That is the great attainment.

src: (Andere) sagten: "Euer Herr kennt die (Zeit), die ihr verbracht habt, am besten.
ref: "Your Lord knows best," they said, "how long you have stayed.
draft: (Other) said: "Your Lord knows best the (time) you have spent."
hil: (Other) said: 'Your Lord knows best the (time) you have spent.'
compare: (Other) said: "Your Lord knows best the (time) you have spent."

src: ER ist Derjenige, Der euch die Nacht einrichtete, um darin zu ruhen, sowie den Tag mit Licht.
ref: It is He who made the night for you to rest, and made the day enlightening.
draft: He is the one who set up the night for you to rest in and the day with light.
hil: And it is He who set up the night for you to rest in and the day with light.
compare: And it is He who set up the night for you to rest in and the day with light.

src: Da erhörten Wir ihn und schenkten ihm Jahya und heilten seine Frau.
ref: So We heard him and gave him John, and cured his wife (of barrenness).
draft: We heard him and gave him Jahya and healed his wife.
hil: Therefore, We heard him and gave him Jahya and healed his wife.
compare: Therefore, We heard him and gave him Jahya and healed his wife.

src: Esst von den Tay-yibat und tut gottgefällig Gutes!
ref: Eat of the Taiyibat [all kinds of Halal (legal) foods which Allah has made legal (meat of slaughtered eatable animals, milk products, fats, vegetables, fruits, etc.], and do righteous deeds.
draft: "Eat from the Tay-yibat and do good deeds pleasing to God!"
hil: Eat from the good things you have earned and from what We have produced for you from the earth, and do good deeds pleasing to God!
compare: Eat from the good things you have earned and from what We have produced for you from the earth, and do good deeds pleasing to God!

src: Und sie sagen: «O weh uns! Das ist der Tag des Gerichtes!»
ref: And they will say: Ah! woe be Unto us! this is the Day of Requital.
draft: And they say, "Woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!"
hil: "And they say, 'Woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!'"
compare: And they say, "Woe to us! This is the Day of Judgment!"

src: Auf Ihn ver lassen sich diejenigen, die sich (überhaupt auf jemanden) verlassen.
ref: The trusting place their trust in Him."
draft: Those who rely on someone at all, rely on him.
hil: Those who rely on someone at all, rely on him.
compare: Those who rely on someone at all, rely on him.

src: Und wen ALLAH irre gehen läßt, für den wirst du keinen Weg (zum Iman) finden.
ref: For them who are not given the guidance by God, you will never find a way.
draft: And whoever Allah leads astray, you will not find a way (to faith) for them.
hil: And if Allah should let someone go astray, you will not find a way (to faith) for them.
compare: And whoever Allah leads astray, you will not find a way (to faith) for them.

src: Solcherart erwecken WIR die Toten, damit ihr euch entsinnt.
ref: Similarly, We shall raise up the dead, so that you may remember or take heed.
draft: Such we awaken the dead so that you remember.
hil: Such We resurrect the dead so that you may remember.
compare: Such We resurrect the dead so that you may remember.

src: ALLAH gehört alles, was in den Himmeln und was auf Erden ist. Und gewiß, bereits haben WIR denjenigen, denen die Schrift vor euch zuteil wurde, sowie euch angewiesen: "Handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber! Und solltet ihr Kufr betreiben, so gehört ALLAH gewiß alles, was in den Himmeln und was auf Erden ist." Und ALLAH bleibt immer absolut autark, alllobenswürdig.
ref: And to Allah only belongs all whatever is in the heavens and all whatever is in the earth; and indeed We have commanded those who received the Books before you, and commanded you, that keep fearing Allah; and if you disbelieve, undoubtedly to Allah only belongs all whatever is in the heavens and all whatever is in the earth; and Allah is Independent, Worthy Of All Praise.
draft: ALLAH owns everything that is in the heavens and on the earth. And certainly, WE have instructed those to whom the scripture was given before you, as well as you, to "act with Taqwa towards ALLAH! And if you commit Kufr, then surely ALLAH possesses everything that is in the heavens and on the earth." And ALLAH always remains absolutely self-sufficient and praiseworthy.
hil: ALLAH owns everything in the heavens and on the earth. Indeed, WE have already instructed those whom the scripture was given before you, as well as you, to "act with Taqwa towards ALLAH! And if you commit disbelief, then surely ALLAH owns everything in the heavens and on the earth." And ALLAH always remains absolutely self-sufficient and praiseworthy.
compare: ALLAH owns everything that is in the heavens and on the earth. And certainly, WE have instructed those to whom the scripture was given before you, as well as you, to "act with Taqwa towards ALLAH! And if you commit Kufr, then surely ALLAH possesses everything that is in the heavens and on the earth." And ALLAH always remains absolutely self-sufficient and praiseworthy.

src: Dann sing das Lob deines Herrn und bitte Ihn um Vergebung. Siehe, Er wendet sich gnädig wieder zu.
ref: Then proclaim the Purity of your Lord while praising Him, and seek forgiveness from Him; indeed He is the Most Acceptor of Repentance.
draft: Then sing the praise of your Lord and ask Him for forgiveness. Behold, He turns back graciously.
hil: Then glorify your Lord and seek His forgiveness. Verily, He is relenting.
compare: Then sing the praise of your Lord and ask Him for forgiveness. Behold, He turns back graciously.

src: Das sind die, von denen Gott weiß, was in ihrem Herzen ist. Wende dich von ihnen ab, ermahne sie und sprich zu ihnen über sie selbst eindringliche Worte.
ref: The secrets of their hearts are well known to Allah; so avoid them and explain to them, and speak to them clearly in their affairs.
draft: These are the ones of whom God knows what is in their hearts. Turn away from them, admonish them, and speak to them with penetrating words about themselves.
hil: These are the ones of whom God knows what is in their hearts. Turn away from them, admonish them, and speak penetrating words to them about themselves.
compare: These are the ones of whom God knows what is in their hearts. Turn away from them, admonish them, and speak to them with penetrating words about themselves.

src: Er hat doch einen Vater, der ein Greis ist, so nimm einen von uns an seiner Stelle fest.
ref: Verily, he has an old father (who will grieve for him); so take one of us in his place.
draft: He does have a father who is an old man, so take one of us instead.
hil: "He does have a father who is an old man, so take one of us instead."
compare: "He does have a father who is an old man, so take one of us instead."

src: Aber nein, er ist mit der Wahrheit gekommen und hat die Gesandten bestätigt.
ref: Not in the least. He has brought the truth and confirmed the other messengers.
draft: But no, he came with the truth and confirmed the messengers.
hil: But no, he has come with the truth and confirmed the messengers.
compare: But no, he has come with the truth and confirmed the messengers.

src: Und sie fragen dich nach Dhul-qarnain.
ref: They will question thee concerning Dhool Karnain.
draft: And they ask you about Dhul-Qarnain.
hil: They ask you about Dhul-Qarnain.
compare: And they ask you about Dhul-Qarnain.

src: Fir'auns und der Tamud?
ref: Of Pharaoh and Thamud come to you?
draft: Fir'aun and the Tamud?
hil: And Pharaoh and the Tamud?
compare: Fir'aun and the Tamud?

src: Also wenn die Augen strahlen,
ref: Yet when the eyes are dazzled,
draft: Also, when the eyes shine,
hil: Thus, when the eyes shine,
compare: Also, when the eyes shine,

src: Diese haben ihre Belohnung bei ihrem HERRN. Gewiß, ALLAH ist schnell im Zur-Rechenschaft-Ziehen.
ref: Their reward is verily with their Lord; and swift is the reckoning of God!
draft: They will receive their reward from their LORD for sure, ALLAH is quick in taking account.
hil: They will receive their reward from their LORD for sure. Indeed, ALLAH is quick in taking account.
compare: They will receive their reward from their LORD for sure, ALLAH is quick in taking account.

src: Sag: O ihr Menschen, wenn ihr über meine Religion im Zweifel seid, so diene ich nicht denjenigen, denen ihr anstatt Allahs dient, sondern ich diene Allah, Der euch abberuft.
ref: Say (O Muhammad SAW): "O you mankind! If you are in doubt as to my religion (Islam), then (know that) I will never worship those whom you worship, besides Allah.
draft: Say: O mankind, if you are in doubt about my religion, then I do not serve those whom you serve instead of Allah, but I serve Allah, Who recalls you.
hil: Say, O people, if you have doubts about my religion, I do not worship those whom you worship besides Allah, but I worship Allah who recalls you.
compare: Say: O mankind, if you are in doubt about my religion, then I do not serve those whom you serve instead of Allah, but I serve Allah, Who recalls you.

src: Und dies zum Schutz vor jedem rebellischen Satan.
ref: Protecting them against every wayward devil,
draft: And this to protect against every rebellious Satan.
hil: And this for protection against every rebellious Satan.
compare: And this for protection against every rebellious Satan.

src: Und WIR umhüllten ihre Herzen mit Bedeckung, damit sie ihn nicht begreifen, und machten ihre Ohren schwerhörig.
ref: And We put covers over their hearts and deafness in their ears that they should not understand it.
draft: And WE enveloped their hearts with covering, so that they should not understand him, and made their ears heavy.
hil: And We shrouded their hearts with veils, lest they comprehend it, and made their ears heavy.
compare: And WE enveloped their hearts with covering, so that they should not understand him, and made their ears heavy.

src: Als die Nacht über ihn hereinbrach, sah er einen Himmelskörper.
ref: Then when the night darkened on him, he beheld a star.
draft: When the night fell upon him, he saw a celestial body.
hil: When the night fell upon him, he saw a celestial body.
compare: When the night fell upon him, he saw a celestial body.

src: So machen Wir die Zeichen klar für ein Volk, das begreift.
ref: In this wise We detail the signs for a people who reflect.
draft: So we make the signs clear to a people who understand.
hil: Thus does Allah make clear to you the signs (of revelation) that you may comprehend.
compare: Thus does Allah make clear to you the signs (of revelation) that you may comprehend.

src: Und die Berge, die du für fest hältst, wirst du wie Wolken dahingehen sehen: Das (ist das) Werk Allahs, Der alles vollendet hat.
ref: You will see the mountains and think they are firmly planted, but they will pass away like flying clouds: Artistry of God who perfected everything.
draft: And the mountains that you consider to be firm, you will see them pass by like clouds. This is the work of Allah, who completes everything.
hil: The mountains that you consider to be firm, you will see them pass by like clouds. This is the work of Allah, who completes everything.
compare: And the mountains that you consider to be firm, you will see them pass by like clouds. This is the work of Allah, who completes everything.

src: Ist nicht zu ihnen der deutliche Beweis dessen gekommen, was in den früheren Blättern steht?
ref: Have not clear proofs come to them in what is contained in the earlier Books?
draft: Has not the clear proof of what is written in the earlier pages come to them?
hil: Has the clear evidence of what is stated in the previous pages not come to them?
compare: Has not the clear proof of what is written in the earlier pages come to them?

src: Als sie dann vor ihn (Yusuf) traten, da sagten sie: "O `Aziz, die Not hat uns und unsere Familie geschlagen, und wir haben Ware von geringem Wert mitgebracht; so gib uns das volle Maß und sei wohltätig gegen uns. Wahrlich, Allah belohnt die Wohltätigen."
ref: Then when they reached in the company of Yusuf they said, “O governor! Calamity has struck us and our household, and we have brought goods of little value, so give us the full measure and be generous to us; undoubtedly Allah rewards the generous.”
draft: When they stood before Yusuf, they said, "Oh, Aziz, hardship has touched us and our family, and we have brought only a small amount of goods, so give us full measure and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable."
hil: They said, 'O Minister, hardship has touched us and our family, and we have brought only a small amount of goods, so give us full measure and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable.'
compare: When they stood before Yusuf, they said, "Oh, Aziz, hardship has touched us and our family, and we have brought only a small amount of goods, so give us full measure and be charitable to us. Indeed, Allah rewards the charitable."

src: Sie sagten: "Bitte für uns deinen Herrn, uns Klarheit zu geben, wie sie sein soll! Die Kühe erscheinen uns (alle) ähnlich.
ref: "Call on your Lord," they said, "to name its variety, as cows be all alike to us.
draft: They said, "Please ask your Lord to clarify for us how it should be! The cows all look alike to us."
hil: They said, 'Please ask your Lord to clarify for us how it should be! The cows all look alike to us.'
compare: They said, "Please ask your Lord to clarify for us how it should be! The cows all look alike to us."

src: Der Tag der Entscheidung ist wahrlich die festgesetzte Zeit für sie alle
ref: The Day of Judgement is your promised day of meeting,
draft: The day of decision is truly the appointed time for all of them.
hil: Verily, the Day of Judgment is the appointed time for all of them.
compare: Verily, the Day of Judgment is the appointed time for all of them.

src: (Es ist) die Befreiung eines Sklaven
ref: To free a neck (from the burden of debt or slavery),
draft: The liberation of a slave.
hil: freeing a slave
compare: The liberation of a slave.

src: Es ziemt dem Allerbarmer nicht, Sich Kinder zu nehmen.
ref: When it does not behove the Merciful to have a son.
draft: "The Most Merciful One should not take children."
hil: It is not appropriate for the Most Merciful to have children.
compare: It is not appropriate for the Most Merciful to have children.

src: Aber niemals werden sie ihn sich wünschen wegen dessen, was ihre Hände vorausgeschickt haben.
ref: And they will never wish there for, because of that which their hands have sent forward.
draft: But they will never desire him because of what their hands have sent ahead.
hil: However, they will never desire him because of what their hands have sent forth.
compare: But they will never desire him because of what their hands have sent ahead.

src: Ist es nur eine, soll sie die Hälfte haben.
ref: If there is only one, she gets one-half.
draft: If there's only one, she should have half.
hil: If there is only one, she should have half.
compare: If there's only one, she should have half.

src: Und sollte eine Schwerbelastete um (die Entlastung von) ihrer Last rufen, der (Gerufene) wird (ihr) davon nichts abnehmen, und selbst dann nicht, wäre er von den Nahverwandten.
ref: Even if one weighted down calls for help with its burden, nothing can be lifted from it, even if they were related.
draft: And if a heavily burdened person calls for (relief from) their burden, the (person called) will not take any of it away from them, not even if they were a close relative.
hil: And if a heavily burdened person calls for (relief from) their burden, the (person called) will not take any of it away from them, not even if they were a close relative.
compare: And if a heavily burdened person calls for (relief from) their burden, the (person called) will not take any of it away from them, not even if they were a close relative.

src: Allah ist Allhörend, Allsehend.
ref: Truly, Allah is Ever All-Hearer, All-Seer.
draft: Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.
hil: Allah is All-Hearing and All-Seeing.
compare: Allah is All-Hearing, All-Seeing.

src: Und wir haben bestimmt gesündigt.»
ref: We were definitely in the wrong.”
draft: "And we have certainly sinned."
hil: "Certainly, we have sinned".
compare: "Certainly, we have sinned".

src: Allah wird euer Tun sehen, und (auch) Sein Gesandter und die Gläubigen.
ref: Allah will see your deeds, and (so will) His Messenger and the believers.
draft: "Allah will see your actions, and (also) His Messenger and the believers."
hil: God will see your conduct, and so will His apostle and the faithful.
compare: "Allah will see your actions, and (also) His Messenger and the believers."

src: Und bestimme für uns im Diesseits Gutes, und auch im Jenseits.
ref: Enjoin for us good in the world, and good in the world to come.
draft: And determine good for us in the world, and also in the hereafter.
hil: Determine good for us in this world, and also in the hereafter.
compare: And determine good for us in the world, and also in the hereafter.

src: Allah schämt Sich nicht, ein Gleichnis auch nur mit einer Mücke oder mit etwas darüber (hinaus) zu prägen. Was nun diejenigen angeht, die glauben, so wissen sie, daß es die Wahrheit von ihrem Herrn ist. Was aber diejenigen angeht, die ungläubig sind, so sagen sie: "Was will denn Allah damit als Gleichnis?" Er läßt damit viele in die Irre gehen und leitet viele damit recht, doch läßt Er damit nur die Frevler in die Irre gehen,
ref: Surely Allah is not ashamed to set forth any parable-- (that of) a gnat or any thing above that; then as for those who believe, they know that it is the truth from their Lord, and as for those who disbelieve, they say: What is it that Allah means by this parable: He causes many to err by it and many He leads aright by it! but He does not cause to err by it (any) except the transgressors,
draft: "Allah is not ashamed to set forth a parable even of a mosquito above it. As for those who believe, they know that it is the truth from their Lord. But as for those who disbelieve, they say: What does Allah wish to achieve by such a parable? He causes many to err by it, and many He leads aright thereby. And He sends astray thereby only those who are rebellious."
hil: Allah is not ashamed to set forth a parable, even of a mosquito, or something beyond it. As for those who believe, they know that it is the truth from their Lord. But those who disbelieve say, 'What does Allah mean by this parable?' By it, Allah leads many astray, and many He guides, but He leads astray only the wicked.
compare: Allah is not ashamed to set forth a parable, even of a mosquito, or something beyond it. As for those who believe, they know that it is the truth from their Lord. But those who disbelieve say, 'What does Allah mean by this parable?' By it, Allah leads many astray, and many He guides, but He leads astray only the wicked.

src: Diejenigen aber, die ungläubig waren, (bekommen zu hören): «Sind euch nicht meine Zeichen immer wieder verlesen worden?
ref: As for the infidels, (it will be said): "Were not My messages read out to you?
draft: But those who were unbelievers (will hear): "Have not my signs been recited to you again and again?"
hil: But those who disbelieved (will hear): 'Have not my signs been recited to you again and again?'
compare: But those who disbelieved (will hear): 'Have not my signs been recited to you again and again?'

src: Die, denen ihr anstelle Gottes dient, können euch keinen Lebensunterhalt bringen.
ref: Surely those you worship other than God have no power over your means of livelihood.
draft: The ones you serve instead of God cannot provide for your livelihood.
hil: The ones whom you worship instead of God cannot provide for your livelihood.
compare: The ones whom you worship instead of God cannot provide for your livelihood.

src: Und den, dem Wir ein langes Leben geben, setzen wir körperlichem Verfall aus.
ref: Whoever reaches old age, We reverse in natural disposition.
draft: And the one to whom we give a long life, we subject to physical decay.
hil: And whomever We bring to an old age, We reverse him in the creation; so do they not understand?
compare: And the one to whom we give a long life, we subject to physical decay.

src: Diejenigen, die den ehrbaren Ehefrauen (Untreue) vorwerfen und hierauf nicht vier Zeugen beibringen, die geißelt mit achtzig Hieben und nehmt von ihnen niemals mehr eine Zeugenaussage an - das sind die (wahren) Frevler -,
ref: Those who defame chaste women and do not bring four witnesses should be punished with eighty lashes, and their testimony should not be accepted afterwards, for they are profligates,
draft: Those who accuse honorable wives of adultery and do not bring four witnesses should be punished with eighty lashes and never accept their testimony again - they are the true wrongdoers -
hil: Those who accuse chaste women [of adultery] and then do not produce four witnesses - flog them with eighty lashes and do not accept from them testimony ever after. Indeed, they are the defiantly disobedient.
compare: Those who accuse chaste women [of adultery] and then do not produce four witnesses - flog them with eighty lashes and do not accept from them testimony ever after. Indeed, they are the defiantly disobedient.

src: Und verzehrt ihn nicht maßlos und ihrem Erwachsenwerden zuvorkommend.
ref: And do not consume it extravagantly or hastily before they grow up.
draft: And do not consume it excessively and proactively for their adulthood.
hil: Do not consume it excessively and be considerate to their coming of age.
compare: Do not consume it excessively and be considerate to their coming of age.

src: Alsdann sagte einer von ihnen: "Tötet Yusuf nicht, sondern werft ihn in die Tiefe des Brunnens hinein, so finden ihn einige Reisende, solltet ihr dies tun wollen."
ref: One of them said: "If you must do so, then do not kill Joseph, but throw him into an unused well. Some passing caravan may rescue him."
draft: Then one of them said: "Do not kill Yusuf, but throw him into the depths of the well, so some travelers may find him, if you want to do this."
hil: Then one of them said: 'Do not kill Yusuf, but cast him into the depths of the well so that some travelers may find him if you want to do this.'
compare: Then one of them said: "Do not kill Yusuf, but throw him into the depths of the well, so some travelers may find him, if you want to do this."

src: Erklärt nicht für haram die Tay-yibat dessen, was ALLAH euch für halal erklärte, und übertretet nicht!
ref: Make not unlawful the Taiyibat (all that is good as regards foods, things, deeds, beliefs, persons, etc.) which Allah has made lawful to you, and transgress not.
draft: Do not declare as haram the Tay-yibat of what Allah has declared halal to you, and do not transgress.
hil: Do not declare as haram the good things of what Allah has declared lawful for you, and do not transgress.
compare: Do not declare as haram the good things of what Allah has declared lawful for you, and do not transgress.

src: Und sie erkundigen sich bei dir: "Ist es wahr?"
ref: Yet they want to be informed if it is true.
draft: And they ask you: "Is it true?"
hil: And they inquire of you, "Is it true?"
compare: And they ask you: "Is it true?"

src: Eine Gruppe davon pflegte er zu unterdrücken, indem er ihre Söhne erschlug und ihre Frauen leben ließ.
ref: He persecuted a group of them, slaughtering their sons, while sparing their daughters.
draft: One group of them he used to suppress by killing their sons and letting their women live.
hil: A group of them he used to oppress by killing their sons and leaving their wives alive.
compare: A group of them he used to oppress by killing their sons and leaving their wives alive.

src: Ein Buch, dessen Zeichen im einzelnen dargelegt sind, als arabischer Koran, für Leute, die Bescheid wissen,
ref: A Book whose verses have been distinguished and explained, a lucid discourse for people who understand,
draft: A book whose characters are explicated in detail, like an Arabic Quran, for people who know.
hil: A book whose signs are detailed, like the Arabic Quran, for people who understand.
compare: A book whose signs are detailed, like the Arabic Quran, for people who understand.

src: Und sie fragen dich nach einer Fatwa, sag: "ALLAH gibt euch Fatwa hinsichtlich der Kalala. Wenn ein Mensch stirbt, ohne daß er Kinder (oder Eltern), aber eine Schwester (väterlicherseits) hinterläßt, so bekommt sie die Hälfte dessen, was er hinterläßt, und er beerbt sie, wenn sie keine Kinder (oder Eltern) hinterläßt.
ref: They ask you for a ruling. Say, ‘Allah gives you a ruling concerning the kalalah: If a man dies and has no children [or parents], but has a sister, for her shall be a half of what he leaves, and he shall inherit from her if she has no children.
draft: And they ask you for a fatwa, say: "ALLAH gives you a fatwa regarding the kalala. If a person dies without leaving children (or parents), but leaves a sister (paternal), then she receives half of what he leaves behind, and he inherits her if she does not leave children (or parents) behind.
hil: And if they ask you for a fatwa, say: \"Allah gives you a fatwa regarding the Kalala. If a person dies without leaving children (or parents), but leaves a sister (paternal), then she receives half of what he leaves behind, and he inherits her if she does not leave children (or parents) behind.\""
compare: And if they ask you for a fatwa, say: \"Allah gives you a fatwa regarding the Kalala. If a person dies without leaving children (or parents), but leaves a sister (paternal), then she receives half of what he leaves behind, and he inherits her if she does not leave children (or parents) behind.\""

src: Laß die Ungläubigen nicht meinen, sie hätten (Uns) übertroffen.
ref: The infidels should not think that they can bypass (the law of God).
draft: Let not the unbelievers think that they have surpassed (Us).
hil: Do not let the disbelievers think that they have surpassed us.
compare: Do not let the disbelievers think that they have surpassed us.

src: "Yusuf, du Wahrhaftiger! Gib uns eine Antwort über sieben fette Kühe, die von sieben mageren Kühen gefressen werden, und über sieben grüne Ähren und (sieben) andere Vertrocknete, vielleicht kehre ich zu den Menschen zurück, vielleicht wissen sie es dann."
ref: (And coming to the prison) he said: "O Joseph the truthful, tell us (the meaning of) seven fat cows being devoured by seven lean ones, and seven green ears of corn and seven seared, that I may go back to the people and tell them."
draft: "Yusuf, you truthful one! Give us an answer about seven fat cows being eaten by seven skinny cows, and about seven green ears of corn and (seven) others that are dried up. Perhaps I will return to the people, and maybe they will know then."
hil: Yusuf, you truthful one! Give us an answer about seven fat cows being eaten by seven skinny cows, and about seven green ears of corn and (seven) others that are dried up. Perhaps I will return to the people, and maybe they will know then.
compare: "Yusuf, you truthful one! Give us an answer about seven fat cows being eaten by seven skinny cows, and about seven green ears of corn and (seven) others that are dried up. Perhaps I will return to the people, and maybe they will know then."

src: Ihr dient anstatt Allahs nur Götzen und schafft (dabei nur) ungeheuerliche Lüge. Gewiß, diejenigen, denen ihr anstatt Allahs dient, vermögen euch nicht zu versor gen.
ref: You only serve, apart from God, idols and you create a calumny; those you serve, apart from God, have no power to provide for you.
draft: You worship only idols instead of Allah and create (only) immense lies. Indeed, those whom you serve besides Allah cannot provide for you.
hil: You worship only idols instead of Allah and create (only) immense lies. Indeed, those whom you serve besides Allah cannot provide for you.
compare: You worship only idols instead of Allah and create (only) immense lies. Indeed, those whom you serve besides Allah cannot provide for you.

src: Auf Ihn vertraue ich.
ref: In Him I have put my trust.
draft: I trust him.
hil: I place my trust in Him.
compare: I place my trust in Him.

src: (Und auch) acht Tiere zu Paaren: von den Schafen zwei und von den Ziegen zwei. - Sprich: Sind es die beiden Männchen, die Er verboten hat, oder die beiden Weibchen, oder was der Leib der beiden Weibchen enthält?
ref: There are eight pairs, two of the species of sheep and two of goats. Ask them which has He forbidden, the two males or the two females, or what the females carry in their wombs?
draft: (And also) eight animals in pairs: two from the sheep and two from the goats. - Say: Is it the two males that He has forbidden or the two females, or what the bodies of the two females contain?
hil: (And also) eight animals in pairs: two from the sheep and two from the goats. - Say: Are they the two males that He has forbidden, or the two females, or what the bodies of the two females contain?
compare: (And also) eight animals in pairs: two from the sheep and two from the goats. - Say: Is it the two males that He has forbidden or the two females, or what the bodies of the two females contain?

src: Dieser (Quran) ist nichts als eine Ermahnung für die Welten.
ref: This is only a warning for mankind.
draft: "This (Quran) is nothing but a reminder for the worlds."
hil: This (Quran) is nothing but a reminder for the worlds.
compare: "This (Quran) is nothing but a reminder for the worlds."

src: Und den, der an Allah glaubt und recht handelt, wird Er in Gärten führen, durch die Bäche fließen, worin (er) auf ewig verweilen wird. Allah hat ihm wahrlich eine treffliche Versorgung gewährt.
ref: And those who believe in Allah and work righteousness, He will admit to Gardens beneath which Rivers flow, to dwell therein for ever: Allah has indeed granted for them a most excellent Provision.
draft: And he who believes in Allah and acts rightly, He will lead him into gardens with running rivers, wherein he will abide forever. Surely, Allah has granted him an excellent provision.
hil: "And He will admit those who believe in Allah and do righteous deeds into gardens with flowing rivers wherein they will abide eternally. Allah has indeed given him an excellent provision."
compare: And he who believes in Allah and acts rightly, He will lead him into gardens with running rivers, wherein he will abide forever. Surely, Allah has granted him an excellent provision.

src: Und sie sagen: "Er ist ja fürwahr besessen."
ref: They say: “Surely he is afflicted with madness”;
draft: "They say: 'He is indeed possessed.'"
hil: And they said, 'He is indeed possessed.'
compare: And they said, 'He is indeed possessed.'

src: Gewiß, ALLAH ist allumfassend, allwissend.
ref: Allah is All-Sufficient for His creatures' needs, All-Knowing.
draft: Certainly, Allah is all-encompassing, all-knowing.
hil: Surely Allah is all-encompassing, all-knowing.
compare: Certainly, Allah is all-encompassing, all-knowing.

src: So machten Wir es zu einem warnenden Beispiel für die Zeitgenossen und die Nachfolgenden und zu einer Ermahnung für die Gottesfürchtigen.
ref: And whom We made an example for the people (of the day) and those after them, and warning for those who fear God.
draft: So we made it a warning example for contemporaries and posterity and a reminder for the God-fearing.
hil: Thus We made it a warning example for contemporaries and posterity, and a reminder for the God-fearing.
compare: Thus We made it a warning example for contemporaries and posterity, and a reminder for the God-fearing.

src: (Damals als Allah sie dir in deinem Traum in geringer Anzahl zeigte; und hätte Er sie dir in großer Anzahl gezeigt, wäret ihr sicherlich Versager und über die Sache uneins gewesen; Allah aber bewahrte (euch davor); wahrlich, Er kennt wohl, was in den Herzen ist.
ref: God showed (the Makkans) to be few in your dream, for if He had shown them to be many you would surely have lost courage and disagreed about the (wisdom) of the battle. But God spared you this, for He surely knows what is in the hearts of men.
draft: Back then, when Allah showed them to you in your dream in small numbers; and if He had shown them to you in large numbers, you would have certainly failed and disagreed about the matter; but Allah prevented that; truly, He knows well what is in the hearts.
hil: Back then, when God showed them to you in your dream in few, and if He had shown them to you in many, you would have surely failed and disagreed about the matter. But God prevented that. Surely, He knows well what is in the hearts.
compare: Back then, when Allah showed them to you in your dream in small numbers; and if He had shown them to you in large numbers, you would have certainly failed and disagreed about the matter; but Allah prevented that; truly, He knows well what is in the hearts.

src: Gewiß, für die Unrecht-Begehenden ist eine qualvolle Peinigung bestimmt.
ref: Verily, there is a painful torment for the Zalimun (polytheists and wrong-doers, etc.)."
draft: Certainly, a painful punishment is destined for those who commit injustice.
hil: Indeed, for those who commit injustice, a painful punishment is destined.
compare: Certainly, a painful punishment is destined for those who commit injustice.

src: Damit Gott einem jeden vergelte, was er erworben hat.
ref: That God may reward each soul for its deeds.
draft: In order for God to repay each one for what he has earned.
hil: So that God may requite each one according to what they have earned.
compare: In order for God to repay each one for what he has earned.

src: So erfolgt auch das Herauskommen.
ref: Even thus will be the life after death.
draft: So the coming out also happens.
hil: Thus, the coming out also happens.
compare: Thus, the coming out also happens.

src: Und ER machte für euch Bekleidungen, die euch vor der Hitze schützen, und Bekleidungen, die euch vor eurer Gewalttätigkeit (gegeneinander) schützen.
ref: He has given you garments to protect you from the heat, and garments to protect you from your own violence.
draft: And HE made clothing for you that protect you from the heat, and clothing that protect you from your violence (against each other).
hil: HE made clothing for you that protect you from the heat, and clothing that protect you from your violence (against each other).
compare: And HE made clothing for you that protect you from the heat, and clothing that protect you from your violence (against each other).

src: Und wer von euch es vorsätzlich tötet, so ist die Vergeltung (dafür) Gleiches von den An'am wie das, was man getötet hat, - darüber befinden zwei Redliche von euch - als Hady-Opfertier, das bei der Ka'ba geopfert wird.
ref: Whoever of you kills any intentionally, its penalty shall be a domestic animal comparable to what he killed, as determined by two honest persons among you—an offering delivered to the Kaabah.
draft: And whoever intentionally kills it among you, then (the penalty) for it is to be compensated with the like of what he killed, from the cattle, as determined by two men of justice among you, as an offering to be brought to the Kaaba.
hil: And whoever among you purposely kills it, then the penalty for it is to be compensated with the like of what he killed, from among the grazing livestock, as determined by two just men of you, as an offering to be brought to the Kaaba.
compare: And whoever among you purposely kills it, then the penalty for it is to be compensated with the like of what he killed, from among the grazing livestock, as determined by two just men of you, as an offering to be brought to the Kaaba.

src: Das Gleichnis Seiner Erleuchtung ist wie eine Aushöhlung, in der eine Leuchte ist.
ref: The allegory of His light is that of a pillar on which is a lamp.
draft: "The parable of his enlightenment is like a hollow in which a light is."
hil: "The parable of His enlightenment is like a hollow in which a light is."
compare: "The parable of his enlightenment is like a hollow in which a light is."

src: Da erretteten Wir ihn und diejenigen, die mit ihm waren, im Schiff. Und Wir machten sie zu Nachfolgern und ließen diejenigen ertrinken, die Unsere Zeichen für Lüge erklärten.
ref: They denied him, but We delivered him, and those with him in the ship, and We made them generations replacing one after another, while We drowned those who belied Our Ayat (proofs, evidences, lessons, signs, revelations, etc.).
draft: We saved him and those who were with him in the ship. And We made them successors and caused those who denied Our signs to drown.
hil: So, We saved him and those who were with him in the ship, and We made them successors, while We drowned those who rejected Our signs.
compare: So, We saved him and those who were with him in the ship, and We made them successors, while We drowned those who rejected Our signs.

src: Wie kann Ihm ein Sohn gehören, wo ER niemals eine Partnerin hatte und doch alles erschuf?! Und ER ist über alles allwissend.
ref: How can He have children when He has no wife? He created all things and He is the All-Knower of everything.
draft: How can he have a son when he never had a partner and yet created everything?! And he is omniscient about everything.
hil: How can He have a son when He never had a partner and created everything?! And He is all-knowing about everything.
compare: How can he have a son when he never had a partner and yet created everything?! And he is omniscient about everything.

src: Sowie die Bewohner von Madyan. Auch Musa wurde der Lüge bezichtigt, so gewährte ICH den Kafir noch längere Zeit, dann richtete ICH sie zugrunde.
ref: and so did the dwellers of Midian, and Moses too was branded a liar. Initially I granted respite to the unbelievers for a while and then seized them.
draft: As well as the inhabitants of Midian. Also Musa was accused of lying, so I granted the Kafir more time, then I destroyed them.
hil: As well as the inhabitants of Midian. Also Moses was accused of lying, so I granted the Kafir more time, and then I destroyed them.
compare: As well as the inhabitants of Midian. Also Moses was accused of lying, so I granted the Kafir more time, and then I destroyed them.

src: Sie waren gegen den Gesandten ihres Herrn ungehorsam. I) a ergriff Er sie mit einem sich steigernden heftigen Griff.
ref: When they disobeyed the apostle of their Lord He seized them with an overwhelming punishment.
draft: They were disobedient to the envoy of their master. I) He grabbed her with an increasingly violent grip.
hil: They were disobedient to the envoy of their lord. I) He took hold of her with an increasingly violent grip.
compare: They were disobedient to the envoy of their lord. I) He took hold of her with an increasingly violent grip.

src: Sollte euch ALLAHs Peinigung unerwartet oder voraussehbar überkommen, werden etwa andere damit zugrunde gerichtet außer den unrecht-begehenden Leuten?"
ref: If God's chastisement comes upon you, suddenly or openly, shall any be destroyed, except the people of the evildoers?'
draft: "Should ALLAH's punishment come upon you unexpectedly or foreseeable, will anyone be destroyed by it other than the wrongdoing people?"
hil: "If ALLAH's punishment should come upon you unexpectedly or foreseeably, will anyone else be destroyed by it except the wrongdoers?"
compare: "Should ALLAH's punishment come upon you unexpectedly or foreseeable, will anyone be destroyed by it other than the wrongdoing people?"

src: Als sie deren Zusammenfluß erreicht hatten, vergaßen sie ihren Fisch, so nahm er seinen Weg ins Meer wie einen Tauchpfad.
ref: When they reached the confluence they forgot the fish (they had brought as food) which swiftly made its way into the sea.
draft: When they reached its confluence, they forgot about their fish, so he took his way into the sea like a diving path.
hil: When they reached the confluence, they forgot about their fish, so it took its path into the sea like a diving path.
compare: When they reached its confluence, they forgot about their fish, so he took his way into the sea like a diving path.

src: Und (ER gebietet euch), daß ihr eure Verantwortung den Waisen gegenüber in gerechter Weise erfüllt."
ref: Allah directs you to treat the orphans with justice.
draft: "And (HE commands you) that you fulfill your responsibility towards orphans in a just manner."
hil: And (HE commands you) that you fulfill your responsibility towards orphans in a just manner.
compare: "And (HE commands you) that you fulfill your responsibility towards orphans in a just manner."

src: Und wenn ihr krank oder auf Reisen seid, oder wenn einer von euch vom Abort kommt, oder wenn ihr die Frauen berührt habt und ihr kein Wasser findet, dann sucht einen sauberen Boden und streicht euch davon über das Gesicht und die Hände. Gott will euch keine Bedrängnis auferlegen, sondern Er will euch rein machen und seine Gnade an euch vollenden, auf daß ihr dankbar seid.
ref: When you wish to stand up for prayer, wash your faces, and your hands up to the elbows, and pass wet palms over your heads and wash your feet up to the ankles; and if you need a bath, clean yourselves thoroughly; and if you are sick or on a journey, or one of you returns from answering the call of nature, or you have cohabited with women, and you do not find water, then cleanse (yourself) with clean soil – therefore stroke your soiled palms over your faces and your hands with it; Allah does not will to place you in hardship, but He wills to fully purify you and complete His favour upon you, so that you may be grateful.
draft: And if you are sick or traveling, or if one of you comes from the toilet, or if you have touched the women and cannot find water, then look for a clean ground and rub your faces and hands with it. God does not want to burden you, but He wants to make you pure and complete His grace upon you, so that you may be thankful.
hil: If you are ill or traveling, or if any of you come from the toilet, or if you have touched women and cannot find water, then seek out clean ground and wipe your faces and hands with it. God does not want to burden you, but to purify you and complete His grace upon you, so that you may be grateful.
compare: If you are ill or traveling, or if any of you come from the toilet, or if you have touched women and cannot find water, then seek out clean ground and wipe your faces and hands with it. God does not want to burden you, but to purify you and complete His grace upon you, so that you may be grateful.

src: ER ist Derjenige, Der Herzensruhe in die Herzen der Mumin hinabsandte, damit sie mehr Iman zu ihrem Iman gewinnen. Und ALLAH gehören die Gehilfen der Himmel und der Erde. Und ALLAH ist immer allwissend, allweise.
ref: It is He who sent down the sense of security into the hearts of believers so that their faith may increase with belief, -- God's are the armies of the heavens and the earth; and God is all-knowing and all-wise; --
draft: HE is the One Who sent tranquility to the hearts of the believers so that they may increase in faith upon their faith. And to Allah belong the soldiers of the heavens and the earth. And Allah is Always All-Knowing, All-Wise.
