ref: Whosoever of you then befriendeth them then those! they are the wrong-doers.
draft: Those among you who take them as friends, they are the ones who do wrong.
hil: And those of you who take them as friends are oppressors.
compare: Those among you who take them as friends, they are the ones who do wrong.

src: Fir'aun hatte sein Volk in die Irre geführt und nicht rechtgeleitet.
ref: The Pharaoh had led his people astray, and did not rightly guide them.
draft: Pharaoh had misled his people and not guided them rightly.
hil: Pharaoh had led his people astray and not guided them rightly.
compare: Pharaoh had misled his people and not guided them rightly.

src: Gewiß, dieser ist ein Feind für dich und für deine Gattin. Also lasst ihn nicht euch beide aus der Dschanna herausbringen, sonst mußt du dich mühen.
ref: This is an enemy unto thee and unto thy wife, so let him not drive you both out of the Garden so that thou come to toil.
draft: Certainly, this one is an enemy to you and your wife. So do not let him bring both of you out of the Dschanna, otherwise you will have to struggle.
hil: Certainly, this one is an enemy to you and your wife. So do not let him bring both of you out of the Dschanna, otherwise you will have to struggle.
compare: Certainly, this one is an enemy to you and your wife. So do not let him bring both of you out of the Dschanna, otherwise you will have to struggle.

src: ER vergibt, wem ER will, und peinigt, wen ER will.
ref: No: You are only mortals, of His creation."
draft: HE forgives whom HE will, and torments whom HE will.
hil: He pardons whomever He pleases and afflicts whomever He wills.
compare: HE forgives whom HE will, and torments whom HE will.

src: Das sind die Parteien.
ref: These were the hordes.
draft: These are the parties.
hil: These are the parties.
compare: These are the parties.

src: Und sie pflegten zu sagen: "Wie?
ref: And said: "What!
draft: And they used to say, "How?".
hil: And they used to say, "How?"
compare: And they used to say, "How?".

src: Das ist der Genuß im diesseitigen Leben. Doch bei Allah ist die schöne Heimstatt.
ref: That is the enjoyment of the present life; but God -- with Him is the fairest resort.
draft: "This is the pleasure in this earthly life. But with Allah is the beautiful home."
hil: "This is the pleasure of the earthly life, but with Allah is the beautiful abode exclusively for the believers on the Day of Resurrection."
compare: "This is the pleasure in this earthly life. But with Allah is the beautiful home."

src: So legen Wir die Zeichen ausführlich dar, - auf daß sie umkehren mögen.
ref: That is how We explain Our signs distinctly so that they may come back (to the right path).
draft: So we explain the signs in detail, - so that they may turn back.
hil: Thus do We explain the signs in detail, so that they may repent.
compare: Thus do We explain the signs in detail, so that they may repent.

src: Das ist die Frohbotschaft, die Gott seinen Dienern, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, verkündet. Sprich: Ich verlange von euch keinen Lohn dafür, es sei denn die Liebe wie zu den Verwandten.
ref: That is that whereof Allah giveth the glad tidings Unto His bondmen who believe and work righteous works, Say thou: I ask of you no hire therefor save affection in respect of kinship.
draft: "This is the good news that God proclaims to his servants who believe and do good works. Say: I do not ask you for any reward for this, except for the love of kin."
hil: "This is the glad tidings that God gives to His believers who do good deeds. Say: I do not ask for any reward from you for it, except for love towards kin."
compare: "This is the good news that God proclaims to his servants who believe and do good works. Say: I do not ask you for any reward for this, except for the love of kin."

src: Und vor Mir (allein) sollt ihr Ehrfurcht haben.
ref: Me, you must fear.
draft: And before me (alone) you shall have reverence.
hil: And you should have reverence before me (alone).
compare: And before me (alone) you shall have reverence.

src: Und Wir haben ihn als Koran in Abschnitte geteilt, damit du ihn den Menschen ohne Hast verliest. Und Wir haben ihn nach und nach hinabgesandt.
ref: And We sent down the Qur’an in parts, that you may gradually recite it to the people, and We sent it down slowly in stages.
draft: And We have divided it (i.e., the Quran) into sections that you may recite it to the people at intervals. And We have sent it down gradually.
hil: "We have divided it (i.e., the Quran) into sections that you may recite it to the people at intervals. And We have sent it down gradually."
compare: And We have divided it (i.e., the Quran) into sections that you may recite it to the people at intervals. And We have sent it down gradually.

src: Sollte Der Allgnade Erweisende mir Schaden zufügen, würden weder ihre Fürbitte mir etwas nützen, noch würden sie mich erretten.
ref: So that if the Most Gracious should wish me any harm, their intercession would be of no use to me, nor would they be able to save me?”
draft: If the merciful one were to harm me, neither their intercession would benefit me nor would they save me.
hil: If the Most Gracious were to inflict harm upon me, neither their intercession would benefit me, nor would they save me.
compare: If the Most Gracious were to inflict harm upon me, neither their intercession would benefit me, nor would they save me.

src: Und (einen Teil) der Nacht, verbringe ihn damit, zusätzlich für dich.
ref: And in some parts of the night (also) offer the Salat (prayer) with it (i.e. recite the Quran in the prayer), as an additional prayer (Tahajjud optional prayer Nawafil) for you (O Muhammad SAW).
draft: And (a part of) the night, spend it doing something extra for yourself.
hil: And spend (a part of) the night doing something extra for yourself.
compare: And spend (a part of) the night doing something extra for yourself.

src: Ein anderer Teil sorgte sich jedoch nur um sich selbst, sie dachten von ALLAH alles andere als das Wahre, eben das Denken der unwissenden Gemeinschaft, sie sagten: "Haben wir in dieser Angelegenheit irgendwelchen Einfluß?!"
ref: Slumber overtook a party of you, while another party was thinking about themselves (as how to save their ownselves, ignoring the others and the Prophet SAW) and thought wrongly of Allah - the thought of ignorance.
draft: Another part, however, only cared about themselves, they thought of ALLAH anything but the truth, just the thinking of the ignorant community, they said: "Do we have any influence in this matter?!"
hil: Another part, however, only cares about themselves, they think anything but the truth of Allah, just the thinking of the ignorant community. They say: "Do we have any influence in this matter?!"
compare: Another part, however, only cared about themselves, they thought of ALLAH anything but the truth, just the thinking of the ignorant community, they said: "Do we have any influence in this matter?!"

src: Handelt Taqwa gemäß ALLAH gegenüber, strebt nach dem, womit ihr Sein Wohlgefallen erreicht und leistet Dschihad fi-sabilillah, damit ihr erfolgreich werdet.
ref: Fear Allah, and seek the means towards Him, and strive in His cause, in the hope of attaining success.
draft: Act with Taqwa towards Allah, strive for that which pleases Him and perform Jihad for the sake of Allah so that you may be successful.
hil: Act with Taqwa towards Allah, follow the path shown by Him and strive for what will attain His pleasure, and struggle for the sake of Allah, so that you may have success.
compare: Act with Taqwa towards Allah, strive for that which pleases Him and perform Jihad for the sake of Allah so that you may be successful.

src: (Dies), außer das Wort Ibrahims zu seinem Vater: "Ich werde ganz gewiß für dich um Vergebung bitten; doch vermag ich für dich vor Allah gar nichts auszurichten.
ref: (Except that Abraham said unto his father, 'Certainly I shall ask pardon for thee; but I have no power to do aught for thee against God.')
draft: (This), except for Ibrahim's words to his father: "I will certainly ask for forgiveness for you, but I have no power with Allah to do anything for you."
hil: This, except for Ibrahim's words to his father: 'I will certainly ask for forgiveness for you, but I have no power with Allah to do anything for you.'
compare: (This), except for Ibrahim's words to his father: "I will certainly ask for forgiveness for you, but I have no power with Allah to do anything for you."

src: Also manche von ihnen haben den Iman verinnerlicht und manche von ihnen haben Kufr betrieben. Und hätte ALLAH es gewollt, hätten sie den bewaffneten Kampf gegenseitig nicht geführt, doch ALLAH macht, was ER will.
ref: If Allah had willed, they would not have fought against one another, but Allah does what He likes.
draft: Also, some of them have internalized faith (Iman) and some of them have committed disbelief (Kufr). And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought against each other in armed battle, but Allah does what He wills.
hil: Some of them have internalized faith (Iman) and some of them have committed disbelief (Kufr). And if it had been Allah's will, they would not have fought each other in armed combat, but Allah does as He pleases.
compare: Also, some of them have internalized faith (Iman) and some of them have committed disbelief (Kufr). And if Allah had willed, they would not have fought against each other in armed battle, but Allah does what He wills.

src: Er sagte: "Gewiß, bereits tat er dir Unrecht mit seiner Forderung zur Überlassung deines Schafsweibchen zu seinen Schafsweibchen. Und gewiß, die meisten der Beteiligten begehen doch Übertretungen die einen von ihnen gegen die anderen außer denjenigen, die den Iman verinnerlicht und gottgefällig Gutes getan haben. Doch diese sind wenige." Und Dawud dachte, daß WIR ihn nur einer Fitna unterzogen haben. Dann bat er seinen HERRN um Vergebung, fiel in Ruku' nieder und war umkehrend.
ref: Said he, 'Assuredly he has wronged thee in asking for thy ewe in addition to his sheep; and indeed many intermixers do injury one against the other, save those who believe, and do deeds of righteousness -- and how few they are!' And David thought that We had only tried him; therefore he sought forgiveness of his Lord, and he fell down, bowing, and he repented.
draft: He said, "Certainly, he has already wronged you with his demand to transfer your female sheep to his female sheep. And certainly, most of those involved commit transgressions against each other except those who have internalized the iman and have done good that is pleasing to God. But these are few." And Dawud thought that WE only subjected him to a fitnah. Then he asked his LORD for forgiveness, fell into ruku' and repented.
hil: He said, "Certainly, he has already wronged you with his demand to transfer your female sheep to his female sheep. And certainly, most of those involved commit transgressions against each other except those who have internalized faith and have done good that is pleasing to God. But these are few." And Dawud thought that WE only subjected him to a trial. Then he asked his LORD for forgiveness, fell into ruku' and repented.
compare: He said, "Certainly, he has already wronged you with his demand to transfer your female sheep to his female sheep. And certainly, most of those involved commit transgressions against each other except those who have internalized faith and have done good that is pleasing to God. But these are few." And Dawud thought that WE only subjected him to a trial. Then he asked his LORD for forgiveness, fell into ruku' and repented.

src: Dies (geschah deshalb), weil sie immer wieder die Zeichen Allahs leugneten und die Propheten zu Unrecht töteten; dies (geschah), weil sie sich auflehnten und immer wieder übertraten.
ref: This, because they were ever disbelieving in the signs of Allah and slaying the prophets without justice. This, because they disobeyed and were ever trespassing.
draft: This happened because they repeatedly denied the signs of Allah and unjustly killed the prophets, because they rebelled and repeatedly transgressed.
hil: This happened because they repeatedly denied the signs of Allah and killed the prophets unjustly; this happened because they rebelled and repeatedly transgressed.
compare: This happened because they repeatedly denied the signs of Allah and unjustly killed the prophets, because they rebelled and repeatedly transgressed.

src: (Hätten Wir dich nicht entsandt), würden sie sagen, wenn sie ein Unglück trifft wegen dessen, was ihre Hände vorausgeschickt haben: "Unser Herr, hättest Du doch einen Gesandten zu uns gesandt, so daß wir Deinen Zeichen hätten folgen können und zu den Gläubigen'hätten gehören können!"
ref: And in case disaster comes upon them for what they have done themselves, they should say: "O Lord, why did You not send an apostle to us that we should have followed Your commands, and been with those who are believers;"
draft: "If We had not sent you", they would say, when an affliction befalls them because of what their hands have sent before them, "Why did we not send a messenger so that we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?"
hil: "If We had not sent you", they would say, when an affliction befalls them because of what their hands have sent before them, "Why did we not send a messenger so that we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?".
compare: "If We had not sent you", they would say, when an affliction befalls them because of what their hands have sent before them, "Why did we not send a messenger so that we could have followed Your verses and been among the believers?"

src: An dem Tag, wenn ER sie allesamt erweckt, werden sie Ihm schwören, wie sie euch schwören, und sie denken, sie verfügen über etwas (Nützliches).
ref: On the Day when Allah will resurrect them all together (for their account), then they will swear to Him as they swear to you (O Muslims).
draft: On the day when HE resurrects them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you, and they think they have some power.
hil: On the day when He resurrects them all together, they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think they have something useful. But certainly they are liars.
compare: On the day when HE resurrects them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you, and they think they have some power.

src: Vielleicht tue ich Gutes in dem, was ich hinterlassen habe.» Nein, das ist nur ein Wort, das er (so) sagt.
ref: "In order that I may work righteousness in the things I neglected." - "By no means!
draft: Maybe I'm doing good in what I've left behind." No, that's just a word he says.
hil: "Maybe I'm doing good in what I've left behind." No, that's just a word he says.
compare: Maybe I'm doing good in what I've left behind." No, that's just a word he says.

src: Dann konnten sie weder aufstehen, noch wurde ihnen beigestanden.
ref: And neither stand up nor defend themselves.
draft: Then they could neither get up nor were they assisted.
hil: Then they could neither stand up nor were they assisted.
compare: Then they could neither get up nor were they assisted.

src: Ich bitte euch nicht um eine Belohnung dafür. Meine Belohnung obliegt doch nur Demjenigen, Der mich erschuf.
ref: “O my people, I ask you no wage for it; my wage lies with Him who originated me.
draft: I do not ask you for a reward for it. My reward lies only with Him who created me.
hil: I seek no reward from you for it. My reward lies only with Him who created me.
compare: I do not ask you for a reward for it. My reward lies only with Him who created me.

src: Dann entsandten Wir nach ihnen Mose mit unseren Zeichen zu Pharao und seinen Vornehmen.
ref: Then after them We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his elite, but they wronged them.
draft: Then We sent Moses to them with our signs to Pharaoh and his elite.
hil: We sent Moses with Our signs to Pharaoh and his elite.
compare: Then We sent Moses to them with our signs to Pharaoh and his elite.

src: Und Al'ahrsch von deinem HERRN tragen über ihnen an diesem Tag acht.
ref: And on that Day, eight (of them) will carry the Throne of your Lord above them.
draft: And Al'ahrsch from your LORD carry over them eight on this day.
hil: On this day, Al'ahrsch will carry over them eight from your Lord.
compare: On this day, Al'ahrsch will carry over them eight from your Lord.

src: Wenn die Heuchler und diejenigen, in deren Herzen Krankheit ist, und diejenigen, die beunruhigende Falschmeldungen in der Stadt verbreiten, (damit) nicht aufhören, werden Wir dich bestimmt gegen sie antreiben.
ref: If the hypocrites and those who have a disease in their hearts, and those who make a commotion in the City do not desist, We will surely urge you against them.
draft: If the hypocrites and those whose hearts are sick and those who spread disturbing false rumors in the city do not stop, then We will certainly drive you (Prophet) against them.
hil: If the hypocrites and those whose hearts are sick, and those who spread disturbing false rumors in the city, do not stop, We will definitely drive you against them.
compare: If the hypocrites and those whose hearts are sick and those who spread disturbing false rumors in the city do not stop, then We will certainly drive you (Prophet) against them.

src: Und die weiblichen Guten sind für die männlichen Guten, und die männlichen Guten sind für die weiblichen Guten bestimmt, diese sind unschuldig hinsichtlich dessen, was sie (die anderen an Ifk-Lüge) sagen. Für sie ist Vergebung und edles Rizq bestimmt.
ref: Good statements are for good people (or good women for good men) and good people for good statements (or good men for good women), such (good people) are innocent of (each and every) bad statement which they say, for them is Forgiveness, and Rizqun Karim (generous provision i.e. Paradise).
draft: And the female goods are for the male goods, and the male goods are intended for the female goods, these are innocent in terms of what they say about the others regarding Ifk-lie. Forgiveness and noble Rizq are intended for them.
hil: And the female good are intended for the male good, and the male good are intended for the female good, and they are innocent as to what they say about the others regarding Ifk-lie. Forgiveness and noble Rizq are intended for them.
compare: And the female good are intended for the male good, and the male good are intended for the female good, and they are innocent as to what they say about the others regarding Ifk-lie. Forgiveness and noble Rizq are intended for them.

src: (Es gilt) schöne Geduld (zu üben). Gott ist der, der um Hilfe gebeten wird gegen das, was ihr beschreibt.»
ref: He said: nay! your selves have embellished for you an affair; so seemly patience! and Allah is to be implored for help in that which ye ascribe
draft: "Beautiful patience (should be practiced). God is the one who is asked for help against what you describe."
hil: Practice beautiful patience. God is the One who is invoked for help against what you describe.
compare: Practice beautiful patience. God is the One who is invoked for help against what you describe.

src: Doch es ist nichts als eine Ermahnung für die Weltenbewohner.
ref: Whilst it is no more than reminder for the people of the world.
draft: But it is nothing but a warning for the inhabitants of the worlds.
hil: But it is nothing but a reminder for the inhabitants of the worlds.
compare: But it is nothing but a reminder for the inhabitants of the worlds.

src: Oder glaubt ihr in Sicherheit davor zu sein, daß Er euch ein anderes Mal aufs Meer zurückbringt und einen verheerenden Wind gegen euch sendet und euch ertrinken läßt, weil ihr ungläubig seid, und (daß) ihr dann für euch keinen Gefolgsmann findet, der Uns deswegen belangen könnte?
ref: Or you feel so secure that He will not send you back (to sea) again or send a gravel-hurtling storm against you, and drown you for your ingratitude? Then you will not find any avenger against Us.
draft: Or do you think that you are safe from Him bringing you back to the sea another time and sending a devastating wind against you and letting you drown because you are unbelievers, and that then you will not find anyone to help you against Us?
hil: O ye who believe! do not take My enemies and your enemies for friends: would you offer them love while they deny what has come to you of the truth, driving out the Messenger and yourselves because you believe in Allah, your Lord? If you have come forth to strive for My sake and seeking My pleasure, would you show them affection in secret, knowing that I know best what you conceal and what you reveal?
compare: Or do you think that you are safe from Him bringing you back to the sea another time and sending a devastating wind against you and letting you drown because you are unbelievers, and that then you will not find anyone to help you against Us?

src: Doch WIR sehen mit euch nicht eure Fürbittenden, die ihr unter euch als Partner (für ALLAH) angenommen habt.
ref: We do not see your intercessors with you who, you imagined, had partnership with you.
draft: But WE do not see with you your intercessors whom you have taken as partners (for ALLAH) among yourselves.
hil: But WE do not see with you those whom you have taken as interleaved partners (with ALLAH) among yourselves.
compare: But WE do not see with you your intercessors whom you have taken as partners (for ALLAH) among yourselves.

src: Seht ihr denn nicht?
ref: Can you not perceive?
draft: Can't you see?
hil: Have you not seen it?
compare: Can't you see?

src: Sie sagte: "Ihr Entscheidungsträger!
draft: She said: "Your decision maker!"
hil: She said, 'You decision maker!'
compare: She said, 'You decision maker!'

src: Und die Ungläubigen sagen von den Gläubigen: "Wäre er (der Quran) etwas Gutes, hätten sie ihn nicht vor uns erlangt." Und da sie sich nicht von ihm leiten lassen, sagen sie: "Dies ist eine alte Lüge."
ref: And the disbelievers said regarding the Muslims, “If there were any good in it, the Muslims would not have surpassed us in achieving it!”; and since they did not receive guidance with it, they will now say, “This is an old slander.”
draft: And the unbelievers say of the believers: "If (the Quran) were something good, they would not have obtained it before us." And since they are not guided by it, they say: "This is an ancient lie."
hil: And the unbelievers say of the believers: 'If (the Quran) were something good, they would not have obtained it before us.' And since they do not allow themselves to be guided by it, they say: 'This is an old lie.'
compare: And the unbelievers say of the believers: 'If (the Quran) were something good, they would not have obtained it before us.' And since they do not allow themselves to be guided by it, they say: 'This is an old lie.'

src: Er hat die Schlüssel der Himmel und der Erde. Diejenigen, die die Zeichen Gottes verleugnen, das sind die Verlierer.
ref: He has the keys of the heavens and the earth; and those who deny the revelations of God will be losers.
draft: He has the keys to Heaven and Earth. Those who deny God's signs, they are the losers.
hil: He holds the keys to the heavens and the earth. Those who deny the signs of God, they are the losers.
compare: He has the keys to Heaven and Earth. Those who deny God's signs, they are the losers.

src: Ihre Gesandten sagten: "Existiert etwa ein Zweifel über Allah, den Schöpfer der Himmel und der Erde?
ref: Said their apostles: "Can there be doubt about God, the originator of the heavens and the earth?
draft: Their messengers said, "Is there any doubt about Allah, the creator of the heavens and the earth?"
hil: "Their messengers said, 'Is there any doubt about Allah, the Creator of the heavens and the earth?'"
compare: Their messengers said, "Is there any doubt about Allah, the creator of the heavens and the earth?"

src: Jene sind (überhaupt) die Unachtsamen.
ref: They are the heedless ones.
draft: Those are (totally) the inattentive ones.
hil: They are the careless ones (at all).
compare: They are the careless ones (at all).

src: Einen Teil tötetet ihr, und einen Teil nahmt ihr gefangen.
ref: Some of them you killed, and others you took captive.
draft: You partially killed them, and partially took them captive.
hil: Some of them you killed, and some you took captive.
compare: You partially killed them, and partially took them captive.

src: Allah hat gesagt: Nehmt euch nicht zwei Götter. Er ist nur ein Einziger Gott. Vor Mir (allein) sollt ihr Ehrfurcht haben.
ref: And Allah has proclaimed, “Do not ascribe two Gods; indeed He is the only One God; therefore fear Me alone.”
draft: Allah has said: Do not take two gods. He is the only one God. You should have awe of me (alone).
hil: Allah has said: Do not take two gods. He is the only one God. You should have awe of me (alone).
compare: Allah has said: Do not take two gods. He is the only one God. You should have awe of me (alone).

src: Ehefrauen des Propheten! Welche von euch eine bewiesene Abscheulichkeit vollbringt, für diese wird die Peinigung verzweifacht. Und dies ist für ALLAH immer ein Leichtes.
ref: Wives of the Prophet, whosoever among you commits a flagrant indecency, for her the chastisement shall be doubled; that is easy for God.
draft: Wives of the Prophet! Whoever among you commits a proven indecency, her torment shall be doubled, and this is easy for Allah.
hil: Wives of the Prophet! If any among you committs a proven indecency, her punishment will be doubled, and this is easy for Allah.
compare: Wives of the Prophet! If any among you committs a proven indecency, her punishment will be doubled, and this is easy for Allah.

src: Und hätte dein HERR es gewollt, hätte ER doch die Menschen zu einer einzigen Umma gemacht - sie aber bleiben uneins
ref: But if your Lord had pleased He could have made all human beings into one community of belief. But they would still have differed from one another,
draft: And if your Lord had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ.
hil: And had your Lord willed, He could have made all the people on the earth one community, yet they continue to disagree.
compare: And if your Lord had willed, He could have made mankind one community; but they will not cease to differ.

src: Und seid nicht wie diejenigen, die sich gespalten haben und uneins geworden sind, nachdem die deutlichen Zeichen zu ihnen gekommen waren.
ref: So be not like those who became disunited and differed among themselves after clear proofs had come to them.
draft: And be not like those who have divided and differed among themselves after there had come to them clear evidence.
hil: And do not be like those who have divided and become divided after the clear signs have come to them, if God had willed they would not have fought each other.
compare: And be not like those who have divided and differed among themselves after there had come to them clear evidence.

src: Sie sagten: "Fürchte dich nicht!" Und sie überbrachten ihm frohe Botschaft über einen äußerst wissenden Jungen.
ref: They said, “Do not fear,” and they announced to him the good news of a knowledgeable boy.
draft: They said, "Don't be afraid!" And they brought him good news about an extremely knowledgeable young boy.
hil: They said, 'Do not fear.' And they conveyed to him the glad tidings of a knowledgeable boy.
compare: They said, 'Do not fear.' And they conveyed to him the glad tidings of a knowledgeable boy.

src: Dies (ist deshalb so), weil jene, die ungläubig sind, dem Trügerischen folgen, und weil diejenigen, die gläubig sind, der Wahrheit ihres Herrn folgen. So beschreibt Allah den Menschen ihre Lage.
ref: This is because the disbelievers followed falsehood and the believers followed the Truth which is from their Lord; this is how Allah illustrates the examples of people to them.
draft: This is so because those who are unbelievers follow deceit, while those who are believers follow the truth of their Lord. Allah thus describes to mankind their situation.
hil: This is so because those who are unbelievers follow deception, while those who are believers follow the truth of their Lord. Thus Allah describes to mankind their situation.
compare: This is so because those who are unbelievers follow deceit, while those who are believers follow the truth of their Lord. Allah thus describes to mankind their situation.

src: Als die Nacht über ihn hereinbrach, sah er einen Himmelskörper. Er sagte: "Das ist mein Herr."
ref: When the night came with her covering of darkness he saw a star, and (Azar, his father) said: "This is my Lord."
draft: As the night fell, he saw a celestial body. He said, "That is my Lord."
hil: As the night fell, he saw a celestial body. He said, "This is my Lord."
compare: As the night fell, he saw a celestial body. He said, "This is my Lord."

src: Aber Allah ist voll Huld gegen die Weltenbewohner.
ref: But gracious is God to the people of the world.
draft: But Allah is full of grace towards the inhabitants of the world.
hil: But Allah is full of grace towards the inhabitants of the world.
compare: But Allah is full of grace towards the inhabitants of the world.

src: Und Wir haben den untersten Himmel mit Leuchten geschmückt und haben sie zu Wurfsteinen gegen die Satane gemacht.
ref: We have adorned the lower heaven with lamps, and have made them a means to drive away the satans.
draft: And We have adorned the lowest heaven with lights and made them a means of stoning the devils.
hil: "And We adorned the nearest heaven with lamps to be an adornment as well as to guard from the devils by using them as missiles against the devils. Such is the decree of Him the All-Mighty, the All-Knower."
compare: "And We adorned the nearest heaven with lamps to be an adornment as well as to guard from the devils by using them as missiles against the devils. Such is the decree of Him the All-Mighty, the All-Knower."

src: Ihr könnt auf der Erde nichts vereiteln. Und ihr habt außer Gott weder Freund noch Helfer.
ref: You cannot thwart Him on the earth, and have no friend or helper apart from Him.
draft: You cannot thwart anything on earth. And you have neither friend nor helper besides God.
hil: You cannot frustrate anything on earth. And you have neither friend nor helper except God.
compare: You cannot thwart anything on earth. And you have neither friend nor helper besides God.

src: "Aber jetzt erst! Wo du dich doch zuvor widersetztest und zu den Unheilstiftern gehörtest?
ref: "Yes, now" (was the answer), "though before this you were disobedient and rebellious.
draft: But now! When you opposed before and belonged to the troublemakers?
hil: But now, really! When you previously resisted and belonged to the troublemakers?
compare: But now, really! When you previously resisted and belonged to the troublemakers?

src: Und euch wird nur für das vergolten, was ihr zu tun pflegtet,
ref: And be rewarded but only for what you had done,
draft: And only what you used to do will be repaid to you.
hil: You shall not be recompensed except according to your deeds.
compare: You shall not be recompensed except according to your deeds.

src: Du bist aber nur ein Warner.
ref: (Muhammad), you are only a warner.
draft: You are only a Warner.
hil: You are only a bearer of warnings.
compare: You are only a Warner.

src: Sag: Wollt ihr mit uns über Allah streiten, wo Er doch unser und euer Herr ist?
ref: Say: "Why do you dispute with us about God when He is equally your Lord and our Lord?
draft: Say, do you want to argue with us about Allah, even though He is our Lord and your Lord?
hil: Say, will you strive with us concerning Allah, whereas He is our Lord and your Lord? To us our works, and to you your works; to Him we are sincere.
compare: Say, do you want to argue with us about Allah, even though He is our Lord and your Lord?

src: Und derjenige (Mann) aus Ägypten, der ihn gekauft hatte, sagte zu seiner Frau: "Nimm ihn freundlich auf.
ref: The Egyptian who bought him instructed his wife: "House him honourably.
draft: And the person (man) from Egypt who had bought him said to his wife: "Receive him kindly."
hil: And he, being from Egypt, who bought him said to his wife, 'Give him goodly lodging, and it may be that he will profit us, or we may take him for our own son.'
compare: And the person (man) from Egypt who had bought him said to his wife: "Receive him kindly."

src: So richte dein Antlitz in aufrichtiger Weise auf den Glauben; (dies entspricht) der natürlichen Veranlagung, mit der Allah die Menschen geschaffen hat.
ref: So keep yourself exclusively on the true way, the creational law of God according to which He created man with the quality of choosing right or wrong.
draft: So direct your face in a sincere way towards faith; (this corresponds to) the natural disposition with which Allah has created people.
hil: So direct your face towards faith in a sincere manner; this corresponds to the natural disposition with which Allah has created people.
compare: So direct your face in a sincere way towards faith; (this corresponds to) the natural disposition with which Allah has created people.

src: Hast du nicht jene gesehen, denen ein Teil der Schrift gegeben wurde?
ref: Have you not seen those who were given a portion of the Scripture?
draft: Have you not seen those to whom a portion of the scripture was given?
hil: Have you not seen those to whom a portion of the Scripture was given?
compare: Have you not seen those to whom a portion of the Scripture was given?

src: Und jedesmal wenn du den Quran rezitiert hast, errichteten WIR zwischen dir und denjenigen, die keinen Iman an das Jenseits verinnerlichen, einen unsichtbaren Vorhang.
ref: When you recite the Qur'an, We place a hidden veil between you and those who do not believe in the Hereafter;
draft: And every time you recited the Quran, we built an invisible curtain between you and those who do not internalize faith in the hereafter.
hil: "And every time you recited the Quran, we set up an invisible curtain between you and those who do not believe in the hereafter."
compare: "And every time you recited the Quran, we set up an invisible curtain between you and those who do not believe in the hereafter."

src: Und bitte um Vergebung für deine Sünde und lobpreise deinen Herrn am Abend und am frühen Morgen.
ref: And ask forgiveness for thy sin, and proclaim the praise of thy Lord at evening and dawn.
draft: And ask for forgiveness for your sin and praise your Lord in the evening and early morning.
hil: And ask for forgiveness for your sin and glorify your Lord in the evening and early morning.
compare: And ask for forgiveness for your sin and glorify your Lord in the evening and early morning.

src: Für diejenigen von euch, die sich von ihren Frauen durch den Rückenspruch scheiden...
ref: Those among you who make their wives unlawful (Az-Zihar) to them by saying to them "You are like my mother's back."
draft: "For those of you who divorce their wives through the back quote..."
hil: For those of you who say to your wives: 'You are to me like my mother's back,' they are not their mothers; none are their mothers except those who gave birth to them. And those who say this (thing) are committing an obscenity, and a lie.
compare: For those of you who say to your wives: 'You are to me like my mother's back,' they are not their mothers; none are their mothers except those who gave birth to them. And those who say this (thing) are committing an obscenity, and a lie.

src: Es wird dir nichts gesagt außer dem, was den Gesandten vor dir gesagt wurde.
ref: Nothing is said to you which had not been said to other apostles before you.
draft: You will not be told anything except what was said to the messengers before you.
hil: You will not be told anything except what was said to the messengers before you.
compare: You will not be told anything except what was said to the messengers before you.

src: Dann trifft ihn das Alter, während er (noch) schwache Nachkommen hat. Nun trifft ihn ein Wirbelsturm mit Feuer, er verbrennt.
ref: But he is afflicted with old age and has weak offspring, and it is hit by a whirlwind containing fire and is burned.
draft: Then old age hits him, while he still has weak offspring. Now a whirlwind with fire hits him, he burns.
hil: Then old age hits him, while he still has weak offspring. Now a whirlwind with fire hits him, he burns.
compare: Then old age hits him, while he still has weak offspring. Now a whirlwind with fire hits him, he burns.

src: Und sie wurden zum Guten des Gesagten rechtgeleitet.
ref: They were guided to purity of speech.
draft: And they were guided to the good of what was said.
hil: "They were guided to what was said for good".
compare: And they were guided to the good of what was said.

src: Es ist nur eine Ermahnung für die ganze Schöpfung.
ref: It is only a warning for all mankind.
draft: It is only a admonition for the entire creation.
hil: It is just an admonition for the entire creation.
compare: It is just an admonition for the entire creation.

src: Und urteile zwischen ihnen nach dem, was Gott herabgesandt hat, und folge nicht ihren Neigungen.
ref: And judge between them according to what God revealed, and do not follow their desires.
draft: And judge between them according to what God has revealed, and do not follow their inclinations.
hil: And judge between them by what God has revealed, and do not follow their inclinations.
compare: And judge between them according to what God has revealed, and do not follow their inclinations.

src: Gewiß, ALLAH liebt nicht die Freudenerregten.
ref: God does not like those who exult.
draft: Sure, Allah does not love the exultant.
hil: Surely, Allah does not love the exultant.
compare: Sure, Allah does not love the exultant.

src: Und wenn eine jede Seele, die Unrecht begangen hat, alles besäße, was auf Erden ist, würde sie versuchen, sich damit (von der Strafe) loszukaufen.
ref: And if every one that hath wronged had all that is in the earth, surely he would ransom himself therewith.
draft: And if every soul that has committed injustice possessed everything that is on earth, it would try to buy itself out (of punishment) with it.
hil: If each soul that has committed wrongdoings owned everything on earth and twice as much, they would surely try to redeem themselves from the punishment. And they will secretly feel regret when they see the punishment. But it will be judged between them with fairness, and they will not be wronged.
compare: And if every soul that has committed injustice possessed everything that is on earth, it would try to buy itself out (of punishment) with it.

src: Und auch die in Erfahrung bringe, die heucheln.
ref: And that he might know those who played the hypocrite.
draft: And also find out the ones who pretend.
hil: And also find out those who pretend.
compare: And also find out the ones who pretend.

src: Und das Wasser begann zu sinken, und die Angelegenheit war entschieden. Und das Schiff kam auf dem Güdyy zur Rast.
ref: Withhold (your rain)." And the water was diminished (made to subside) and the Decree (of Allah) was fulfilled (i.e. the destruction of the people of Nuh (Noah).
draft: And the water began to sink, and the matter was decided. And the ship came to rest on the Güdyy.
hil: And the water began to sink, and the matter was decided. And the ship came to rest on the Güdyy.
compare: And the water began to sink, and the matter was decided. And the ship came to rest on the Güdyy.

src: Er ist es, Der in Seiner Barmherzigkeit die Winde als frohe Botschaft schickt, bis daß Wir sie, wenn sie eine schwere Wolke tragen, zu einem toten Ort treiben; dann lassen Wir Wasser aus ihr herab, mit dem Wir Früchte von jeglicher Art hervorbringen. So bringen Wir auch die Toten hervor, auf daß ihr dessen eingedenk sein möget.
ref: And it is He Who sends the winds giving glad tidings, ahead of His mercy; until when they come bearing heavy clouds, We drove it towards a city devoid of vegetation, and then rained water upon it, then produced fruits of various kinds from it; this is how We will bring forth the dead, so that you may heed advice.
draft: He is the one who, in His mercy, sends the winds as glad tidings until We drive them to a dead place when they carry a heavy cloud; then We let water from it descend with which We bring forth fruits of every kind. Thus do We bring forth the dead, that you may remember.
hil: He is the one who sends the winds as glad tidings in His mercy until We drive them away to a dead place when they carry a heavy cloud; then We let water from it descend with which We bring forth fruits of every kind. Thus We also bring forth the dead so that you may remember it.
compare: He is the one who, in His mercy, sends the winds as glad tidings until We drive them to a dead place when they carry a heavy cloud; then We let water from it descend with which We bring forth fruits of every kind. Thus do We bring forth the dead, that you may remember.

src: Gewiß, sie sind ein Volk von Frevlern."
ref: They are certainly a rebellious people."
draft: "Surely, they are a people of transgressors."
hil: The people are indeed transgressors.
compare: "Surely, they are a people of transgressors."

src: Gewiß, WIR haben dir die Schrift mit der Wahrheit hinabgesandt, damit du zwischen den Menschen richtest mit dem, was ALLAH dir erklärt hat.
ref: Surely We have sent down to thee the Book with the truth, so that thou mayest judge between the people by that God has shown thee.
draft: Surely, WE have sent down to you the Book with the truth, that you may judge between people by what Allah has taught you.
hil: Surely, WE have sent down to you the Book with the truth, that you may judge between people by what Allah has taught you.
compare: Surely, WE have sent down to you the Book with the truth, that you may judge between people by what Allah has taught you.

src: Dafür werdet ihr dann Uns gegenüber keinen Rächer für euch finden.
ref: Then you will not find any avenger against Us.
draft: For this, you will not find a avenger towards us.
hil: For this, you shall not find any avenger for yourselves towards us.
compare: For this, you shall not find any avenger for yourselves towards us.

src: Und es gibt keinen unter euch, der nicht dahin wie zur Tränke gehen würde?
ref: There is not one among you who will not reach it.
draft: And there is no one among you who would not go there as if to a watering place?
hil: Is there anyone among you who would not go there as if to a drink?
compare: And there is no one among you who would not go there as if to a watering place?

src: Dann wird Er euch eure Sünden vergeben und euch eingehen lassen in Gärten, unter denen Bäche fließen, und in angenehme Wohnungen in den Gärten von Eden. Das ist der großartige Erfolg.
ref: He will forgive you your sins and admit you into Gardens beneath which rivers flow, and superb dwellings in everlasting Gardens of Eden; this is the greatest success.
draft: Then He will forgive you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow, and to beautiful mansions in the gardens of Eden. This is the great success.
hil: Then He will forgive you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow, and to beautiful mansions in the gardens of Eden. This is the great success.
compare: Then He will forgive you your sins and admit you to gardens beneath which rivers flow, and to beautiful mansions in the gardens of Eden. This is the great success.

src: Da zogen sie beide weiter, bis, als sie dann zu den Bewohnern einer Stadt kamen, sie ihre Bewohner um etwas zu essen baten; diese aber weigerten sich, sie gastlich aufzunehmen. Da fanden sie in ihr eine Mauer, die einzustürzen drohte, und so richtete er sie auf. Er (Musa) sagte: "Wenn du wolltest, hättest du dafür wahrlich Lohn nehmen können."
ref: So they both set out again; until they came to the people of a dwelling – they asked its people for food – they refused to invite them – then in the village they both found a wall about to collapse, and the chosen bondman straightened it; said Moosa, “If you wished, you could have taken some wages for it!”
draft: They both continued on until they came to the inhabitants of a city, and asked its inhabitants for something to eat, but they refused to host them hospitably. Then they found a wall in it that was about to collapse, and so he (Musa) raised it up. He said, "If you had wished, you could have taken a wage for it."
hil: They both continued on until they came to the inhabitants of a city, and asked its inhabitants for something to eat, but they refused to host them hospitably. Then they found a wall in it that was about to collapse and so Musa raised it up. He said, 'If you had wished, you could have taken a wage for it.'
compare: They both continued on until they came to the inhabitants of a city, and asked its inhabitants for something to eat, but they refused to host them hospitably. Then they found a wall in it that was about to collapse and so Musa raised it up. He said, 'If you had wished, you could have taken a wage for it.'

src: Dann werden diese ihnen die Rede erwidern: "Gewiß, ihr seid zweifelsohne Lügner."
ref: They will fling back at them the saying, 'Surely, you are truly liars.'
draft: Then they will answer them: "Certainly, you are without doubt liars."
hil: Then they will respond to them, 'Indeed, you are certainly liars.'
compare: Then they will respond to them, 'Indeed, you are certainly liars.'

src: Ist es denn für die Menschen verwunderlich, daß Wir einem Mann von ihnen (als Offenbarung) eingegeben haben: "Warne die Menschen und verkünde denen, die glauben, die frohe Botschaft, daß sie bei ihrem Herrn einen wahrhaftigen Stand haben"? Die Ungläubigen sagen: "Das ist wahrlich ein deutlicher Zauberer.3"
ref: Are people amazed that We have sent to a man among them, the divine revelation that “Warn the people and convey glad tidings to the believers that for them with their Lord is the place* of truth”? The disbelievers say, “Indeed he is an open magician.” (* Positions of honour on the Day of Resurrection or in heaven.)
draft: Is it surprising for people that we have revealed to a man from among them (as revelation): "Warn mankind and give good news to those who believe, that they have a true rank with their Lord"? The disbelievers say, "This is clearly a magician."
hil: "Is it surprising for people that we have revealed to a man from among them (as revelation): 'Warn mankind and give good news to those who believe, that they have a true rank with their Lord'? The disbelievers say, 'This is clearly a magician.'"
compare: Is it surprising for people that we have revealed to a man from among them (as revelation): "Warn mankind and give good news to those who believe, that they have a true rank with their Lord"? The disbelievers say, "This is clearly a magician."

src: Allah weiß besser über ihren Glauben Bescheid. Wenn ihr sie dann als gläubig erkennt, dann schickt sie nicht zu den Ungläubigen zurück.
ref: When believing women come to you as emigrants, examine them, Allah knows best as to their Faith, then if you ascertain that they are true believers, send them not back to the disbelievers, they are not lawful (wives) for the disbelievers nor are the disbelievers lawful (husbands) for them.
draft: "Allah knows better about their faith. If you then recognize them as believers, then do not send them back to the unbelievers."
hil: Allah knows best about their faith. If you recognize them as believers, then do not send them back to the unbelievers.
compare: "Allah knows better about their faith. If you then recognize them as believers, then do not send them back to the unbelievers."

src: ALLAH erlegt einer Seele nichts auf, außer was sie vermag. Ihr gebührt, was sie erworben, und ihr obliegt, was sie sich angeeignet hat.
ref: Allah does not burden anyone, except with something within its capacity; beneficial for it is the virtue it earned, and harmful for it is the evil it earned; “Our Lord!
draft: ALLAH imposes nothing on a soul, except what it can bear. It deserves what it has earned, and it is incumbent upon it what it has appropriated.
hil: ALLAH imposes on no soul a responsibility greater than it can bear. It belongs to what it has earned and against it is what it has incurred.
compare: ALLAH imposes on no soul a responsibility greater than it can bear. It belongs to what it has earned and against it is what it has incurred.

src: ER sagte: "Du wirst Mich nicht sehen!
ref: "You cannot behold Me," He said.
draft: He said, "You won't see me!"
hil: He said, 'You will not behold Me!'
compare: He said, "You won't see me!"

src: Er sprach: "O Noah, er gehört nicht zu deiner Familie; siehe, dies ist kein rechtschaffenes Benehmen. So frage Mich nicht nach dem, von dem du keine Kenntnis hast.
ref: He said: "O Nuh (Noah)! Surely, he is not of your family; verily, his work is unrighteous, so ask not of Me that of which you have no knowledge!
draft: He said, "O Noah, he does not belong to your family; indeed, he is [one whose] conduct is other than righteous, so do not ask Me for that about which you have no knowledge."
hil: He said, "O Noah, he does not belong to your family; behold, this is not righteous behavior. Do not question me about something you do not have knowledge of."
compare: He said, "O Noah, he does not belong to your family; behold, this is not righteous behavior. Do not question me about something you do not have knowledge of."

src: Auch hat Er die Herdentiere erschaffen.
ref: And the cattle! He hath created them.
draft: Also, He created the herd animals.
hil: He has also created the herd animals.
compare: He has also created the herd animals.

src: Er sagte zu seinen Angehörigen: "Bleibt hier.
ref: "Wait here," he said to his family; "I have seen a fire.
draft: He said to his relatives, "Stay here."
hil: "He said to his relatives, 'Stay here.'"
compare: "He said to his relatives, 'Stay here.'"

src: Und wir erklärten den Tag des Gerichtes für Lüge,
ref: And rejected the Day of Judgement as a lie
draft: And we declared the Day of Judgment to be a lie.
hil: And we denied the Day of Judgment, as did those before us who rejected the signs of God, and were punished for their sins; and the punishment of God is severe.
compare: And we declared the Day of Judgment to be a lie.

src: Und gewähre ihnen Einblick, denn sie werden den Einblick haben.
ref: And wait; they will come to know soon.
draft: And grant them insight, for they will have the insight.
hil: Grant them insight, for they will have insight.
compare: Grant them insight, for they will have insight.

src: Dem das Königreich der Himmel und der Erde gehört; und Allah ist Zeuge von allem.
ref: Whose kingdom spreads over the heavens and the earth. God is witness over everything.
draft: To whom belongs the kingdom of heaven and earth; and Allah is witness to everything.
hil: To Him belongs the kingship of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is a Witness over all things.
compare: To Him belongs the kingship of the heavens and the earth; and Allah is a Witness over all things.

src: Sie möchten gern die Worte Gottes abändern. Sprich: «Ihr dürft uns nicht folgen.
ref: They want to change God's word, but tell them, "You shall not follow us.
draft: They would like to modify the words of God. Say, "You must not follow us."
hil: They would like to modify the words of God. Say, 'You must not follow us.'
compare: They would like to modify the words of God. Say, "You must not follow us."

src: Sag: "Wie seht ihr eure beigesellten Partner, an die ihr anstelle von ALLAH Bittgebete richtet? Zeigt mir, was sie von der Erde erschufen!
ref: Proclaim, “Just show me your partners (false deities) whom you worship other than Allah; show me which part of the earth have they created – or do they have any share in the heavens?”
draft: Say: "How do you see your associated partners to whom you direct prayer instead of Allah? Show me what they have created on earth!
hil: Say: "How do you see your associated partners to whom you direct prayer instead of Allah? Show me what they have created on earth!"
compare: Say: "How do you see your associated partners to whom you direct prayer instead of Allah? Show me what they have created on earth!

src: Dann erretten WIR Unsere Gesandten und diejenigen, die den Iman verinnerlicht haben. Solcherart obliegt es Uns, die Mumin zu erretten.
ref: Then We shall save Our Noble Messengers and the believers – this is it; it is incumbent upon Our mercy to save the Muslims.
draft: Then we will save our messengers and those who have internalized the faith. In this way, it is our responsibility to save the believers.
hil: Then we save our messengers and those who have internalized the faith. It is thus our responsibility to save the believers.
compare: Then we will save our messengers and those who have internalized the faith. In this way, it is our responsibility to save the believers.

src: Allah ist mit den Standhaften.
ref: Truly! Allah is with As-Sabirin (the patient ones, etc.).
draft: Allah is with the steadfast.
hil: God is with those who are determined.
compare: God is with those who are determined.

src: Die die Engel abberufen, während sie gute (Menschen) gewesen sind.
ref: Those whom the angels cause to die (when they are) good.
draft: "Those who the angels recall, while they have been good (people)."
hil: "Those whom the angels take while they have been good (people)."
compare: "Those whom the angels take while they have been good (people)."

src: Und wer von euch krank ist oder an seinem Haupt ein Leiden hat, der soll Ersatz leisten durch Fasten, Mildtätigkeit oder Darbringen eines Schlachtopfers.
ref: But if you are sick or have ailment of the scalp (preventing the shaving of hair), then offer expiation by fasting or else giving alms or a sacrificial offering.
draft: And whoever among you is sick or has a head ailment, shall provide compensation by fasting, charity or offering a sacrifice.
hil: Those of you who are sick or suffering from a head ailment (that prevents hair shaving) must offer expiation by fasting, giving charity, or offering a sacrificial animal.
compare: And whoever among you is sick or has a head ailment, shall provide compensation by fasting, charity or offering a sacrifice.

src: O die ihr glaubt, wenn ihr gläubige Frauen heiratet und euch hierauf von ihnen scheidet, bevor ihr sie berührt habt, dann dürft ihr für sie keine von euch berechnete Wartezeit aussetzen; gewährt ihnen eine Abfindung und gebt sie auf schöne Weise frei.
ref: O you who believe, when you marry believing women then divorce them before having (sexual) contact with them, you have no right to demand observance of the 'waiting period' of them. But provide suitably for them, and let them go with honour.
draft: O you who believe, if you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, then there is no waiting period for you to count for them. Give them [a gift of] compensation and release them in a gracious manner.
hil: O you who believe, if you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, then there is no waiting period for you to count for them. Give them [a gift of] compensation and release them in a gracious manner.
compare: O you who believe, if you marry believing women and then divorce them before you have touched them, then there is no waiting period for you to count for them. Give them [a gift of] compensation and release them in a gracious manner.

src: Sag: "Wie seht ihr es? Wenn ALLAH mich und diejenigen mit mir zugrunde richtet oder Gnade erweist, wer gewährt den Kafir einen Schutz vor einer qualvollen Peinigung?"
ref: Say: "Just think: If God destroys me and those with me, or is benevolent to us, who will then protect the unbelievers from a painful doom?"
draft: Say: "How do you see it? If ALLAH destroys me and those with me or shows mercy, who will grant the unbelievers protection from a painful punishment?"
hil: Say: "Have you ever thought, if ALLAH were to destroy me and those with me or show mercy, who would grant protection to the unbelievers from a painful punishment?"
compare: Say: "Have you ever thought, if ALLAH were to destroy me and those with me or show mercy, who would grant protection to the unbelievers from a painful punishment?"

src: Es ist die Gemeinschaft eures Vaters Ibrahim. ER nannte euch Muslime vorher und in diesem (Quran), damit der Gesandte Zeuge über euch wird und ihr Zeugen über die Menschen werdet.
ref: He hath named you Muslims of old time and in this (Scripture), that the messenger may be a witness against you, and that ye may be witnesses against mankind. So establish worship, pay the poor-due, and hold fast to Allah.
draft: It is the community of your father Ibrahim. He called you Muslims before and in this (Quran), so that the messenger may be a witness over you, and you may be witnesses over the people.
hil: It is the community of your father Ibrahim. He called you Muslims before and in this (Quran), so that the messenger may be a witness over you, and you may be witnesses over the people.
compare: It is the community of your father Ibrahim. He called you Muslims before and in this (Quran), so that the messenger may be a witness over you, and you may be witnesses over the people.

src: Den Herrn von Mose und Aaron.»
ref: "The Lord of Moses and Aaron."
draft: "To Mr. Moses and Aaron."
hil: To the Lord of Moses and Aaron.
compare: To the Lord of Moses and Aaron.

src: Und sie sagten: "Was ist los mit diesem Gesandten, er ißt die Speisen und geht zu den Märkten, würde zu ihm doch ein Engel herabgesandt, damit er mit ihm einWarner wird!
ref: But they say: "What sort of prophet is this who eats food and walks the market places? Why was no angel sent to him to act as admonisher with him?
draft: And they said: "What's wrong with this messenger, he eats the food and goes to the markets, if only an angel was sent down to him, to be a warner with him!"
hil: "And they said: 'What's wrong with this messenger, he eats the food and goes to the markets, if only an angel was sent down to him, to be a warner with him!'"
compare: And they said: "What's wrong with this messenger, he eats the food and goes to the markets, if only an angel was sent down to him, to be a warner with him!"

src: Er ist es, Der euch bei Nacht abberuft und weiß, was ihr bei Tag begangen habt, und euch hierauf an ihm auferweckt, damit eine festgesetzte Frist erfüllt wird.
ref: It is He indeed who sends you to death at night, and knows what you do in the day, then makes you rise with it again in order that the fixed term of life be fulfilled.
draft: He is the one who calls you at night and knows what you have done during the day, and then raises you up to Him so that a fixed term may be fulfilled.
hil: He is the one who calls you at night and knows what you have done during the day, and then raises you up to Him so that a fixed term may be fulfilled.
compare: He is the one who calls you at night and knows what you have done during the day, and then raises you up to Him so that a fixed term may be fulfilled.

src: Und hütet ja eure Eide. So macht euch Allah Seine Zeichen klar, auf daß ihr dankbar sein möget.
ref: So God makes clear to you His signs; haply you will be thankful.
draft: And keep your oaths. Thus Allah makes His signs clear to you, that you may be grateful.
hil: And keep your oaths. Thus does Allah make clear to you His signs that you may be grateful.
compare: And keep your oaths. Thus Allah makes His signs clear to you, that you may be grateful.

src: Sie sagten: "Verbrennt ihn und helft euren Göttern, wenn ihr etwas tun wollt."
ref: They said: "Burn him, and save your gods, if you are men of action."
draft: They said, "Burn him and help your gods, if you want to do something."
hil: They said, 'Burn him and help your gods, if you want to do something.'
compare: They said, "Burn him and help your gods, if you want to do something."

src: Gewiß, ALLAH bleibt immer allwissend, allkundig.
ref: Indeed Allah is Ever All-Knower, Well-Acquainted with all things.
draft: Sure, ALLAH always remains omniscient and all-knowing.
hil: Verily, Allah remains all-knowing, all-knower.
compare: Sure, ALLAH always remains omniscient and all-knowing.

src: Ihr werdet (noch) erfahren, über wen eine Strafe kommen wird, die ihn in Schande stürzt, und wer ein Lügner ist.
ref: You will come to know who it is on whom descends the torment that will cover him with ignominy, and who is a liar!
draft: You will (still) find out who will be punished in a way that brings shame upon them, and who is a liar.
hil: You will (still) find out over whom a punishment will come that will bring shame upon him, and who is a liar.
compare: You will (still) find out over whom a punishment will come that will bring shame upon him, and who is a liar.

src: Aber diejenigen, die böse Taten begehen und danach bereuen und glauben-, gewiß, dein Herr ist danach wahrlich Allvergebend und Barmherzig.
ref: Yet those who do wrong, then repent and believe, are forgiven, for your Lord is forgiving and kind.
draft: But those who commit evil deeds and then repent and believe, surely your Lord is thereafter truly All-forgiving and Merciful.
hil: "But those who commit evil deeds and then repent and believe, surely your Lord is thereafter truly All-forgiving and Merciful."
compare: But those who commit evil deeds and then repent and believe, surely your Lord is thereafter truly All-forgiving and Merciful.

src: Sie sind doch nicht ihre Mütter. Ihre Mütter sind die, die sie geboren haben.
ref: Their mothers are none else but those who gave birth to them.
draft: You are not their mothers. Their mothers are the ones who gave birth to them.
hil: You are not their mothers. Their mothers are the ones who gave birth to them.
compare: You are not their mothers. Their mothers are the ones who gave birth to them.

src: Als ob sie wohlverwahrte Eier wären.
ref: Like sheltered eggs in a nest.
draft: As if they were well-preserved eggs.
hil: As if they were well-preserved eggs.
compare: As if they were well-preserved eggs.

src: Reisende kamen vorbei. Sie sandten ihren Wasserschöpfer, und er ließ seinen Eimer hinunter.
ref: A caravan happened to pass, and sent the water-carrier to bring water from the well.
draft: Travelers passed by. They sent down their water scooper, and he lowered his bucket.
hil: Travelers passed by. They sent down their water scooper, and he lowered his bucket.
compare: Travelers passed by. They sent down their water scooper, and he lowered his bucket.

src: Er ist zweifelsohne dieWahrheit von unserem HERRN! Wir waren doch vor ihm Muslime."
ref: Indeed even before it we have been from those who submit themselves to Allah in Islam as Muslims (like 'Abdullah bin Salam and Salman Al-Farisi, etc.).
draft: He is undoubtedly the truth of our LORD! We were Muslims before him.
hil: "He is undoubtedly the truth of our LORD! We were Muslims before him."
compare: He is undoubtedly the truth of our LORD! We were Muslims before him.

src: 'Ain-sin-qaf.
ref: 'Am Sin Qaf.
draft: Ain-sin-qaf.
hil: Ain-sin-qaf.
compare: Ain-sin-qaf.

src: Und Wir wollen euch sicherlich prüfen, bis Wir diejenigen von euch ausscheiden, die kämpfen und standhaft sind.
ref: We shall certainly test you until We know those who strive hard for the cause of God and those who exercise patience.
draft: And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allah] and the patient
hil: We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allah] and the patient.
compare: And We will surely test you until We make evident those who strive among you [for the cause of Allah] and the patient

src: ALLAH gewährt viel Rizq, wem ER will, und läßt es wenig sein.
ref: God outspreads and straitens His provision unto whomsoever He will.
draft: ALLAH grants much provision to whom HE wills and restricts it.
hil: In truth, my Lord increases or restricts the provision of any of His creatures as He will, and repays whatsoever you spend.
compare: ALLAH grants much provision to whom HE wills and restricts it.

src: Du brichst das Versprechen nicht.»
ref: Verily Thou failest not the tryst.
draft: "You don't break the promise."
hil: You do not break the promise.
compare: "You don't break the promise."

src: Und diejenigen, die weder neben ALLAH an einen anderen Gott Bittgebete richten, noch den Menschen töten, den ALLAH für haram erklärte, außer mit Berechtigung, noch Zina begehen.
ref: And those who call not unto anot her god along with Allah and slay not any soul which Allah hath forbidden, save in justification, and commit not fornication.
draft: And those who do not direct supplication to any other god alongside Allah, nor kill a human being whom Allah has declared inviolate, except in rightful cause, nor commit illicit sex.
hil: And those who do not direct supplication to any other deity alongside Allah, nor kill a person whom Allah has declared inviolate, except in rightful cause, nor commit adultery.
compare: And those who do not direct supplication to any other god alongside Allah, nor kill a human being whom Allah has declared inviolate, except in rightful cause, nor commit illicit sex.

src: (Sei nicht traurig,) denn du kannst nicht die Toten hören lassen noch die Tauben den Ruf hören lassen, wenn sie den Rücken kehren.
ref: You cannot make the dead to listen nor the deaf hear the call when they have turned back and retreated,
draft: "Don't be sad, because you can't make the dead hear or the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs."
hil: "Don't be sad, because you cannot make the dead hear or the deaf hear a call when they turn their backs."
compare: "Don't be sad, because you can't make the dead hear or the deaf hear the call when they turn their backs."

src: Diese sind die Weggenossen des Feuers. Darin werden sie ewig sein.
ref: Those are the dwellers of the Fire, and they will abide therein forever.
draft: These are the companions of the fire. They will be in it forever.
hil: They are the companions of the fire. They will be in it forever.
compare: These are the companions of the fire. They will be in it forever.

src: Darum führe uns unter den Bezeugenden auf."
ref: Enroll us among the witnesses."
draft: Therefore lead us among the witnesses."
hil: Therefore, lead us among the witnesses who testify."
compare: Therefore, lead us among the witnesses who testify."

src: Also lasse uns das zuteil werden, wovor du uns warnst, solltest du von den Wahrhaftigen sein."
ref: If so, bring on us what you threaten us with, if what you say is true."
draft: "Let us experience what you warn us against, if you are truly truthful."
hil: Let us be subject to what you warn us against, if you are of the truthful ones.
compare: Let us be subject to what you warn us against, if you are of the truthful ones.

src: O Prophet, mühe dich gegen die Ungläubigen und Heuchler ab und sei hart gegen sie! Ihr Zufluchtsort wird die Hölle sein - ein schlimmer Ausgang!
ref: O Herald of the Hidden! Fight against the disbelievers and the hypocrites, and be stern with them; and their destination hell; and what an evil place to return!
draft: O Prophet, strive against the unbelievers and the hypocrites and be stern with them! Their refuge will be Hell, and evil is the destination.
hil: O Prophet, struggle with the unbelievers and the hypocrites, and be harsh with them! Their refuge will be Hell, an evil homecoming.
compare: O Prophet, strive against the unbelievers and the hypocrites and be stern with them! Their refuge will be Hell, and evil is the destination.

src: Es sind Finsternisse, die einen über den anderen, wenn er seine Hand ausstreckt, beinahe sieht er sie nicht.
ref: If you stretch your hand, you could hardly see it.
draft: There are eclipses that one over the other, when he reaches out his hand, he almost can't see them.
hil: They are darknesses, one above the other, which he almost cannot see when he reaches out his hand.
compare: They are darknesses, one above the other, which he almost cannot see when he reaches out his hand.

src: Darin bleiben sie ewig, wie die Himmel und die Erde (des Jenseits) bleiben - außer was dein HERR will. Gewiß, dein HERR macht, was ER will.
ref: Remaining in it as long as the heavens and the earth remain, except as much as your Lord willed*; indeed your Lord may do whatever, whenever, He wills. (* Remaining forever even after the heavens and the earth are destroyed.)
draft: They remain in it forever, as the heavens and the earth of the hereafter remain - except what your Lord wills. Indeed, your Lord does whatever He wills.
hil: They remain in it forever, as the heavens and the earth of the hereafter remain - except what your Lord wills. Indeed, your Lord does whatever He wills.
compare: They remain in it forever, as the heavens and the earth of the hereafter remain - except what your Lord wills. Indeed, your Lord does whatever He wills.

src: Zwei Männer von denjenigen, die Ehrfurcht haben und denen ALLAH von Seinen Gaben gewährte, sagten: "Tretet zu ihnen durch das Tor ein! Und wenn ihr es durchschritten habt, werdet ihr dann doch Sieger sein.
ref: Two men of those who feared, but whom God had blessed, said, “Go at them by the gate; and when you have entered it, you will prevail.
draft: Two men from those who have awe and to whom ALLAH granted His favors said: "Enter through the gate to them! And when you have passed through it, you will still be victorious.
hil: Two men from among those who fear Allah and who Allah favoured said: "Enter upon them by force, through the gate; if you enter the gate, victory will be yours."
compare: Two men from among those who fear Allah and who Allah favoured said: "Enter upon them by force, through the gate; if you enter the gate, victory will be yours."

src: Am Tag, da Allah sie alle auferweckt, da werden sie Ihm schwören, wie sie euch schwören, und meinen, sie hätten eine Grundlage.
ref: On the day that God will raise them together, they will swear before Him as they swear before you, and imagine they are on the right path.
draft: On the day when Allah resurrects them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think they have a basis.
hil: On the day when God will resurrect them all together, they will swear to Him as they swore to you and they will think that they have a good case but they are certainly liars.
compare: On the day when Allah resurrects them all, they will swear to Him as they swear to you and think they have a basis.

src: Aber trefft nicht heimlich eine Abmachung mit ihnen, außer ihr sagt geziemende Worte.
ref: And do not consummate the marriage until the term prescribed is fulfilled.
draft: But do not secretly make an agreement with them, unless you speak fitting words.
hil: But do not promise them secretly unless you speak fitting words.
compare: But do not secretly make an agreement with them, unless you speak fitting words.

src: Dann wurde er ein Blutklumpen; dann bildete und vervollkommnete Er (ihn)
ref: Then formed into an embryo? Then He fashioned, shaped and proportioned
draft: Then he became a blood clot; then He formed and perfected it.
hil: "Then he became a blood clot; then He formed and perfected it."
compare: Then he became a blood clot; then He formed and perfected it.

src: Um undankbar zu sein für das, was Wir ihnen zukommen ließen. So genießet nur.
ref: That they may show ingratitude for that which We have vouchsafed unto them.
draft: To be ungrateful for what we have bestowed upon them. So just enjoy.
hil: Be ungrateful for what we have bestowed upon them. So just enjoy.
compare: To be ungrateful for what we have bestowed upon them. So just enjoy.

src: Wissen sie denn nicht, daß Allah die Versorgung großzügig gewährt, wem Er will, und auch bemißt?
ref: Do they not know that God enhances or restricts the provision of any one He will.
draft: Do you not know that Allah generously grants provision to whom He wills and restricts it?
hil: Do you not know that Allah generously grants provision to whom He wills and also measures it out?
compare: Do you not know that Allah generously grants provision to whom He wills and restricts it?

src: Und ALLAH gegenüber sollen die Mumin Tawakkul üben!
ref: And in God let the believers put their trust.
draft: And the believers should practice trust in Allah!
hil: And oh believers, you should have trust (Tawakkul) in Allah!
compare: And oh believers, you should have trust (Tawakkul) in Allah!

src: Und erwähne in der Schrift Isma'il! Gewiß, er war wahrhaftig im Versprechen und war ein Gesandter, ein Prophet.
ref: And remember Ismail in the Book; he was indeed true to his promise and was a Noble Messenger, a Prophet.
draft: And mention Ishmael in the Scripture. Verily, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger, a prophet.
hil: And mention Ishmael in the Scripture. Verily, he was true to his promise and he was a messenger, a prophet.
compare: And mention Ishmael in the Scripture. Verily, he was true to his promise, and he was a messenger, a prophet.

src: Oder (sind jene sicher davor,) daß Er sie nicht durch vorgewarnte Vernichtung erfaßt? Euer Herr ist wahrlich Gütig Barmherzig.
ref: Or, that he will not take hold of them by giving them a fright? verily thy Lord is Kind, Merciful.
draft: Or (are those) safe from His punishment, protected by a preemptive strike? Your Lord is truly kind and merciful.
hil: Or (are they safe from) being caught by His pre-warned destruction? Your Lord is truly kind and merciful.
compare: Or (are they safe from) being caught by His pre-warned destruction? Your Lord is truly kind and merciful.

src: Und Allah hat euch aus Erde erschaffen, dann aus einem Samentropfen, dann machte Er euch zu Paaren. Und kein weibliches Wesen wird schwanger oder entbindet ohne Sein Wissen.
ref: God has created you from dust, then from a drop of semen and then divided you into pairs; no female conceives or gives birth without His knowledge; and no one's life is prolonged or shortened, but it is recorded in a Book.
draft: And Allah has created you from the earth, then from a sperm drop, then He made you into pairs. And no female being becomes pregnant or gives birth without His knowledge.
hil: Allah created you from the earth, then from a sperm drop, then made you into pairs. And no female being becomes pregnant or gives birth without His knowledge.
compare: And Allah has created you from the earth, then from a sperm drop, then He made you into pairs. And no female being becomes pregnant or gives birth without His knowledge.

src: Und wenn sie ein Zeichen sehen, so verdrehen sie es zu Spott
ref: When they see a sign, they laugh at it,
draft: And when they see a sign, they turn it into ridicule.
hil: And if they see a sign, they turn it into ridicule.
compare: And if they see a sign, they turn it into ridicule.

src: Belehrt hat ihn der Besitzer starker Kräfte,
ref: Bestowed on him by the Supreme Intellect,
draft: The owner of strong powers has instructed him.
hil: He was instructed by the owner of strong powers.
compare: The owner of strong powers has instructed him.

src: Und ALLAH ist über das, was ihr tut, allwissend.
ref: God is aware of what you do.
draft: And Allah is all-knowing about what you do.
hil: But God is all-knowing of what you do.
compare: But God is all-knowing of what you do.

src: Sie sagten: "O Moses, siehe, dort lebt ein tyrannisches Volk, und wir werden es (das Land) nicht betreten, ehe jene es nicht verlassen haben.
ref: They said: "O Moses, in that land live a people who are formidable; we shall never go there until they leave.
draft: They said, "O Moses, behold, there resides a tyrannical people in that land, and we shall not enter it until they depart from it."
hil: They said, "O Moses, behold, there resides a tyrannical people in that land, and we shall not enter it until they depart from it."
compare: They said, "O Moses, behold, there resides a tyrannical people in that land, and we shall not enter it until they depart from it."

src: Was dich an Gutem traf, dies ist von ALLAH. Und was dich an Unglück traf, dies ist aufgrund eigener (Verfehlungen).
ref: What comes to you of good is verily from God; and what comes to you of ill is from your own self (your actions).
draft: What hit you in goodness, that is from Allah. And what hit you in misfortune, that is due to your own wrongdoing.
hil: What hit you in goodness is from Allah, and what hit you in misfortune is due to your own wrongdoing.
compare: What hit you in goodness is from Allah, and what hit you in misfortune is due to your own wrongdoing.

src: Und zu Uns führt der Lebensweg.
ref: To Us is the arrival.
draft: And the path of life leads us to Us.
hil: And the path of life leads us to Him.
compare: And the path of life leads us to Him.

src: Das ist die Ermahnung derer, die mit mir sind, und die Ermahnung derer, die vor mir lebten. Aber die meisten von ihnen kennen die Wahrheit nicht, so wenden sie sich ab.
ref: Say, “Bring your proof; this is the remembrance of those with me and those before me”; but in fact most of them do not know the Truth, so they turn away.
draft: "This is the admonition of those who are with me, and the admonition of those who lived before me. But most of them do not know the truth, so they turn away."
hil: This is the admonition of those who are with me, and the admonition of those who lived before me. But many of them do not know the truth, so they turn away.
compare: "This is the admonition of those who are with me, and the admonition of those who lived before me. But most of them do not know the truth, so they turn away."

src: Gewiß, manches Spekulieren ist eine Verfehlung.
ref: And spy not, neither backbite one another.
draft: Surely, some speculating is a failure.
hil: Indeed, some speculating is a failure.
compare: Indeed, some speculating is a failure.

src: Er sprach: "lch bin der Bote deines Herrn.
ref: If thou fearest God...
draft: He said, "I am the messenger of your Lord."
hil: He said, 'I am the messenger of your Lord.'
compare: He said, "I am the messenger of your Lord."

src: Und sie folgten dem, was die Satane während der Herrschaft Salomos vortrugen; doch nicht Salomo war ungläubig, sondern. die Satane waren ungläubig; sie brachten den Menschen die Zauberei bei sowie das, was den beiden Engeln in Babel, Harut und Marut, herabgesandt wurde.
ref: And they follow that which the Satans recited in the reign of Sulaiman; and Sulaiman blasphemed not, but the Satans blasphemed.; teaching people magic; and they follow that also which was sent down unto the two angels in Babil, Harut, and Marut.
draft: And they followed what the Satan during Solomon's reign recited; but not Solomon was an unbeliever, but the Satans were unbelievers; They taught people sorcery and that which was sent down to the two angels at Babel, Harut and Marut.
hil: And they followed what the Satans recited during the reign of Solomon; but it was not Solomon who was unbelieving, but the Satans were unbelieving; they taught people sorcery and what was revealed to the two angels at Babylon, Harut and Marut.
compare: And they followed what the Satans recited during the reign of Solomon; but it was not Solomon who was unbelieving, but the Satans were unbelieving; they taught people sorcery and what was revealed to the two angels at Babylon, Harut and Marut.

src: (Dies) als Belohnung von deinem Herrn, als hinreichende Gabe,
ref: A recompense from your Lord, a sufficient gift,
draft: As a reward from your Lord, as a sufficient gift.
hil: As a reward from your Lord, as a sufficient gift.
compare: As a reward from your Lord, as a sufficient gift.
