ref: And the old women residing in houses who do not have the desire of marriage – it is no sin upon them if they discard their upper coverings provided they do not display their adornment; and avoiding even this is better for them; and Allah is All Hearing, All Knowing.
draft: (As for) the older women who can no longer hope to marry, there is no blame on them if they shed their cloaks without displaying their adornment. But if they refrain from doing so, it is better for them. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
hil: As for older women who can no longer hope to marry, they shall not be blamed if they take off their outer garments without revealing their adornment. But to refrain from doing so is better for them. Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.
compare: (As for) the older women who can no longer hope to marry, there is no blame on them if they shed their cloaks without displaying their adornment. But if they refrain from doing so, it is better for them. And Allah is All-Hearing, All-Knowing.

src: Und wenn sie zu euch kommen, sagen sie: "Wir haben den Iman bekundet.", während sie selbst doch mit dem Kufr eingetreten und mit diesem fortgegangen sind.
ref: And when they come to you they say: we believe; whereas surely with infidelity they entered and surely with it they went forth.
draft: And when they come to you, they say, "We have expressed faith", while they themselves have entered with disbelief and left with it.
hil: They come to you saying 'We have declared faith,' while in fact they entered with disbelief and left with it.
compare: They come to you saying 'We have declared faith,' while in fact they entered with disbelief and left with it.

src: Und Wir trafen mit ihnen ein festes Abkommen.
ref: We made a solemn covenant with them.
draft: And we made a firm agreement with them.
hil: And We made with them a firm agreement.
compare: And we made a firm agreement with them.

src: Und WIR setzten für ihr Zugrunde-Richten einen Termin fest.
ref: And We appointed a fixed time for their destruction.
draft: And WE set a date for their judgment.
hil: "And WE set a date for their judgment."
compare: And WE set a date for their judgment.

src: Mein HERR! Schenke mir Weisheit und lasse mich den gottgefällig Guttuenden folgen!
ref: O Lord, give me wisdom and admit me among the righteous,
draft: My Lord! Grant me wisdom and let me follow the God-pleasing good deeds!
hil: My Lord, grant me wisdom and allow me to follow righteous deeds that please You.
compare: My Lord! Grant me wisdom and let me follow the God-pleasing good deeds!

src: Für diejenigen, die Unrecht tun, ist ein Los bestimmt wie das Los ihrer Gefährten.
ref: Those who do wrong will indeed come to the same end as their fellows (of old).
draft: "For those who do wrong, a fate is determined like the fate of their comrades."
hil: Those who do wrong are destined for a fate like the fate of their companions.
compare: Those who do wrong are destined for a fate like the fate of their companions.

src: Erwarten Sie denn etwas anderes, als daß die Engel zu ihnen kommen, oder daß der Befehl deines Herrn eintrifft?
ref: So what are they waiting for, except that the angels come upon them or that your Lord’s punishment comes?
draft: Do you expect anything other than that the angels come to them, or that the command of your Lord arrives?
hil: Do you expect anything else than that the angels come to them, or that the command of your Lord arrives?
compare: Do you expect anything other than that the angels come to them, or that the command of your Lord arrives?

src: Und wer macht die Schöpfung am Anfang und wiederholt sie? Und wer versorgt euch vom Himmel und von der Erde?
ref: Or He Who initiates the creation, then will create it again, and He Who provides you sustenance from the skies and the earth?
draft: And who makes the creation at the beginning and repeats it? And who supplies you from heaven and earth?
hil: And who gives you food and sustenance from the skies and the earth? Say: "Who provides you with sustenance from the heavens and the earth?"
compare: And who gives you food and sustenance from the skies and the earth? Say: "Who provides you with sustenance from the heavens and the earth?"

src: Ihr, die den Iman verinnerlicht habt! Wer von euch sich von seinem Din abwendet, so wird ALLAH Menschen bringen, die ER liebt und welche Ihn lieben.
ref: Believers, if any among you renounce the faith, God will replace them by others who love Him and are loved by Him, who will be kind and considerate towards believers and firm and unyielding towards those who deny the truth.
draft: You who have internalized the Iman! Whoever turns away from his Din among you, Allah will bring people whom He loves and who love Him.
hil: You who have internalized the faith! Whoever turns away from their Din among you, Allah will bring people whom He loves and who love Him.
compare: You who have internalized the Iman! Whoever turns away from his Din among you, Allah will bring people whom He loves and who love Him.

src: Sie sagten: "Bist du zu uns gekommen, um uns von dem abzubringen, worin wir unsere Väter (vor)gefunden haben, und damit euch beiden die Oberhoheit im Land werde?
ref: "Have you come," said they, "to turn us back from what we found our ancestors doing, so that the two of you may attain supremacy in the land?
draft: They said: "Did you come to us to divert us from what our fathers have found, so that you both may have dominance in the land?
hil: They said, 'Did you come to us to divert us from what our fathers have found, so that you both may have dominance in the land?'
compare: They said: "Did you come to us to divert us from what our fathers have found, so that you both may have dominance in the land?

src: Und (Er läßt dies zu,) damit diejenigen, denen das Wissen gegeben wurde, erkennen, daß es die Wahrheit von deinem Herrn ist, auf daß sie daran glauben und ihre Herzen sich Ihm friedvoll unterwerfen mögen. Und siehe, Allah leitet jene, die gläubig sind, auf den geraden Weg.
ref: And so that the people given the knowledge may know that it is the truth from your Lord, in order that they may accept faith in it, therefore their hearts may humble before Him; and indeed Allah will guide the believers on the Straight Path.
draft: And (He allows this,) so that those to whom knowledge has been given may know that it is the Truth from your Lord, and that they may believe in it, and their hearts may submit peacefully to Him. And Allah definitely guides the believers to the straight path.
hil: And (He allows this) so that those to whom knowledge has been given may recognize that it is the Truth from your Lord, that they may believe in it and submit their hearts peacefully to Him. And Allah guides those who believe to the straight path.
compare: And (He allows this) so that those to whom knowledge has been given may recognize that it is the Truth from your Lord, that they may believe in it and submit their hearts peacefully to Him. And Allah guides those who believe to the straight path.

src: Hätten sie gesagt: «Wir hören, und wir gehorchen», und: «Höre», und: «Schau auf uns» (unzurnaa), wäre es besser und richtiger für sie. Aber Gott hat sie wegen ihres Unglaubens verflucht, so glauben sie nur wenig.
ref: If they had said, 'We have heard and obey' and 'Hear' and 'Regard us,' it would have been better for them, and more upright; but God has cursed them for their unbelief so they believe not except a few.
draft: If they had said, "We listen and we obey," and, "Listen," and, "Look at us" (unzurnaa), it would be better and more correct for them. But God has cursed them because of their disbelief, so they believe only a little.
hil: If they had said, "We listen and we obey," and, "Listen," and, "Look at us" (unzurnaa), it would be better and more correct for them. But God has cursed them because of their disbelief, so they believe only a little.
compare: If they had said, "We listen and we obey," and, "Listen," and, "Look at us" (unzurnaa), it would be better and more correct for them. But God has cursed them because of their disbelief, so they believe only a little.

src: Dann befände ich mich wahrlich in einem offenkundigen Irrtum.
ref: In that case I would surely be in clear error.
draft: Then I would truly be in an obvious error.
hil: "Then I would truly be in a clear error."
compare: "Then I would truly be in a clear error."

src: Wenn aber jemand (dazu) gezwungen ist, ohne (es) zu begehren und ohne das Maß zu überschreiten, so trifft ihn keine Schuld; wahrlich, Allah ist Allverzeihend, Barmherzig.
ref: If one is obliged by necessity to eat it without intending to transgress, or reverting to it, he is not guilty of sin; for God is forgiving and kind.
draft: If, however, someone is forced to do so without desiring it and without exceeding the limit, then he is not guilty; truly, Allah is All-Forgiving, Merciful.
hil: "But if someone is forced to do something without desiring it and without exceeding the limit, then he is not guilty; truly, Allah is All-Forgiving, Merciful."
compare: If, however, someone is forced to do so without desiring it and without exceeding the limit, then he is not guilty; truly, Allah is All-Forgiving, Merciful.

src: Sag: "Ihr Schriftbesitzer! Ihr habt nichts (vom Din), bis ihr At-taurat und Alindschil und das einhaltet, was euch von eurem HERRN hinabgesandt wurde.
ref: Say to them: "O people of the Book, you have no ground (for argument) until you follow the Torah and the Gospel and what has been revealed to you by your Lord."
draft: Say: "Oh you who possess the scripture, you have nothing (of guidance) until you observe the Torah and the Gospel and what has been revealed to you from your Lord."
hil: Say, you people of the Book, you have nothing (of guidance) until you observe the Torah and the Gospel and what has been revealed to you from your Lord.
compare: Say: "Oh you who possess the scripture, you have nothing (of guidance) until you observe the Torah and the Gospel and what has been revealed to you from your Lord."

src: Und (erinnere daran), als Musa zu seinen Leuten sagte: "Gewiß, ALLAH gebietet euch, eine Kuh zu schlachten."
ref: And when Moses said to his people, 'God commands you to sacrifice a cow.'
draft: And (remember) when Musa said to his people, "Verily, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow."
hil: And (remember) when Musa said to his people, 'Verily, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow.'
compare: And (remember) when Musa said to his people, "Verily, Allah commands you to slaughter a cow."

src: Könntest du nur sehen wenn sie mit Furcht geschlagen sein werden!
ref: And couldst thou see the time when they shall be terrified!
draft: Could you only see when they will be struck with fear!
hil: O you who believe! If you could only see when they will be struck with fear (on the Day of Judgment)! Allah has relieved you of questioning about this and Allah is Forgiving, Forbearing.
compare: O you who believe! If you could only see when they will be struck with fear (on the Day of Judgment)! Allah has relieved you of questioning about this and Allah is Forgiving, Forbearing.

src: ER ist Der Allhörende, Der Allwissende.
ref: He is the Hearer, the Knower.
draft: He is the all-hearing, the all-knowing.
hil: He is The All-Hearing, The All-Knowing.
compare: He is The All-Hearing, The All-Knowing.

src: Und ALLAHs Erde ist weit.
ref: And God’s earth is vast.
draft: And ALLAH's earth is vast.
hil: And Allah's earth is vast.
compare: And ALLAH's earth is vast.

src: Gewiß, die Unrecht-Begehenden werden nie erfolgreich werden."
ref: But surely the wicked will not prosper."
draft: "Surely, wrongdoers will never succeed."
hil: Certainly, those who commit injustice will never be successful.
compare: Certainly, those who commit injustice will never be successful.

src: Verleihe uns Geduld und lasse uns als Muslime sterben!"
ref: Pour (bestow abundantly) patience on us, and bestow us death as Muslims.”
draft: "Lend us patience and let us die as Muslims!"
hil: Lend us patience and let us die as Muslims!
compare: Lend us patience and let us die as Muslims!

src: Könnt ihr uns vor Gottes Pein etwas nützen?»
ref: They will say: "Had Allah guided us, we would have guided you.
draft: "Can you help us in the face of God's suffering?"
hil: Can you benefit us from God's torment?
compare: "Can you help us in the face of God's suffering?"

src: Diese erhalten einen Anteil von dem, was sie sich erworben haben. Gott ist schnell im Abrechnen.
ref: They are those who will surely have their share of whatsoever they have earned; for God is swift at the reckoning.
draft: These receive a share of what they have acquired. God is quick in settling scores.
hil: They receive a share of what they have acquired. God is quick in settling scores.
compare: These receive a share of what they have acquired. God is quick in settling scores.

src: (Das ist) Allahs Versprechen in Wahrheit.
ref: The Promise of Allah is true.
draft: This is Allah's promise in truth.
hil: This is Allah's binding promise in truth.
compare: This is Allah's binding promise in truth.

src: Sie können doch sich selbst nicht helfen, und sie werden keinen Beistand gegen Uns erhalten.
ref: But they are not able to help themselves, nor can they find protection against Us.
draft: You can't help yourself, and you won't get any help from us.
hil: You cannot help yourself, and you will not receive any support from us.
compare: You can't help yourself, and you won't get any help from us.

src: Und lauert nicht auf jedem Weg auf, um (Menschen) einzuschüchtern und von ALLAHs Weg diejenigen abzuhalten, die den Iman verinnerlicht haben - erstrebt nach dem Krümmen (dieses Weges). Und entsinnt euch, als ihr noch wenige wart, dann ließ ER euch mehr werden. Und nehmt wahr, wie das Anschließende von den Verderben-Anrichtenden war.
ref: “And do not be seated on every road in order to scare the travellers, and to prevent from Allah’s path the people who believe in Him, wishing to distort it; and remember when you were few and He increased your numbers; and see what sort of fate befell the mischievous!”
draft: And do not lie in wait on every path, endeavoring to frighten and turn away from Allah's way those who believe in Him, nor seek to make it crooked. And remember when you were few and He increased your number. And see how was the end of the corrupters.
hil: And do not lie in wait on every path, endeavoring to frighten and turn away from Allah's way those who have believed in Him, nor seek to make it crooked. And remember when you were few and He increased your number. And see how was the end of the corrupters.
compare: And do not lie in wait on every path, endeavoring to frighten and turn away from Allah's way those who believe in Him, nor seek to make it crooked. And remember when you were few and He increased your number. And see how was the end of the corrupters.

src: ER sagte: "WIR ließen doch deine Leute nach dir der Fitna aussetzen.
ref: Said He, 'We have tempted thy people since thou didst leave them.
draft: He said, "We did expose your people to fitna after you."
hil: He said, 'We did expose your people to fitna after you.'
compare: He said, "We did expose your people to fitna after you."

src: Und verkünde denen, die glauben und die guten Werke tun, daß für sie Gärten bestimmt sind, unter denen Bäche fließen.
ref: And bear thou the glad tidings unto those who believe and do righteous works that verily for them shall be Gardens whereunder rivers flow.
draft: And announce to those who believe and do good deeds that gardens are destined for them, beneath which rivers flow.
hil: Proclaim to those who believe and do good deeds that gardens are appointed for them, beneath which rivers flow.
compare: And announce to those who believe and do good deeds that gardens are destined for them, beneath which rivers flow.

src: Und gewiß, viele führen mit ihren Gelüsten durch Mangel an Wissen zum Irrweg.
ref: Surely many (men) mislead others into following their vain desires through lack of knowledge.
draft: And surely, many are led astray by their desires due to a lack of knowledge.
hil: Undoubtedly, many are led astray by their desires due to a lack of knowledge.
compare: And surely, many are led astray by their desires due to a lack of knowledge.

src: So prüfen Wir sie dafür, daß sie zu freveln pflegten.
ref: We tried them in this way, for they were disobedient.
draft: So we test them for having been accustomed to sin.
hil: We test them for having been accustomed to sin.
compare: So we test them for having been accustomed to sin.

src: Gewiß, WIR entsandten Nuh zu seinen Leuten: "Warne deine Leute, bevor zu ihnen eine qualvolle Peinigung kommt."
ref: SENT NOAH to his people to warn them before the painful punishment came upon them.
draft: Certainly, WE sent Noah to his people: "Warn your people before a painful torment comes to them."
hil: "Certainly, WE sent Noah to his people: \"Warn your people before a painful torment comes to them.\""
compare: Certainly, WE sent Noah to his people: "Warn your people before a painful torment comes to them."

src: Vielmehr sind sie Leute, die (Allah andere) gleichsetzen.
ref: Nay, but they are a people who ascribe equals (to Him)!
draft: Rather, they are people who equate (others with Allah).
hil: In fact, they are people who turn away (from the truth).
compare: Rather, they are people who equate (others with Allah).

src: Gewiß, ALLAH ist allwürdig, allweise.
ref: He is indeed all-mighty and all-wise.
draft: Certainly, Allah is worthy of all praise, all wise.
hil: Certainly, Allah is worthy of all praise, all wise.
compare: Certainly, Allah is worthy of all praise, all wise.

src: Und WIR werden euch bestimmt das Land nach ihnen bewohnen lassen. Dies ist für denjenigen, der Ehrfurcht vor der Vorstellung Mir gegenüber hat, und der Meine Androhung fürchtet."
ref: “And indeed We will establish you in the land after them; this is for him who fears to stand before Me and fears the commands of punishment declared by Me.”
draft: And WE will certainly let you inhabit the land after them. This is for the one who has awe of the thought towards Me, and who fears My threat.
hil: And WE will certainly let you inhabit the land after them. This is for the one who has awe of the thought towards Me, and who fears My threat.
compare: And WE will certainly let you inhabit the land after them. This is for the one who has awe of the thought towards Me, and who fears My threat.

src: Hast du etwa nicht diejenigen wahrgenommen, denen gesagt wurde: "Haltet euch zurück, verrichtet ordnungsgemäß das rituelle Gebet und entrichtet die Zakat"?!
ref: Have you not seen the people who were told: "Hold back your hands (from attacking), observe your devotional obligations and pay the zakat?"
draft: Did you not perceive those who were told to "restrain themselves, perform the ritual prayer properly, and pay the zakat"?!
hil: Did you not perceive those who were told to 'restrain themselves, perform the ritual prayer properly, and pay the zakat'?
compare: Did you not perceive those who were told to 'restrain themselves, perform the ritual prayer properly, and pay the zakat'?

src: "Und gewiß, als ALLAHs Diener aufstand, an Ihn Bittgebete zu richten, beinahe wären sie ihn Niederdrückende."
ref: When the devotee of God stood up to invoke Him (the jinns) crowded upon him (to listen).
draft: "And certainly, when Allah's servant stood up to pray to Him, they were almost overcome and overwhelmed him."
hil: And indeed, when Allah's servant stood up to supplicate to Him, they almost overwhelmed him.
compare: And indeed, when Allah's servant stood up to supplicate to Him, they almost overwhelmed him.

src: Und sie sind vor (jedem) Schrecken an jenem Tag in Sicherheit'.
ref: He will be secure from the terror of the Day of Judgment.
draft: And they are safe from (every) horror on that day.
hil: And on that Day they are safe from every horror.
compare: And on that Day they are safe from every horror.

src: Gewiß ALLAH verfügt bei Sich über das Wissen der Stunde, ER läßt den helfenden (Regen) nieder und ER weiß, was in den Mutterschößen ist. Und kein Lebewesen weiß, was es morgen erwirbt, und kein Lebewesen weiß, in welchem Lande es stirbt. Gewiß, ALLAH ist allwissend, allkundig.
ref: Surely Allah is He with Whom is the knowledge of the hour, and He sends down the rain and He knows what is in the wombs; and no one knows what he shall earn on the morrow; and no one knows in what land he shall die; surely Allah is Knowing, Aware.
draft: Surely, Allah has knowledge of the Hour and sends down rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.
hil: Surely, Allah has knowledge of the Hour and sends down the helping rain, and knows what is in the wombs. And no living being knows what it will acquire tomorrow, and no living being knows in which land it will die. Surely, Allah is all-knowing, all-aware.
compare: Surely, Allah has knowledge of the Hour and sends down rain and knows what is in the wombs. And no soul perceives what it will earn tomorrow, and no soul perceives in what land it will die. Indeed, Allah is Knowing and Acquainted.

src: Das Königreich, das wahrhaftige - an jenem Tage wird es des Allerbarmers sein; und ein Tag soll es sein, (der) schwer für die Ungläubigen (ist)
ref: The real sovereignty will belong to Ar-Rahman. How grievous will be the day for the infidels!
draft: The kingdom, the truthful - on that day it will be of the Most Merciful; and it will be a day difficult for the disbelievers.
hil: The kingdom, the truthful - on that day it will be of the Most Merciful; and it will be a day difficult for the disbelievers.
compare: The kingdom, the truthful - on that day it will be of the Most Merciful; and it will be a day difficult for the disbelievers.

src: Allah wird uns zusammenbringen.
ref: Allah will bring us all together.
draft: Allah will bring us together.
hil: Allah will bring us together.
compare: Allah will bring us together.

src: Sag: "Setzt ihr ALLAH etwa (damit) in Kenntnis über etwas, was ER weder in den Himmeln noch auf der Erde kennt?!" Gepriesen-erhaben sei ER über das, was sie an Schirk betreiben.
ref: Say: "Do ye indeed inform Allah of something He knows not, in the heavens or on earth?- Glory to Him! and far is He above the partners they ascribe (to Him)!"
draft: Say, "Do you inform Allah of something He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?" Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
hil: Say: 'Do you wish to inform Allah of that which He knows not in the heavens or in the earth?' Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.
compare: Say, "Do you inform Allah of something He does not know in the heavens or on the earth?" Exalted is He and high above what they associate with Him.

src: Du bringst das Lebendige aus dem Toten, und Du bringst das Tote aus dem Lebendigen hervor, und Du bescherst Unterhalt, wem Du willst, ohne (viel) zu rechnen.
ref: You bring forth the living out of the dead, and You bring the dead out of the living, and You give sustenance to whom You will beyond all reckoning.'
draft: You bring the living out of the dead, and you bring the dead out of the living, and you provide sustenance to whom you will, without (much) accounting.
hil: You bring the living out of the dead, and you bring the dead out of the living, and you provide sustenance to whom you will, without measure.
compare: You bring the living out of the dead, and you bring the dead out of the living, and you provide sustenance to whom you will, without (much) accounting.

src: Aber er ist nicht den steilen Paßweg hinaufgestürmt.
ref: But he could not scale the steep ascent.
draft: But he did not rush up the steep path.
hil: But he did not storm up the steep mountain pass.
compare: But he did not storm up the steep mountain pass.

src: Erhebt nicht eure Stimmen über die Stimme des Propheten, und seid ihm gegenüber nicht so laut mit dem Gesagten, wie die einen von euch den anderen gegenüber laut sind, sonst werden eure Handlungen zunichte, während ihr es nicht merkt.
ref: Do not raise your voices higher than the voice of the Prophet, nor speak to him loudly the way you shout to one another, lest your deeds go to waste whilst you are unaware. (Faith will go waste due to the slightest disrespect towards the Holy Prophet – peace and blessings be upon him.
draft: Do not raise your voices above the voice of the prophet, and do not be so loud in what you say to him, as some of you are loud in relation to others, otherwise your actions will be nullified while you do not realize it.
hil: Do not raise your voices above the voice of the prophet, and do not be as loud with what you say to him, as some of you are loud in relation to others, otherwise your actions will be nullified while you do not realize it.
compare: Do not raise your voices above the voice of the prophet, and do not be so loud in what you say to him, as some of you are loud in relation to others, otherwise your actions will be nullified while you do not realize it.

src: Sie pflegten nicht zuzuhören und sie pflegten nicht einzublicken.
ref: They could not bear to hear (the preachers of the truth) and they used not to see (the truth because of their severe aversin, inspite of the fact that they had the sense of hearing and sight).
draft: They didn't use to listen and they didn't use to look in.
hil: They did not listen and they did not look in.
compare: They did not listen and they did not look in.

src: Und WIR ließen Musa Wahy zuteil werden, als seine Leute ihn um Wasser baten: "Schlage mit deinem Stock gegen den Felsen!"
ref: And We revealed unto Musa, when his people asked him for drink: Smite the rock with thy rod.
draft: "And WE caused Moses to receive revelation when his people asked him for water: "Strike the rock with your staff!""
hil: And WE said to Moses, 'strike the rock with your staff', when his people asked him for water.
compare: "And WE caused Moses to receive revelation when his people asked him for water: "Strike the rock with your staff!""

src: Und wenn der Himmel (wie ein Fell) abgezogen wird,
ref: The curtain drawn back from the skies,
draft: And when the sky (like a pelt) is peeled off,
hil: And if the sky is peeled off like a pelt,
compare: And when the sky (like a pelt) is peeled off,

src: Und daß ihr fastet, ist besser für euch, wenn ihr (es) nur wißt!
ref: And if you fast it is good for you, if you knew.
draft: And that you fast is better for you, if you only knew!
hil: O you who have believed, fasting is better for you, if you only knew.
compare: O you who have believed, fasting is better for you, if you only knew.

src: Und verheiße den Gläubigen die frohe Botschaft.
ref: So convey glad tidings to those who believe.
draft: And promise the believers the good news.
hil: And give the believers the glad tidings.
compare: And give the believers the glad tidings.

src: Diejenigen, die es lieben, daß sich das Abscheuliche unter denjenigen, die glauben, verbreitet, für sie wird es schmerzhafte Strafe geben im Diesseits und Jenseits. Allah weiß, ihr aber wißt nicht.
ref: There is painful punishment in this world and the next for those who like that immorality should spread among the believers, for God knows and you do not know.
draft: Those who love that the abominable things spread among those who believe, for them there will be painful punishment in this life and in the hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know.
hil: But for those who love that abomination should spread among those who believe, for them there will be a painful punishment in this life and in the hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know.
compare: But for those who love that abomination should spread among those who believe, for them there will be a painful punishment in this life and in the hereafter. Allah knows, but you do not know.

src: Sie sagen: "Allah hat Sich Kinder genommen." Preis sei Ihm! Er ist der Unbedürftige. Ihm gehört, was in den Himmeln und was auf der Erde ist. Keine Ermächtigung habt ihr dafür. Wollt ihr über Allah etwas sagen, was ihr nicht wißt?
ref: They said, “Allah has created a son for Himself”- Purity is to Him! He is the Perfect (Unwanting, free of needs); to Him only belongs all whatever is in the heavens and all whatever is in the earth; “You do not have any proof of this; do you say a thing concerning Allah which you do not know?”
draft: They say, "Allah has taken children for Himself." Praise be to Him! He is the Independent. To Him belongs what is in the heavens and what is on the earth. You have no authority for this. Do you say about Allah that which you do not know?
hil: They said, 'Allah has taken offspring for Himself.' Purity is to Him! He is the Independent. To Him belongs what is in the heavens and on earth. None has the right to give any authorization in this regard. Do you want to say about Allah what you do not know?'
compare: They said, 'Allah has taken offspring for Himself.' Purity is to Him! He is the Independent. To Him belongs what is in the heavens and on earth. None has the right to give any authorization in this regard. Do you want to say about Allah what you do not know?'

src: Und hätten sie sich doch in Geduld geübt, bis du zu ihnen herauskommst, wäre dies sicher besser für sie.
ref: If they had waited for you to come out it would have been better for them.
draft: And if they had practiced patience until you came out to them, this would surely be better for them.
hil: If they had been patient until you came out to them, it would surely be better for them.
compare: If they had been patient until you came out to them, it would surely be better for them.

src: Möge sein Herr ihm, wenn er euch (alle) entläßt, zum Tausch andere Gattinnen geben, die besser sind als ihr: muslimische Frauen, die gläubig und demütig ergeben sind, bereit zur Umkehr sind, (Gott) dienen und umherziehen, ob sie früher verheiratet waren oder Jungfrauen sind.
ref: In case he divorces you, his Lord will give him better wives in return, who will be modest, true believers, obedient to God, repentant, observant of prayer and fasting, both widows and virgins.
draft: May his master when he dismisses you, exchange for him wives better than you, Muslim women, faithful, obedient, penitent, devout in worship, who fast, previously married or virgins.
hil: May his lord, when He dismisses you, replace you with better wives: Muslim women who are devout, obedient, repentant, worshipful, fasting, previously married or virgins.
compare: May his master when he dismisses you, exchange for him wives better than you, Muslim women, faithful, obedient, penitent, devout in worship, who fast, previously married or virgins.

src: Das ist ein gerader Weg."
ref: This is the straight path."
draft: "The is a straight path."
hil: That is a straight path.
compare: That is a straight path.

src: Da wollte er sie aus dem Land aufschrecken.
ref: So he resolved to turn them out of the land (of Egypt).
draft: He wanted to scare her out of the country.
hil: He sought to scare them out of the land.
compare: He wanted to scare her out of the country.

src: Kostet nun die Pein dafür, daß ihr ungläubig waret.»
ref: Therefore now taste the punishment, the result of your disbelief.”
draft: "Now taste the pain for being unbelievers."
hil: "Now taste the agony for having been unbelievers."
compare: "Now taste the agony for having been unbelievers."

src: Dachten sie etwa nicht über sich selbst nach?!
ref: What, have they not considered within themselves?
draft: Did they not think about themselves?!
hil: Did they not think about themselves?!
compare: Did they not think about themselves?!

src: Und die frohe Botschaft gib den Demütigen
ref: Give good tidings to those who bow in obedience to God,
draft: And give the joyful message to the humble.
hil: And give the glad tidings to the humble.
compare: And give the joyful message to the humble.

src: Das Gleichnis derer, denen die Thora auferlegt wurde, und die ihr dann nicht nachlebten, ist wie das Gleichnis eines Esels, der Bücher trägt. Übel steht es um die Leute, die Allahs Zeichen leugnen. Und Allah rechtleitet kein ungerechtes Volk.
ref: The example of those who were entrusted with the Taurat, and did not carry out its commands, is like the donkey carrying books; what a wretched example is of the people who denied the signs of Allah; and Allah does not guide the unjust.
draft: The parable of those who were entrusted with the Torah but did not uphold it is like the parable of a donkey who carries books. How wretched is the outcome for the people who deny Allah's signs! And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.
hil: The parable of those to whom the Torah was entrusted, but who did not follow it, is like the parable of a donkey carrying books. How evil is the outcome for the people who deny Allah's signs. And Allah does not guide the unjust people.
compare: The parable of those who were entrusted with the Torah but did not uphold it is like the parable of a donkey who carries books. How wretched is the outcome for the people who deny Allah's signs! And Allah does not guide the wrongdoing people.

src: Und WIR wiesen dem Menschen zu, seinen Eltern Ihsan zu erweisen. Seine Mutter war schwanger mit ihm in Angestrengtheit und brachte ihn zur Welt in Angestrengtheit.
ref: We have enjoined on man to be good to his parents: His mother carries him in her womb with hardship, and gives birth to him in pain.
draft: And we commanded mankind to show goodness to his parents. His mother carried him with difficulty and bore him with difficulty.
hil: And We have enjoined upon man goodness to his parents. His mother carried him through weakness upon weakness, and his weaning is in two years. Be grateful to Me and to your parents; to Me is the [final] destination.
compare: And we commanded mankind to show goodness to his parents. His mother carried him with difficulty and bore him with difficulty.

src: Sie sagten: "Al-'aziz!
ref: They said, “O governor!
draft: They said: "Al-'aziz!"
hil: They said, 'Al-'aziz!'
compare: They said: "Al-'aziz!"

src: Und euer HERR ist gewiß Der Allgnade Erweisende.
ref: Surely your Lord is Ar-Rahman.
draft: And your LORD is certainly the one who shows all grace.
hil: And your LORD is certainly The Most Gracious.
compare: And your LORD is certainly The Most Gracious.

src: Und wenn du sie fragst, wer die Himmel und die Erde erschaffen und die Sonne und den Mond dienstbar gemacht hat, sagen sie bestimmt: «Gott.» Wie leicht lassen sie sich doch abwenden!
ref: And if you ask them, “Who created the heavens and the earth, and subjected the sun and the moon?”, they will surely say, “Allah”; so where are they reverting?
draft: And if you ask them who created the heavens and the earth, and made the sun and the moon subservient, they will certainly say, "God." How easily they are turned away!
hil: If you ask them who created the heavens and the earth, and set the sun and the moon to work, they will answer: 'God.' How easily they are turned away!
compare: And if you ask them who created the heavens and the earth, and made the sun and the moon subservient, they will certainly say, "God." How easily they are turned away!

src: Und wenn die Menschen (vor Mir) versammelt werden, werden sie ihre Feinde sein und ihre Anbetung verleugnen.
ref: When all men are gathered together (on that Day) they will become their enemies and deny their worship.
draft: And when people (gather before Me), they will be each other's enemies and will renounce their worship.
hil: And when people (gather before Me), they will be each other's enemies and will deny their worship.
compare: And when people (gather before Me), they will be each other's enemies and will renounce their worship.

src: Sag: "Ja!
ref: Say: "Yes!
draft: Say: "Yes!"
hil: Say: 'Yes!'
compare: Say: "Yes!"

src: Als er zu seinem Vater sagte: "Mein Vater! Weshalb betest du etwas an, das weder sieht, noch hört, noch von dir irgend etwas abwenden kann?
ref: Remember, when he said to his father: "O my father, why do you worship that which can neither hear nor see nor even profit you the least?
draft: When he said to his father: "My father! Why do you worship something that neither sees, hears, nor can turn away anything from you?"
hil: When he said to his father: 'My father! Why do you worship something that neither sees, hears, nor can turn away anything from you?'
compare: When he said to his father: "My father! Why do you worship something that neither sees, hears, nor can turn away anything from you?"

src: sie würden gewiß sagen: "Nur unsere Blicke sind benommen; wahrlich, man hat uns nur etwas vorgegaukelt."
ref: They will say all the same: "Our eyes were dazed (and clouded over). We were a people ensorcelled."
draft: They would certainly say, "Only our gaze is obscured; truly, we have only been shown something."
hil: They would surely say, 'Only our gazes have been dimmed; truly, we have only been shown something'.
compare: They would certainly say, "Only our gaze is obscured; truly, we have only been shown something."

src: Es ist so! Denn ALLAH wandelt keine Gabe (in Bestrafung) um, die ER Leuten beschert hat, bis sie sich selbst (zum Schlechten) verändern.
ref: That is so because Allah will never change a grace which He has bestowed on a people until they change what is in their ownselves.
draft: It is true! Because Allah does not turn the gift that he has given to people into punishment until they transform themselves (into bad).
hil: "It is true! Because Allah does not turn the gift that he has given to people into punishment until they transform themselves (into bad)."
compare: It is true! Because Allah does not turn the gift that he has given to people into punishment until they transform themselves (into bad).

src: Ihr Menschen! Esst von dem, was auf Erden ist, an genießbaren Halalmitteln, und folgt nicht den Fußstapfen des Satans!
ref: O men, eat only the things of the earth that are lawful and good.
draft: "Your people! Eat of what is on earth, of permissible and good foods, and do not follow in the footsteps of Satan!"
hil: O people! Eat of the lawful and good things that are on the earth, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan; he is a manifest foe to you.
compare: O people! Eat of the lawful and good things that are on the earth, and do not follow the footsteps of Satan; he is a manifest foe to you.

src: Sagt: "Wollt ihr mit uns über ALLAH disputieren, wo ER unser und euer HERR ist, und wo uns unsere Taten und euch eure Taten gehören, und wo wir Ihm gegenüber aufrichtig sind?!"
ref: Say: "Why do you dispute with us about God when He is equally your Lord and our Lord? To us belong our actions, to you yours; and we are true to Him."
draft: Say: "Do you want to dispute with us about Allah, while He is our and your Lord, and while our deeds and your deeds belong to us, and where we are sincere to Him?!"
hil: Say: "Do you want to argue with us about Allah, when He is our Lord and your Lord, and when our deeds belong to us and your deeds belong to you, and where we are truthful to Him?!"
compare: Say: "Do you want to argue with us about Allah, when He is our Lord and your Lord, and when our deeds belong to us and your deeds belong to you, and where we are truthful to Him?!"

src: Und WIR ließen sie in Unsere Gnade eintreten.
ref: And they were admitted to Our grace.
draft: And WE let them enter into Our mercy.
hil: And WE caused them to enter into Our mercy.
compare: And WE caused them to enter into Our mercy.

src: Auch hat mein Bruder Aaron eine redegewandtere Zunge. So sende ihn mit mir zur Unterstützung, daß er mich bestätige. Ich fürchte, daß sie mich der Lüge zeihen.»
ref: So send my brother Aaron with me as helper for he is more fluent than I with words, that he should affirm me, for I fear that they would call me a liar."
draft: Also, my brother Aaron has a more eloquent tongue. So send him with me for support so that he can confirm me. I'm afraid they're going to accuse me of lying.
hil: Also, my brother Aaron has a more eloquent tongue. So send him with me for support so that he can confirm me. I'm afraid they're going to accuse me of lying.
compare: Also, my brother Aaron has a more eloquent tongue. So send him with me for support so that he can confirm me. I'm afraid they're going to accuse me of lying.

src: Immer wieder wenn sie aus ihr (Dschahannam) aus einer Drangsal herausgehen wollten, werden sie wieder zu ihr zurückgeschickt.
ref: Whenever in their anguish they try to get out of it, they are restored to it.
draft: Again and again, when they wanted to leave it (Jahannam) out of distress, they are sent back to it.
hil: They are sent back to it again and again when they want to leave it (Jahannam) out of distress.
compare: Again and again, when they wanted to leave it (Jahannam) out of distress, they are sent back to it.

src: Jene laden zum (Höllen)feuer ein. Allah aber lädt zum (Paradies)garten und zur Vergebung ein, mit Seiner Erlaubnis, und macht den Menschen Seine Zeichen klar, auf daß sie bedenken mögen.
ref: They invite you to Hell, but God calls you to Paradise and pardon by His grace. And He makes His signs manifest that men may haply take heed.
draft: Those invite to (the infernal) fire. But Allah invites to Paradise and to forgiveness, by His permission. And He makes clear His signs to the people that perhaps they may remember.
hil: Those invite to the fire of hell. But Allah invites to the Paradise garden and to forgiveness, by His permission. And He clarifies His signs to the people that they may reflect.
compare: Those invite to (the infernal) fire. But Allah invites to Paradise and to forgiveness, by His permission. And He makes clear His signs to the people that perhaps they may remember.

src: Und solltest du diejenigen sehen, die über Unsere Ayat lästern, so wende dich von ihnen (so lange) ab, bis sie zu einem anderen Thema übergehen.
ref: When you see them argue about Our messages, withdraw from their company until they begin to talk of other things.
draft: And if you see those who scoff at Our signs, then turn away from them until they turn to another topic.
hil: And if you see those who mock Our signs, then turn away from them until they turn to another topic.
compare: And if you see those who scoff at Our signs, then turn away from them until they turn to another topic.

src: Er aber erklärte (es) für Lüge und war ungehorsam.
ref: But (the Pharaoh) disavowed and disobeyed.
draft: He, however, declared it to be a lie and was disobedient.
hil: But he declared it as a lie and was disobedient.
compare: He, however, declared it to be a lie and was disobedient.

src: Haben WIR euch etwa nicht ein langes Lebensalter gewährt, während dessen derjenige sich erinnern konnte, der sich erinnern wollte?! Auch der Warner kam zu euch.
ref: But did We not grant you life enough for whoever would remember therein to remember, and the warner had come to you?
draft: Have WE not granted you a long lifespan, during which the one who wanted to remember could remember?! Even the warning came to you.
hil: Have WE not granted you a long lifespan during which the one who wanted to remember could remember? The Warner also came to you. And what has been given to you as goods are only consumables of this world and its adornments. And what is with Allah is better and lasting. Do you not have sense?
compare: Have WE not granted you a long lifespan, during which the one who wanted to remember could remember?! Even the warning came to you.

src: Der Satan ist gegen den Erbarmer widerspenstig.
ref: Verily Satan was disobedient to Ar-Rahman.
draft: The Satan is rebellious against the Merciful.
hil: The Satan is rebellious against the Merciful.
compare: The Satan is rebellious against the Merciful.

src: Und (auch) diejenigen unter diesen da, die Unrecht tun, werden die bösen Taten treffen, die sie begangen haben.
ref: So will the evil deeds of those who are sinners among them recoil back on them.
draft: And (also) those among them who do wrong will be met by the evil deeds they have committed.
hil: "And those among them who do wrong will be met by the evil deeds they have committed."
compare: And (also) those among them who do wrong will be met by the evil deeds they have committed.

src: Euer Besitz und eure Kinder sind nur eine Versuchung; Allah aber - bei Ihm gibt es großartigen Lohn.
ref: Your wealth and children are surely meant as trial for you: But with God is the great reward.
draft: Your possessions and your children are but a trial, and Allah is the One with great reward.
hil: Your wealth and your children are only a temptation; but Allah, with Him is great reward.
compare: Your possessions and your children are but a trial, and Allah is the One with great reward.

src: Und dort vor Salomo wurden dessen Heerscharen der Ginn und Menschen und Vögel versammelt, und sie standen in Reih und Glied geordnet
ref: His armies of jinns and men and Tair assembled, formed into ranks, (and marched)
draft: And there, in front of Solomon, his armies of jinn, humans, and birds were gathered, and they stood in rows and organized ranks.
hil: And before Solomon, his armies of jinn, humans, and birds were assembled, standing in orderly rows and lines.
compare: And before Solomon, his armies of jinn, humans, and birds were assembled, standing in orderly rows and lines.

src: Das ist der Tag, an dem sie nicht reden
ref: They will not be able to speak that day,
draft: "This is the day on which they do not speak."
hil: "That is the day when they do not speak."
compare: "That is the day when they do not speak."

src: Vielmehr sind es geehrte Diener.
ref: (Those whom they think are God's sons) are only His honorable servants.
draft: Rather, they are honored servants.
hil: Rather, they are honored servants.
compare: Rather, they are honored servants.

src: Sie werden ihrem Herrn begegnen. Allein, ich erachte euch für ein Volk, das unwissend ist.
ref: Surely, they are going to meet their Lord, but I see that you are a people that are ignorant.
draft: You will meet your lord. However, I consider you to be a people who are ignorant.
hil: "You will meet your Lord. However, I consider you to be an ignorant people."
compare: "You will meet your Lord. However, I consider you to be an ignorant people."

src: Auch ist es eine Erinnerung für die Mumin.
ref: You are to warn with it—and a reminder for the believers.
draft: Also, it is a reminder for the Moomins.
hil: Also, it is a reminder for the believers.
compare: Also, it is a reminder for the Moomins.

src: So kehre dich von ihnen ab; du bist (hierin) nicht zu tadeln.
ref: Turn away from them. You will not be blamed.
draft: So turn away from them; you are not to blame (for this).
hil: So turn away from them; you are not to blame (for this).
compare: So turn away from them; you are not to blame (for this).

src: Du versuchst nur, ein Tyrann im Land zu werden, und du willst kein Friedensstifter sein."
ref: You only want to be a tyrant in the land and no peacemaker."
draft: "You're just trying to become a tyrant in the country, and you don't want to be a peacemaker."
hil: You are only trying to become a tyrant in the land, and you do not want to be a peacemaker.
compare: "You're just trying to become a tyrant in the country, and you don't want to be a peacemaker."

src: Ob er wohl (die Botschaft) für Lüge erklärt und sich abkehrt?
ref: If he cries lies, and turns away -
draft: Will he declare (the message) a lie and turn away?
hil: Will he deny my message as truth and turn away?
compare: Will he deny my message as truth and turn away?

src: Allah hatte ja mit den Kinder Isra'ils ein Abkommen getroffen. Und Wir beriefen von ihnen zwölf Obmänner.
ref: God covenanted the people of Israel and raised twelve leaders among them, and said: "I shall verily be with you.
draft: "Allah had made a covenant with the Children of Israel. And We appointed twelve leaders from among them."
hil: And indeed Allah took a bond from the Children of Israel, and We raised twelve leaders from among them. And Allah said, 'I am with you. If you establish prayer, give alms, believe in My messengers, support them, and loan Allah a goodly loan, I will surely expiate for you your misdeeds and surely shall make you enter the Gardens whereunder rivers flow; then whosoever of you shall disbelieve thereafter, he hath surely strayed from the level way.'
compare: "Allah had made a covenant with the Children of Israel. And We appointed twelve leaders from among them."

src: Und gewiß, ich denke doch über dich, du Pharao! - daß du verleitet bist."
ref: I truly think, O Pharaoh, your days are done."
draft: "And certainly, I do think about you, you Pharaoh! - that you are tempted."
hil: And certainly, I think of you, O Pharaoh, that you are misled.
compare: And certainly, I think of you, O Pharaoh, that you are misled.

src: Laß Mich in Ruhe mit denen, die diese Botschaft für Lüge erklären.
ref: So leave those who deny this Discourse to Me.
draft: Let me be in peace with those who declare this message to be a lie.
hil: Leave me alone to deal with those who deny this message as a lie.
compare: Leave me alone to deal with those who deny this message as a lie.

src: Geh hinaus. Du gehörst zu den Erniedrigten.»
ref: Go, and away; you are one of the damned."
draft: "Go outside. You belong to the humiliated."
hil: Go out. You belong to the humiliated.
compare: "Go outside. You belong to the humiliated."

src: Und Gott zürnt ihm und verflucht ihn und bereitet ihm eine gewaltige Pein.
ref: For him a greater punishment awaits.
draft: And God is angry with him and curses him and prepares a mighty torment for him.
hil: And whoever incur God's anger and gets cursed by Him will suffer a mighty punishment.
compare: And God is angry with him and curses him and prepares a mighty torment for him.

src: (Es sind) diejenigen, die glauben und deren Herzen im Gedenken Allahs Ruhe finden.
ref: “Those who accepted faith and whose hearts gain solace from the remembrance of Allah; pay heed!
draft: (They are) those who believe and find tranquility in the remembrance of Allah in their hearts.
hil: Those who believe and find peace in their hearts from contemplating God, there is peace of heart in the contemplation of God!
compare: (They are) those who believe and find tranquility in the remembrance of Allah in their hearts.

src: Die Entscheidungsträger vom Pharaos Leuten sagten: "Gewiß, dieser ist doch ein im Wissen fundierter Magier!
ref: The nobles of Pharaoh said: "He surely is a clever magician.
draft: The decision-makers of the Pharaoh's people said, "Certainly, this is a magician based in knowledge!"
hil: The proud assembly of the Pharaoh's people said, 'Certainly, this is a magician rooted in knowledge!'
compare: The proud assembly of the Pharaoh's people said, 'Certainly, this is a magician rooted in knowledge!'

src: Wir fordern von keiner Seele etwas über das hinaus, was sie zu leisten vermag. Und wenn ihr eine Aussage macht, so übt Gerechtigkeit, auch wenn es einen nahen Verwandten (betrifft); und haltet den Bund Allahs ein.
ref: Give full measure and weight, according to justice, We never charge a soul with more than it can bear, when you speak, observe justice, even though it concerns a close relative; and fulfil the covenants of God.
draft: We demand from no soul more than it can bear. And if you make a statement, be just, even if it concerns a close relative; and uphold the covenant of Allah.
hil: We demand from no soul more than it can bear. And if you make a statement, be just, even if it concerns a close relative; and uphold the covenant of Allah.
compare: We demand from no soul more than it can bear. And if you make a statement, be just, even if it concerns a close relative; and uphold the covenant of Allah.

src: Sie (die Königin) sagte: "Ihr Vornehmen, ein ehrenvoller Brief ist mir überbracht worden.
ref: (The Queen said): "O nobles, a venerable letter has been delivered to me.
draft: She (the queen) said: "Your Highness, an honorable letter has been delivered to me."
hil: She (the queen) said, 'Your Highness, an honorable letter has been delivered to me.'
compare: She (the queen) said, 'Your Highness, an honorable letter has been delivered to me.'

src: Dann bezichtigten sie ihn der Lüge, dann verletzten sie ihm (dem Kamelweibchen) die Beine, dann richtete ihr HERR sie wegen ihrer Verfehlung zugrunde, dann ließ ER es ihnen gleichmäßig sein.
ref: But they called him a liar and hamstrung her. So God obliterated them for their crime, and (destroyed) all of them alike.
draft: Then they accused him of lying, then they injured his (the female camel's) legs, then their LORD destroyed her [the camel] for their sin, then HE made it [the punishment] equal for them.
hil: They accused him of lying, then they injured his (the female camel's) legs, then their LORD destroyed her [the camel] for their sin, then HE made it [the punishment] equal for them.
compare: Then they accused him of lying, then they injured his (the female camel's) legs, then their LORD destroyed her [the camel] for their sin, then HE made it [the punishment] equal for them.

src: Und wenn diejenigen, die Unrecht begingen, die Peinigung gesehen haben, wird diese ihnen weder erleichtert, noch wird ihnen Zeitaufschub gewährt.
ref: And when the wicked shall face the torment it will not be decreased, nor will they be reprieved.
draft: And when those who committed wrongs have seen the torment, it will not be made easier for them nor will they be granted a respite.
hil: And when those who committed wrongs have seen the torment, it will not be made easier for them nor will they be granted a respite.
compare: And when those who committed wrongs have seen the torment, it will not be made easier for them nor will they be granted a respite.

src: Ihre Angelegenheit unterliegt nur ALLAH, dann wird ER ihnen das kundtun, was sie zu tun pflegten.
ref: Their affair is with God. He will tell them the truth of what they were doing.
draft: Your matter is only subject to Allah, then He will inform them of what they used to do.
hil: Your matter is only subject to Allah, then He will inform them of what they used to do.
compare: Your matter is only subject to Allah, then He will inform them of what they used to do.

src: So ließen Wir die einen von ihnen auf die anderen folgen und machten sie zu(m Gegenstand von) Geschichten. Weg darum mit Leuten, die nicht glauben!
ref: So oft as there came unto a community their apostle, they belied him, so We made them follow one anot her, and We made them bywords: so away with a people who believe not!
draft: Therefore, We let some of them follow the others, and We made them the subject of stories. So away with people who do not believe!
hil: So We made one follow the other (to its doom), and turned them into bygone tales. So away with people who do not believe!
compare: Therefore, We let some of them follow the others, and We made them the subject of stories. So away with people who do not believe!

src: Bis auf eine alte Frau unter denen, die zurückblieben und dem Verderben anheimfielen.
ref: Except one old woman who remained behind.
draft: Except for an old woman among those who remained and succumbed to destruction.
hil: Except for an old woman among those who remained and succumbed to destruction.
compare: Except for an old woman among those who remained and succumbed to destruction.

src: Der Mensch ist ja eilfertig.
ref: Curse him, etc." and that one should not do, but one should be patient].
draft: "Man is always hurried."
hil: "Surely, man is very hasty."
compare: "Surely, man is very hasty."

src: Allah wird sie bald in Seine Barmherzigkeit einführen. Wahrlich, Allah ist Allvergebend, Barmherzig.
ref: This is certainly a means of achieving nearness (to God), and God will admit them to His mercy, for God is forgiving and kind.
draft: "Allah will soon lead them into His mercy. Truly, Allah is All-Forgiving, Merciful."
hil: God will soon lead them into His mercy. Verily, God is forgiving and merciful.
compare: "Allah will soon lead them into His mercy. Truly, Allah is All-Forgiving, Merciful."

src: Sie glauben nicht eher, bis sie dich über das richten lassen, was zwischen ihnen umstritten ist, und hierauf in sich selbst keine Bedrängnis finden durch das, was du entschieden hast, und sich in voller Ergebung fügen.
ref: They will not believe until they make you a judge in their disputes, then do not find within their hearts any dissent to your verdict and submit in full submission.
draft: They will not believe until they let you judge over what is disputed among them, and then find no discomfort within themselves regarding what you have decided, and submit themselves completely.
hil: They will not believe until they let you judge over what is disputed among them, and then find no discomfort within themselves regarding what you have decided, and completely submit themselves.
compare: They will not believe until they let you judge over what is disputed among them, and then find no discomfort within themselves regarding what you have decided, and submit themselves completely.

src: In Deiner Hand ist das Gute; wahrlich, Du hast Macht über alle Dinge.
ref: All goodness is Yours (entirely). Indeed You have the power over all things.
draft: In your hand is the good; truly, you have power over all things.
hil: In your hand is the good; verily, you have power over all things.
compare: In your hand is the good; truly, you have power over all things.

src: ALLAH möge euch vergeben.
ref: God will forgive you.
draft: ALLAH may forgive you.
hil: May God forgive you.
compare: ALLAH may forgive you.

src: Und auswirft, was in ihr ist, und somit ganz leer wird
ref: And throws out whatever it contains and is empty,
draft: And throws out what is inside it, and thus becomes completely empty.
hil: And throws out what is inside it, thus becoming completely empty.
compare: And throws out what is inside it, and thus becomes completely empty.

src: Und sie sagen: "Wann wird dieses Versprechen (verwirklicht werden), wenn ihr wahrhaftig seid?"
ref: They say: "When is this promise going to come, if what you say is true?"
draft: And they say: "When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truly sincere?"
hil: Say: "When will this promise be fulfilled, if you speak the truth?"
compare: And they say: "When will this promise be fulfilled, if you are truly sincere?"

src: Vielmehr wissen die meisten von ihnen nicht.
ref: Nay, most of them know not.
draft: Most of them, however, do not know.
hil: Rather, most of them do not know.
compare: Most of them, however, do not know.

src: Die Vergeltung für diejenigen unter euch, die dies tun, ist nichts als Schande im diesseitigen Leben, und am Tag der Auferstehung werden sie der härtesten Pein zugeführt werden. Und Gott läßt nicht unbeachtet, was ihr tut.
ref: There is no other award for them who so act but disgrace in the world, and on the Day of Judgement the severest of punishment; for God is not heedless of all that you do.
draft: The retribution for those among you who do this is nothing but shame in this life, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be subjected to the harshest torment. And God does not overlook what you do.
hil: The retribution for those among you who do this is nothing but shame in this life, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be subjected to the harshest torment. And God does not overlook what you do.
compare: The retribution for those among you who do this is nothing but shame in this life, and on the Day of Resurrection they will be subjected to the harshest torment. And God does not overlook what you do.

src: Und wenn sie um Hilfe rufen, wird Ihrem Hilferuf entsprochen mit Wasser wie das Geschmolzene, das die Gesichter schmort.
ref: If they ask for water they will be helped to liquid like molten brass that would scald their mouths.
draft: And when they cry for help, their call for help will be answered with water like melted metal that scorches the faces.
hil: And if they cry for help, their call for help will be answered with water like melted metal that scorches the faces.
compare: And when they cry for help, their call for help will be answered with water like melted metal that scorches the faces.

src: Ihr Menschen! Bereits ist zu euch doch ein Gesandter mit der Wahrheit von eurem HERRN gekommen, so verinnerlicht den Iman, dies ist besser für euch.
ref: O men, the Messenger has now come to you with the truth from your Lord; so believe; better is it for you.
draft: "Your people! Already a messenger of truth has come to you from your LORD, so internalize the faith, this is better for you."
hil: O people who believe! A messenger has already come to you with the truth from your Lord. So firmly establish the faith, this is better for you.
compare: O people who believe! A messenger has already come to you with the truth from your Lord. So firmly establish the faith, this is better for you.

src: Uns beeilen, ihnen gute Dinge (zu gewähren)? Aber nein! Sie merken nicht.
ref: We provide them with the means of competing with each other in virtuous deeds, but they do not realize this.
draft: Hurry to grant them good things? But no! They don't notice.
hil: Hurry to grant them good things? No! They don't notice.
compare: Hurry to grant them good things? No! They don't notice.

src: Nein, sondern wir glauben, daß ihr Lügner seid!"
ref: In fact, we think you are a liar."
draft: "No, but we believe that you are liars!"
hil: "No, but we believe that you are liars!"
compare: "No, but we believe that you are liars!"

src: Dient eurem HERRN, Der euch erschuf und diejenigen vor euch, damit ihr Taqwa gemäß handelt.
ref: Worship your Lord, Who has created you and those before you, in the hope of attaining piety.
draft: Serve your LORD Who created you, and those who came before you, so that you may become righteous.
hil: Serve your LORD Who created you, and those who came before you, so that you may act in accordance with Taqwa.
compare: Serve your LORD Who created you, and those who came before you, so that you may act in accordance with Taqwa.

src: Und stifteten darin viel Unheil.
ref: And multiplied corruption.
draft: And caused a lot of trouble with it.
hil: "And caused a lot of trouble with it."
compare: And caused a lot of trouble with it.

src: Betreiben sie etwa Schirk mit dem, was Nichts schafft, während sie alle doch erschaffen werden?!
ref: Do they associate those with Him who cannot create a thing, and are themselves created,
draft: Do they perchance operate Schirk with that which creates nothing, while they themselves are all created?!
hil: Do they operate with that which creates nothing in order to commit shirk, while all of them are created?
compare: Do they operate with that which creates nothing in order to commit shirk, while all of them are created?

src: Da ergriff sie Gott wegen ihrer Sünden.
ref: But Allah seized them with punishment for their sins.
draft: She was seized by God because of her sins.
hil: Thus, God seized them because of their sins.
compare: She was seized by God because of her sins.

src: Dies sind Allahs Grenzen, so übertretet sie nicht! Wer aber Allahs Grenzen übertritt, diejenigen sind die Ungerechten.
ref: Do not exceed the limits of God, for those who exceed the bounds set by God are transgressors.
draft: These are the limits of Allah, so do not transgress them! But whoever transgresses the limits of Allah, it is those who are the wrongdoers.
hil: These are the limits of Allah, so do not transgress them! But whoever transgresses the limits of Allah, it is those who are the wrongdoers.
compare: These are the limits of Allah, so do not transgress them! But whoever transgresses the limits of Allah, it is those who are the wrongdoers.

src: Euch wird euer Lohn am Tag der Auferstehung voll erstattet.
ref: And only on the Day of Resurrection shall you be paid your wages in full.
draft: Your reward will be fully reimbursed on the day of resurrection.
hil: Your reward will be fully reimbursed on the Day of Resurrection, concerning that over which you used to differ.
compare: Your reward will be fully reimbursed on the Day of Resurrection, concerning that over which you used to differ.

src: Doch wenn ihr Kufr betreibt, so ist Meine Peinigung gewiß qualvoll."
ref: My punishment is dire.
draft: But if you practice disbelief, then My punishment is surely painful.
hil: Then if you practice disbelief, My punishment is certainly agonizing.
compare: Then if you practice disbelief, My punishment is certainly agonizing.

src: Und für euch gibt es anstelle von ALLAH weder Wali, noch Beistehenden.
ref: And you have not besides Allah any protector or helper.
draft: And for you there is neither Wali nor supporters instead of Allah.
hil: And there is neither Wali nor supporter for you instead of Allah.
compare: And there is neither Wali nor supporter for you instead of Allah.

src: Und für diejenigen, welche die gottmißfälligen Taten intrigieren, ist eine harte Peinigung bestimmt.
ref: To Him ascend (all) the goodly words, and the righteous deeds exalt it (the goodly words i.e. the goodly words are not accepted by Allah unless and until they are followed by good deeds), but those who plot evils, theirs will be severe torment.
draft: And for those who conspire the displeasing deeds, a severe punishment is determined.
hil: And for those who conspire displeasing deeds, a severe punishment is determined.
compare: And for those who conspire displeasing deeds, a severe punishment is determined.

src: Doch solltet ihr euch abwenden, so fürchte ich doch für euch die Peinigung eines langen Tages.
ref: But if you turn away, I fear the punishment of a terrible Day for you.
draft: But if you turn away, I fear for you the torment of a long day.
hil: If you turn away, I fear for you the torment of a long day.
compare: But if you turn away, I fear for you the torment of a long day.

src: Es sind aber nur die Ungläubigen, die Unsere Zeichen leugnen.
ref: Only those who are infidels will deny it.
draft: But only the unbelievers deny our signs.
hil: But it is only the unbelievers who deny Our messages.
compare: But only the unbelievers deny our signs.

src: Gepriesen-erhaben ist ER! ER ist ALLAH, Der Einzige, Der Allbezwingende.
ref: Exalted is He; He is Allah, the One, the Prevailing.
draft: Praised-exalted is HE! HE is ALLAH, The One, The Almighty.
hil: Praised-exalted is HE! HE is GOD, The One and The All-Powerful.
compare: Praised-exalted is HE! HE is ALLAH, The One, The Almighty.

src: Also gräme dich nicht wegen der fisq-betreibenden Leute!"
ref: So do not grieve for these, the wicked people."
draft: Also don't worry about the fisq-pursuing people!
hil: So do not worry about those who practice fisq!
compare: So do not worry about those who practice fisq!

src: Seine Mutter war schwanger mit ihm in Angestrengtheit und brachte ihn zur Welt in Angestrengtheit. Und (die Zeit) der Schwangerschaft mit ihm und sein Entwöhnen ist dreißig Monate.
ref: His mother beareth him with reluctance, and bringeth him forth with reluctance, and the bearing of him and the weaning of him is thirty months, till, when he attaineth full strength and reacheth forty years, he saith: My Lord!
draft: His mother was pregnant with him in hardship and gave birth to him in hardship. And (the duration of) his pregnancy and weaning (period) is thirty months.
hil: His mother was pregnant with him in hardship and gave birth to him in hardship. And (the duration of) his pregnancy and weaning (period) is thirty months.
compare: His mother was pregnant with him in hardship and gave birth to him in hardship. And (the duration of) his pregnancy and weaning (period) is thirty months.

src: Aber dir gehört es, zu befehlen.
ref: It is for you to decide.
draft: But it's up to you to command.
hil: "But it belongs to you to command."
compare: "But it belongs to you to command."

src: Sie sind doch im Zweifel über die Begegnung mit ihrem HERRN.
ref: They are in doubt concerning the Meeting with their Lord? (i.e. Resurrection after their deaths, and their return to their Lord).
draft: You are in doubt about meeting your LORD.
hil: You are uncertain about meeting your LORD.
compare: You are in doubt about meeting your LORD.

src: Und der Gesandte sagt: "O mein Herr, mein Volk mied diesen Qur'an unter Mißachtung."
ref: The prophet will say: "O my Lord, my people had fettered the Qur'an."
draft: And the messenger says: "O my lord, my people avoided this Quran in contempt."
hil: The messenger says, "O my Lord, my people avoided this Quran in contempt."
compare: The messenger says, "O my Lord, my people avoided this Quran in contempt."

src: So haben Wir ihn als klare Zeichen hinabgesandt, und (es ist so,) daß Allah rechtleitet, wen Er will.
ref: That is why We have sent down these clear revelations, for God gives guidance whomsoever He please.
draft: So We sent him down as clear evidence, and (it is) that Allah guides whom He wills.
hil: "Allah sent him down as clear evidence, and (it is) that Allah guides whom He wills."
compare: So We sent him down as clear evidence, and (it is) that Allah guides whom He wills.

src: So wendet euch nicht als Schuldige ab."
ref: So do not turn away from Him as sinners."
draft: "So do not turn away as if guilty."
hil: Do not turn away as though you were guilty.
compare: Do not turn away as though you were guilty.

src: Und dein HERR genügt als Wakil."
ref: Thy Lord suffices as a guardian.
draft: "And your Lord is enough as a Guardian."
hil: And your Lord is sufficient as Guardian.
compare: And your Lord is sufficient as Guardian.

src: Dem, der Gutes vollbringt, wird Besseres als das zuteil sein, und sie werden vor dem Schrecken an jenem Tag sicher sein.
ref: Whoever comes with good (deeds) will receive better than (what he had done), and be safe that day from terror.
draft: To him who does good, better will be given than that which is given to him, and they will be safe from terror on that day.
hil: To him who performs good deeds, better things than that will be given, and they will surely be safe from the terror on that day.
compare: To him who performs good deeds, better things than that will be given, and they will surely be safe from the terror on that day.

src: Und hätten sie doch das getan, womit sie ermahnt werden, wäre es besser für sie und würde sie noch mehr (im Iman) bestärken.
ref: And did they do that which they are exhorted to do, it would be for them better and more strengthening.
draft: And if they had done what they were admonished, it would have been better for them and would strengthen them even more (in faith).
hil: And if only they had done what they were admonished to do, it would have been better for them and would have strengthened them even more in faith.
compare: And if only they had done what they were admonished to do, it would have been better for them and would have strengthened them even more in faith.

src: um undankbar zu sein für das, was Wir ihnen gegeben haben, und um zu genießen; sie werden (es noch) erfahren.
ref: And deny what We had given them, in order to go on enjoying themselves. They will come to know soon.
draft: To be ungrateful for what We have given them, and to enjoy; they will (yet) know.
hil: To be ungrateful for what We have given them, and to enjoy; they will (yet) know.
compare: To be ungrateful for what We have given them, and to enjoy; they will (yet) know.

src: (Aber) gewiß, Meine List ist fest.
ref: Verily, My Plan is strong.
draft: Surely, my plan is firm.
hil: Surely, My plan is firm.
compare: Surely, my plan is firm.

src: Ihnen genügt Dschahannam, sie werden darin hineingeworfen.
ref: Hell is enough for them. They will roast in it.
draft: "You will suffice with Jahannam, they will be thrown into it."
hil: They are content with Jahannam, they will be thrown into it.
compare: They are content with Jahannam, they will be thrown into it.

src: Das ist Allah, euer Herr. Segensreich ist darum Allah, der Herr der Welten.
ref: That then is God, your Lord, so blessed be God, the Lord of all Being.
draft: This is Allah, your Lord. Allah, the Lord of the worlds, is therefore blessed.
hil: This is Allah, your Lord. Blessed, therefore, is Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
compare: This is Allah, your Lord. Blessed, therefore, is Allah, the Lord of the worlds.

src: Allah wird ganz gewiß diejenigen kennen, die die Wahrheit sprechen, und Er wird ganz gewiß die Lügner kennen.
ref: So Allah will surely know those who are true and He will surely know the liars.
draft: "Allah will surely know those who speak the truth, and He will surely know the liars."
hil: Allah will surely know those who speak the truth, and He will surely know the liars.
compare: "Allah will surely know those who speak the truth, and He will surely know the liars."

src: (Ihre Abneigung gegen diese Einteilung von Al-anfal ist) genauso (wie damals), als dein HERR dich aus deiner Wohnstätte mit der Wahrheit herausführen ließ, während eine Gruppe von den Mumin gewiß dem doch abgeneigt war.
ref: As your Lord sent you from your home (to fight) for the true cause, a section of the faithful were averse,
draft: (Your aversion to this division of Al-Anfal is) just like (back then), when your Lord led you out of your dwelling with the truth, while a group of the believers were certainly averse to it.
hil: Your aversion to this division of Al-Anfal is just like back then when your Lord led you out of your dwelling with the truth, while certainly a group of the believers were averse to it.
compare: Your aversion to this division of Al-Anfal is just like back then when your Lord led you out of your dwelling with the truth, while certainly a group of the believers were averse to it.

src: Die Kaffara dafür ist die Speisung von zehn Bedürftigen in jenem Maß, wie ihr die Eurigen im Durchschnitt speist, oder Ihre Bekleidung oder die Befreiung eines Unfreien.
ref: The atonement for it is by feeding ten needy people from the average of what you feed your families, or by clothing them, or by freeing a slave.
draft: "The kaffara for this is the feeding of ten needy people to the extent that you feed your own on average, or your clothing or the liberation of a slave."
hil: "The kaffara for this is the feeding of ten needy people to the extent that you feed your own on average, or your clothing or the liberation of a slave."
compare: "The kaffara for this is the feeding of ten needy people to the extent that you feed your own on average, or your clothing or the liberation of a slave."

src: Gewiß, sie waren jungeMänner, die den Iman an ihren HERRN verinnerlichten, undWIR ließen sie noch mehr Rechtleitung gewinnen.
ref: They were a few young men who believed in their Lord; so We gave them greater guidance.
draft: Certainly, they were young men who internalized faith in their LORD, and we allowed them to gain even more guidance.
hil: Certainly, they were young men who internalized faith in their LORD, and we allowed them to gain even more guidance.
compare: Certainly, they were young men who internalized faith in their LORD, and we allowed them to gain even more guidance.

src: Aber der Lohn des Jenseits ist wahrlich besser für diejenigen, die glauben und gottesfürchtig sind.
ref: And certainly the recompense of the life to come is better for those who believe and follow the right path.
draft: But the reward of the Hereafter is certainly better for those who believe and fear God.
hil: But the reward of the Hereafter is indeed better for those who believe and fear God.
compare: But the reward of the Hereafter is certainly better for those who believe and fear God.

src: ER trifft damit von Seinen Dienern, wen ER will.
ref: He makes it reach whomever He wills of His servants.
draft: He thus meets whom He wills of His servants.
hil: He meets whom He wills.
compare: He thus meets whom He wills of His servants.

src: Und Wir legten zwischen ihnen und den Städten, die Wir gesegnet haben, sichtbare Städte an.
ref: We placed other prominent towns between them, the towns that We had blessed and had set well-measured stages between them.
draft: And We placed visible towns between them and the blessed cities that We have blessed.
hil: And We placed visible towns between them and the blessed cities that We have blessed.
compare: And We placed visible towns between them and the blessed cities that We have blessed.

src: Wahrlich, Allah ist über alle Dinge Allwissend.
ref: Verily God has knowledge of everything.
draft: Truly, Allah is Omniscient about all things.
hil: Truly, God is Omniscient about everything.
compare: Truly, Allah is Omniscient about all things.

src: Ha Mim.
ref: HA MIM.
draft: Ha Mim.
hil: "Ha Mim."
compare: Ha Mim.

src: Die Engel und Gabriel steigen zu Ihm auf in einem Tage, dessen Ausmaß fünfzigtausend Jahre beträgt.
ref: To whom the angels and the soul take a day to ascend, whose length is fifty thousand years.
draft: The angels and Gabriel ascend to Him in a day whose extent is fifty thousand years.
hil: The angels and Gabriel ascend to Him in a day whose extent is fifty thousand years.
compare: The angels and Gabriel ascend to Him in a day whose extent is fifty thousand years.

src: Seine Leute kamen eilig zu ihm getrieben. Zuvor pflegten sie böse Taten zu begehen.
ref: And his people came to him, running towards him; and erstwhile they had been doing evil deeds.
draft: His people rushed to him urgently. They used to commit evil deeds before.
hil: His people rushed to him urgently. Previously, they used to commit evil deeds.
compare: His people rushed to him urgently. They used to commit evil deeds before.

src: Und manche von ihnen bezichtigen dich (ungerechter Verteilung) der Sadaqa. Doch würde ihnen davon etwas gegeben, wären sie zufrieden. Aber wenn ihnen davon nichts gegeben wird, so sind sie wütend.
ref: And among them is one who slanders you regarding the distribution of charity; so if they receive some of it they would be happy – and if not, thereupon they get displeased!
draft: And some of them accuse you (of unfair distribution) of Sadaqah. But if something is given to them, they are satisfied. But if nothing is given to them, then they are angry.
hil: And some of them accuse you of unfair distribution of alms. But if something is given to them, they would be satisfied. However, if nothing is given to them, they become angry.
compare: And some of them accuse you of unfair distribution of alms. But if something is given to them, they would be satisfied. However, if nothing is given to them, they become angry.

src: Und (erinnere daran), als Musa für seine Leute um Wasser bat, dann sagten WIR: "Schlage mit deinem Stock an den Felsen!" Dann entsprangen daraus zwölf Quellen, bereits kennt jede Gruppe ihre Trinkstelle. Esst und trinkt von ALLAHs Rizq und übertreibt nicht auf Erden als Verderben-Anrichtende!
ref: And when Moosa asked for water for his people, We said, “Strike this rock with your staff”; thereupon twelve springs gushed forth from it; each group recognised its drinking-place; “Eat and drink from what Allah has provided, and do not roam about the earth making turmoil in it.”
draft: And (remember) when Musa asked for water for his people, then WE said: "Strike the rock with your staff!" Then twelve springs gushed forth from it, and each group knew its drinking place. Eat and drink from Allah's sustenance and do not act corruptly on the earth as mischief-makers.
